review: CPK is on of my favorite restaurants. They have a variety of pizzas and pasta. I always order the BBQ Original Pizza, its delicious because its sweet but not too sweet. the lettuce wraps as an appetizer is also one of my favorites because it's unique. The service there was pretty good the waiter always checked on us. Overall the place was Great!! If the line of getting in isn't too long, Then i will probably go more often.

CPK is one of my go to spots for casual and yummy dining. I love to try the new items, but ultimately I  stick with what I always get, the bbq chicken chop salad and the tortilla soup. If you LOVE tortilla soup, you HAVE to try CPK's. There is a freshness to it and the little tortilla strips add a nice crunch. The soup is thick and delightful. I want to eat it just writing about it.  The only thing that is bothersome is the WAIT! Wow. This can sometimes take forever. Understandable. Heard it was one of the most busy CPK's in the world.

CPK, you are my old faithful. When I feel like splurging on lunch but don't have an appetite for any of the other restaurants at the mall, I always choose you. I'm so gracious for your excellent quality control and pleasant service. Hubby and I dined in for lunch today since we haven't been here in so long. I ordered your cranberry, chicken, walnut focaccia sandwich with artichoke and broccoli soup and hubby had your cobb salad (our go-to salad) with vinaigrette dressing. This was my first time ordering this sandwich and it was good! The only thing I didn't like about my meal was that the soup was a little bland. I would've rated you 5 stars, but unfortunately I came here with taste buds ready for your dijon chicken sandwich (I've only had this once last year and I was craving it). However, to my dismay, it was no longer on the menu and in a panic, I had to quickly decide on another sandwich. Why do good things have to go? Why?? WHY!?! :( Despite my disappointment, I will continue to come back here (but only for lunch or take out - dinner wait is ridiculous).

I'm a big fan of Hawaiian pizza.  These guy's have the advantage of having the freshest pineapple possible and it was evident.  Very gooood.  Nice location, good value and good service.  The GF really enjoyed her pizza too.  Would have given five stars if it weren't for the meth addict hanging outside our window eating scraps of food that other people left on their tables in the food court.  Really not CPK's fault, mall security should have maybe been on that a little better.  Worthwhile!

I came here with my bf on new years day for lunch. I was surprised that this place was STILL packed. I didn't think people would want to come here on new years. I used to love CPK, but I was pretty disappointed the last time I came. Food: We ordered the tomato basil pizza and the spinach artichoke dip to share. I was disappointed that we ordered so little. I was planning on ordering a bunch of appetizers, but since they keep changing the menu all of the things I was going to order were gone! The spinach artichoke dip was $10.79 and in my opinion I think they should give less (shocking coming from me) and charge less. There was a lot of dip left over after we were done with our chips AND extra pita bread. The dip is still very tasty. The pizza however, was not how I remembered. The crust was fluffy and soft. I remember their crust being thin and crispy. It wasn't really worth what we paid for. It tasted like cheesy bread with tomatos on top. Our bill came out to about $30 (tip and one drink included) which was a bit pricy for what we ordered. Service: This restaurant is always busy, so the service isn't the fastest or the greatest. Our waitress was very friendly and did the best job she could.  Overall: This location is pretty cool because of the nice view, but you can't see it unless you're sitting on one of the few tables outside. It's always busy, and the food is just okay for the price.

California Pizza Kitchen What can I say about CPK; it's easy, convenient, moderately priced... if I'm at the mall with friends this is where we usually end up eating lunch or dinner. Normal pizza restaurant. I regularly order the Sicilian, oven baked, thin crust filled with marinara sauce, Italian sausage, mozzarella cheese, fontina cheese, spicy ham, salami, parmesan cheese, and basil. Yum!  The salads are great too. If I'm in the mode I get the Chinese Chicken.  It has red cabbage, lettuce and wontons tossed with carrots, scallions, sesame seeds and cilantro in a sweet & sour dressing. Topped with chicken. Mmm...  What sucks is that the wait can be long though they do provide pagers and we normally have a couple of beers at Mai Tais while we wait! Yay...

The bf and I like CPK, but don't dine here as often as we'd like. The biggest issue we have with CPK is the wait; and this one is ALWAYS busy. The food, service, and experience are all very consistent with the time before. The food comes out quick and hot, water is refilled, and everyone is rather pleasant and nice. The lucky times we did not incur ridiculous wait-times and we got a seat, we were in and out. I swear, the service at this place is quick and on point. Love it. Another thing I really appreciate is their picky-eater-friendly variety! Pizza, pasta, salad, Mac n Cheese, red velvet, and a whole lot more. Relatively recently CPK has revamped their menu and has also added the "Small Cravings Menu," featuring smaller picking-size portions. The bf and I love this added option bc it gives us a chance to try new things without over ordering. And most of the items we've tried so far were good!  Lately we've been into sharing the full-sized BBQ chicken salad with avocado for our entrée. Sounds boring, but we always kick it up with Cholula!! Seriously, you'll never want another CPK salad once you've tried this BBQ one with Cholula. ;) Trust! Also, since we are sharing the salad, we have more room for appetizer and picking options. ;) The Tortilla Spring Rolls (appetizer) are pretty tasty. Two rolls for $9; three rolls for $11. And there are 3 different styles to choose from:  1- Mediterranean: a mix of Mediterranean-influenced flavors and ingredients including Portobello mushrooms, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, Fontina, Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses, served with a sun-dried tomato marinara.  2- Baja Chicken: stuffed with Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses, corn, black beans, chilies, red onions, cilantro, and served with homemade guacamole. (Ask for the ranchito sauce too!) 3- Thai Chicken: with bean sprouts, scallions, carrots, cilantro and Mozzarella, and a Thai peanut sauce.  *Out of the 3, the Baja is my fave. :) Of course, their famous Spinach Artichoke Dip (appetizer) is a no brainer... Sometimes we ask for pita and bread instead of chips. :) The Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla is delicious. Perfect for two to share as a mini appetizer. (Off the Small Cravings Menu) There's a lot going on in this mini quesadilla, so I feel like we are getting our $$-worth. It's got bell peppers, lime chicken, a couple cheeses, a dash of chipotle sauce, black beans, cilantro, and more. Served with their addicting homemade ranchito sauce :) Yummy.  The only thing I tried that I wasn't too fond of was the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese, which is also off the Small Cravings Menu. I love Mac n Cheese, but I am sadly not a fan of this "Crispy" one. They are like mini Mac n Cheese patties, breaded, and deep fried.. Sounds great, but I can't put my finger on why I didn't love 'em. It was a little dry, but I think it was that I didn't like the seasoning in the breading.. IDK. Either way, I wouldn't order it again. (Totally unlike their regular Mac n Cheese bc their regular one--off the kid's menu--is fantastic!) Anyway, I'm a fan of CPK, especially this one in particular. The service and consistency will keep me (and the bf) coming back for more.  Yelp 365 - #179/365

My favorite location is this one out of the three (Pearlridge & Waikiki are the other two). Their portions are a lot larger, the service a lot faster, waitresses way more friendlier - even when swamped, and there's parking that I do not need to pay for. Lol. It's a CPK, so they're menu is the same, however I find that this particular location is a lot more fresh than the other two. So take your pick.
Bread was cold and unappetizing, had to ask for the bread and the cream for the Italian soda. Food was good though. Waiter was kinda not there.

It's a chain!  It's a CPK!  It's... it's... awesome!  Yes, CPK can be 5-stars for many, many reasons.  First, they are always evolving their menu which is something I really appreciate.  I mean, for a huge corporate chain to constantly be adding and removing items means they have to be listening to their consumers.  That's a big plus! I'm always a little saddened when personal favorites go away (Miso Shrimp Salad... whyyyyyy???) but I can count on something new and exciting to fill its spot.  CPK always has friendly staff, either because all staff are just trained to love me or the more realistic explanation is that the staff are really, really awesome. This isn't fine dining, this is CPK and what you get is good quality food, good prices, great service and a great time all around.  This is what restaurant dining should be, especially with a place as busy as CPK it is a pleasant surprise to always be treated like you're welcome there.

I got hungry at the mall...and I thought I was pretty screwed since I'm on this special eating plan where it's basically vegan, no oil.  I sat down, and asked for a vegan, no oil dish and they said basically they didn't have anything...and suggested that I'd have salad with no dressing. So I did....and I added avocados. I think they used oil when making the walnuts and pears in the salad...but they said there was no oil...so I just believed them... Thanks CPK for working with such an awkward request. I'll be sure to return when I'm able to eat food-food again.  Yelp 365 Challenge #197/365

CPK is one of my favorite spots in Honolulu!  It's a popular place, so there usually is a wait.  However, the line moves remarkably fast and it's so worth it!  Usually, you can just walk in and sit in the bar area.  I love to sit at the bar and just talk-story with my honey and/or friends.  The service is excellent, the atmosphere is nice and the food is AMAZING! Our favorite is the Habenero Carnitas pizza.  We order a side of ranch dressing and mix the habenero sauce in with it.  This creates a smooth, spicy flavor that won't burn your mouth off (haberno sauce alone is VERY HOT).  I usually have a glass of Markham Napa Valley cabernet which compliments the food nicely.

You can never go wrong with CPK.  They got a variety of pizzas, pastas, and appetizers for anyone on a budget.  If you're looking for an adventure for your palate, their new Habanero Carnitas pizza will serve you right.  The marriage of the sweet spicy habanero sauce, pulled pork and cheese will bring out the flavors and heat in your mouth.  Just be careful because the sauce can kick in a little late if you put too much at one time since it starts off sweet.   On a busy night, the wait can range from 15-30 minutes. To remedy the wait, you can lounge around the ho'okipa terrace and probably enjoy a drink or two at mai tais.  Quick tip, if you are in a big appetite and craving pasta, they do offer an extra serving of pasta and sauce for free!

I haven't been to CPK in a while, but while I've been away it looks as though new items have been added to their menu.  Now my favorite is the Thai crunch salad.  If you love peanuts and edamame like I do, then you'll love this salad - especially if they don't drown it in dressing. The salad has the crunchy rice sticks atop a slaw of veggies, mixed into it are peanuts, won bok, green onions, edamame, and.....yikes I'm making myself hungry!  But the dressing is made out of some kind of peanut dressing that's really light if they don't over dress the salad...

I want to eat it just writing about it.  The only thing that is bothersome is the WAIT! Wow. This can sometimes take forever. Understandable. Heard it was one of the most busy CPK's in the world.

CPK is on of my favorite restaurants. They have a variety of pizzas and pasta. I always order the BBQ Original Pizza, its delicious because its sweet but not too sweet. the lettuce wraps as an appetizer is also one of my favorites because it's unique. The service there was pretty good the waiter always checked on us. Overall the place was Great!! If the line of getting in isn't too long, Then i will probably go more often.

I ate here 2 days in a row. First night I had the traditional mac n' cheese for about 11 dollars. It was very well portioned and delicious, really creamy though so I didn't finish it all. Second night I had fettucine alfredo with chicken for about 15 dollars. I finished it all, delicious. You have to ask for bread now days, I didn't realize this. Service refills drinks promptly and removes finished plates but without bothering you so you can definitely carry on a conversation. If you sit on the tables and not booths, it's kind of close to other tables but all in all it's clean, reasonably priced and my favorite CPK to go to. My wait time for dinner was on average about 30 minutes.

CPK is one of my favorite restaurants!  I love the food at an affordable price.  One of my favorite serves is Jodie and I need to give her an shout out because she does her job very well! Pros - Pricing is affordable, Food taste great, They flip tables quick!  I like the lighting and positions of TV's as well.  Some people will disagree with the dim lighting though. Cons - They got rid of some of my favorite dishes!!  The Carne Asada Pizza and Mushroom Ravioli need to come back ASAP!!  This place can get really busy, especially on the weekends!  Wait time usually an hour on a busy Friday or Saturday night. Will I come back to this restaurant at this location?  Heck Ya!! Will I recommend it to anyone that's never tried it?  Heck Ya!!

My Girlfriend and I love to eat here really good food.  Service can always improve.  They are always polite just sometimes the wait takes forver.  I dont blame the server or the cook its just the situation of a busy restraunt.  The food is worth the wait.
all i can drool over is avocado club rolls, spinach and artichoke dip, cobb salad with beets, and garlic chicken pizza on honey wheat...

215/365 First time coming to this location on a tuesday night, a bit before 7 and it wasnt crowded at all.  Maybe because it was a stormy and rainy night so that "scared" people away to stay home or maybe because it was just a tuesday?  Idk but every time I pass by this location during prime lunch or dinner times, it is ALWAYS packed with people waiting outside.   For my visit, I was with a group of 5 and we were seated right away, however, we were seated in the back near the bathrooms so of course those spots dont really get waitress time :-P.  I ordered their roasted veggie sandwich which comes with a choice of a cup of soup, a side caesar salad, or their slaw.  I chose the artichoke and broccoli soup.  The sandwich was $12 something.  The food came out in a reasonable time.  My sandwich was really tasty and had grilled portobello mushrooms, red and yellow bell peppers, Fontina and Mozzarella, field greens, tomatoes and homemade sun-dried tomato aioli.  You also choose what type of bread you want it on, either herb onion or herb cheese focacci.  The soup was pretty good too and had nice small chunks of artichoke.  For dessert we shared their delicious butter cake.  Our waitress was also nice when my friend asked to change her dish because her noodles were still kind of "hard."  Overall, always delicious.

all i can drool over is avocado club rolls, spinach and artichoke dip, cobb salad with beets, and garlic chicken pizza on honey wheat...
I love the salads, pasta, pizza, drinks, desserts, appetizers, and sandwiches. I don't like the long wait for a table. California pizza kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants.

The food is outstanding.  The service has changed over the years and truly depends on who you get.  I personally feel the waiters /waitresses are overloaded with the amount of tables that they have to cover per person.   We usually start with the spinach/artichoke dip. Ask for the bread and butter.  I usually get the chicken pesto pizza.  The wife vacillates between pastas and sandwiches, all are good. She sampled the small cravings mac and cheese and although we thought it would be perfect for the kids, it actually was a good spin on an old favorite.  (Deep fried goodness) The atmosphere is kid friendly and very accommodating of any amount in your party from 2 -12. For the boys we usually order a mini pizza or a pasta from the kid's menu.   The manager usually stops by to make sure all is well, I like this as it shows attention to all aspects of your meal being taken care of.  This is one of my favorite restaurants and locations.  The only thing missing is the over-worked staff.  I remember coming here 10 years ago, and they would circle your table.  Now, it's a rarity to find your waiter/waitress to fill your tea or water.  Not their fault, I guess it's a cost-saving feature from upper management.  They all look like they work hard.

I love the salads, pasta, pizza, drinks, desserts, appetizers, and sandwiches. I don't like the long wait for a table. California pizza kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants.

Kung Pau chicken, mango ice tea, and bread and butter always hits the spot. The service kinda drops when it is really busy on weekends for lunch. They don't seem to pay attention as often because of the rush. I try to go during the weekdays. Faster to get a table on weekdays.

CPK is awesome.  My favorite food there is the artichoke dip and chips and guacamole sauce.  i wouldn't really care for anything else but that appetizer.  I could eat just that the whole day.  Everything else is good like their pizzas and pastas but I really like the chips and dip.  The bread is good too.  The prices are decent.  The staff and customer service is good.  The location over here is always poppin' because it is located in the Ho'okipa Terrace of Ala Moana Center right next to other beast restaurants like Mai Tai Bar, Bubba Gumps, and others up there by Island Burger side.  So you know there is already high traffic around the area.  One time I came here with the whole crew like 10 plus of us and had to wait for a while but the food and service was good.  They were able to get us a nice long set of tables and just mash them up together.  I like it when they do those scratch and peel campaigns.  It's always nice to get discounts at places that you love to eat.  I would say that it is pretty worth it.  It's a good place to dine in for just about any casual kind of occasion.  The size and space of the restaurant is decent and I think they don't really take any reservations.  You'll have to call them on the day so that they can gauge on the amount of seatings and stuff.   Yelp 365 Challenge #244/365

If you sit on the tables and not booths, it's kind of close to other tables but all in all it's clean, reasonably priced and my favorite CPK to go to. My wait time for dinner was on average about 30 minutes.

Our family had not been here for awhile.  Went for dinner - wait time 20-25 minutes.  It is always busy during the dinner rush hour.  Wish that they would expand their interior to seat more people.  Their menu had new items.  We tried the shrimp dynamite (appetizer) and carnitas soft tacos.  We also ordered their BBQ pizza, garlic Parmesan cream pasta, another pizza (name escapes me).  Everything was delicious including their tacos - homemade salsa and the spices were just right for me.  We had Jenn M. as our server.  She is EXCELLENT!!! Very attentive and Super Good Attitude.  She re-filled our drinks without asking, cleared our plates in an efficient matter so we had room for our entrees, and checked on us at the appropriate times.  When we come back in the future we will definitely ask that she be our server again!  Excellent service and overall our experience was great - tasty foods too :)

i HEART California Pizza Kitchen. I think this may be my favorite place to eat....I never leave regretting my decision and you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  My favorite thing about CPK is their consistency...whether you eat it at Ala Moana or Kahala, Hawaii or California, it's ALWAYS good.  How is that possible?  I don't know, but it is. Service is usually pretty good unless you unfortunately are being served by a server who is PMSing and having a bad day but hey, that's rare and even in that case the food still makes up for it. I think the most awesome thing about CPK is their adventure guarantee.  You know how everyone ALWAYS orders the same thing because trying something new could possible result in an order you don't enjoy and then you leave bummed that you spent money on food you didn't enjoy and you're still hungry.  Well fret not because at CPK, they encourage you to order something you've never tried and if you get it and decide that it sucks...send it back and replace it for something you know you'll love!  Don't be a douche though and eat everything and then say you don't like it...that's bad karma and you'll probably get diarrhea for taking advantage of such a wonderful idea. My Tip:  free refills on soft drinks...my favorite is their flavored iced tea.  My bf and I usually order one and share.  Why would I pay for two when I can pay for one with unlimited refills?  Um, genius right?

Excellent Pizza (had the classic Hawaiian) and the shrimp salad was remarkable as well. Nice ambience, service, location, and decor. We sat at the counter for a fun view of the huge pizza oven . Great to end a day of shopping.

Today I'd like to give a shout out and recognize a dear friend that only appears or stops by once a year.  Although the visit is somewhat brief, I am always excited when its Fall because I know I will soon be reunited.  And so today I'd like to tell you all about my sweet friend, the Seasonal Pumpkin Cheesecake. As most would know, pumpkin flavors or pumpkin related foods are most popular during the fall period of every year...i.e.: pumpkin latte, pumpkin pie, and of course pumpkin cheesecake.  Although cheesecake itself is traditionally sweet, I truly enjoyed my portion of the pumpkin cheesecake today because I felt it was a not too sweet overall.  At times, if a dessert or cheesecake is overly sweet I tend not to finish it entirely (this has happened at the Cheesecake Factory).  The pumpkin cheesecake is a decent portion/size that you can choose to share or keep all to yourself and is accompanied by a generous portion of whip cream as well.  The pumpkin flavor is blended well with a hint of spice, and when combined with the whip cream makes for a wonderful end to a meal. Bottom Line:  Treat yourself (and others hopefully) to a slice of Pumpkin Cheesecake.

My favorite location is this one out of the three (Pearlridge & Waikiki are the other two). Their portions are a lot larger, the service a lot faster, waitresses way more friendlier - even when swamped, and there's parking that I do not need to pay for. Lol. It's a CPK, so they're menu is the same, however I find that this particular location is a lot more fresh than the other two. So take your pick.

CPK is one of my favorite restaurants!  I love the food at an affordable price.  One of my favorite serves is Jodie and I need to give her an shout out because she does her job very well! Pros - Pricing is affordable, Food taste great, They flip tables quick!  I like the lighting and positions of TV's as well.  Some people will disagree with the dim lighting though. Cons - They got rid of some of my favorite dishes!!  The Carne Asada Pizza and Mushroom Ravioli need to come back ASAP!!  This place can get really busy, especially on the weekends!  Wait time usually an hour on a busy Friday or Saturday night. Will I come back to this restaurant at this location?  Heck Ya!! Will I recommend it to anyone that's never tried it?  Heck Ya!!

I've dined here a dozen times since I discovered the Thai Crunch salad a few years ago. Aside from the beautiful ocean view, I prefer to patronize the Pearlridge or Waikiki locations, because of the level of service.  The food is amazing! I have never had their pizza, except from the freezer section at Foodland, lol... but I am totally stuck on the Thai Crunch salad and hummus! I can't even try anything new that isn't a small appetizer! Oh well, guess that's just how it is for me. No surprises there.  The service, however, at this location lends itself more toward mediocrity than excellence. While friendly enough, staff are not terribly proactive... Often   ignoring mild and quiet customers, favoring the ones who are more vocal. Since I tend to be quieter, my needs are often overlooked here. Unfortunately I remember that feeling more than the positive experiences.  So, it's three stars... the food would earn 5, but service here brings the quality of the experience waaaaay down for me.

Long before I was a yelper, CPK was my very favorite restaurant in the whole entire world. This was when I was in the 12th grade, a Senior in high school and thought to myself "How can anything else taste better than this?!" I remember trying to get a job as a hostess, having a group interview and not getting called back. Sure CPK didn't think I was that awesome, but hopefully since then, I've proven them wrong on some level.  As my world view has evolved since the 12th grade, but CPK still remains a solid choice when hitting the mall. It's a place everyone in the family feels comfortable and you can get a damn good salad that eats like a meal. I like sharing a full salad and pizza with my boyfriend, and we usually leave with a full belly. They still offer free bread but you have to make sure to ask for it. This particular location is very busy so during peak hours you can expect to wait a good 30-60 minutes for a table depending on the size of your party. If you've only got two in your party, see if you can grab a seat at the bar as there's less of a wait. If you're ordering take-out you'll still have quite a wait ahead of you so plan wisely and call well before you plan to pick-up.  Yelp 365 Challenge: #226/365 (The World View)

CPK is always pretty steady. Service was pretty slow here though. I had the Thai crunch salad- very good. I also tried their new chips & an avocado/corn dip. The waiter said it was spicy, but it wasn't at all. It was still good, just not what I expected.

I used to love California Pizza Kitchen and it was my favorite restaurant back in the day.  Now CPK is just  okay to me, a place I would go to eat if I couldn't decide where else to eat.  CPK is always a safe choice. I most recently met with one of my old supervisors.  I had the tomato basil spaghettini.  It was ok, could probably have used more tomato. I also had a slice of my supervisor's pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage pizza.  It was good, but there are other places that make better pizza.  We also split the chocolate souffle cake with ice cream.  It was yummy, especially since I was craving something chocolatey.   My all-time favorite go-to dishes are the spinach artichoke dip, the sun dried tomato fusili, grilled vegetable sandwich, and the vegetable pizza. Service was great, the host was nice and so was our server.  CPK at Ala Moana is always busy, but it's a good choice if you don't know where else to eat.

By far the WORST food I've had since I've been back to Hawaii.  You can definitely have better food and drinks else where.   My friend and I went in to get a drink and few things to nibble on, we had the artichoke dip and couple of things on that "Small Cravings" menu.  DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING OFF THAT MENU.  ALL the small cravings dishes were absolutely horrible, especially that taco.  Also, the "Crispy Mac & Cheese" atrocious, I thought it'd be interesting but when I tasted the damn thing I just had to say WTF is this shit?!?!  For the life of me I can't figure out why anyone would approve such horrible things to be made at that restaurant. Drinks were REALLY BAD.  I had the Mojito, which was by far THE WORST mojito I've had in my life.  My friend had Paloma, it was so bad she didn't even bother to finish it or send it back.    Also, I couldn't help but notice that the prices were outrageous too.  Do yourself a favor, if you want pizza go to Amina Pizzeria.  For the price of CPK's personal pan you can get a large pizza that is friggin awesome~!!!  If you want pasta, salad or soup goto La Cucina Ristorante Italiana, so much better for slightly better (or on par) price. Will not go back to CPK.

Will not go back to CPK.

I've been to CPK a number of times.  Every time I eat there, the quality of the food gets worse.  *sigh* I liked the mushroom ravioli..  I am hesitant to go there because of the long wait, the prices for the quality, and the close seating arrangements.  The menu also changes frequently. Despite above, it's one of the better places to eat at Ala Moana Shopping Center.  It's not the best, mind you, but it's not the worst either. I could babble on about every little thing, but I spelled it out in general above.  It's just average.

I could babble on about every little thing, but I spelled it out in general above.  It's just average.

Can't go wrong with CPK.  We stopped in for an early dinner on a Wed. evening and had a brief wait despite all the open tables.  The service was average, nothing special and no complaints.  We ordered an appetizer, the new grilled veggie salad, and a pizza.  The food came in a timely manner, was delicious as usual, and good sized portions.  Great comfortable casual atmosphere and perfect location to walk off your meal with some after dinner shopping.

Can't go wrong with CPK.  We stopped in for an early dinner on a Wed. evening and had a brief wait despite all the open tables.  The service was average, nothing special and no complaints.  We ordered an appetizer, the new grilled veggie salad, and a pizza.  The food came in a timely manner, was delicious as usual, and good sized portions.  Great comfortable casual atmosphere and perfect location to walk off your meal with some after dinner shopping.

We had a nice relaxing early dinner on Saturday night before our flight out of Honolulu. We were there at 5pm so no wait. When we left at 6:30, it was packed.  We ordered Cedar plank salmon with corn - new item on menu. Fish well cooked but not very flavourful. Fish taco with avocado - OK taste, but the fish was a bit dry. Maui Fish Taco was a bit better. Kid's meal - pepperoni pizza - good Kid's meal - mac and cheese with edamame beans - very good as it introduces some veggies with the kid's meal. Strawberry shortcake - Special menu item. Not enough strawberries and sauce. Shortcake was a bit dry.  The food was OK. Prices were reasonable, especially for the kid's meal which included their drinks. Environment was nice. Lots of options to sit by the bar and watch sports, or sit by the windows to get an ocean view. We sat with a courtyard view, which was fine too.

Lots of options to sit by the bar and watch sports, or sit by the windows to get an ocean view. We sat with a courtyard view, which was fine too.

It isn't what it used to be--or my taste buds have evolved since I was a 16-year-old, Ala Moana-loitering, processed food-loving CPK regular.  I'm just not that into mass-produced pizza and pasta anymore, especially at the rate of the price inflation.  The appetizers aren't bad, though; order the dynamite shrimp and spinach artichoke dip if you happen to find yourself here for a family reunion. Btw, the Peking duck pizza is back after a four- or five-year hiatus.  But it's not the same.  Trust me.

CPK, you are my old faithful. When I feel like splurging on lunch but don't have an appetite for any of the other restaurants at the mall, I always choose you. I'm so gracious for your excellent quality control and pleasant service. Hubby and I dined in for lunch today since we haven't been here in so long. I ordered your cranberry, chicken, walnut focaccia sandwich with artichoke and broccoli soup and hubby had your cobb salad (our go-to salad) with vinaigrette dressing. This was my first time ordering this sandwich and it was good! The only thing I didn't like about my meal was that the soup was a little bland. I would've rated you 5 stars, but unfortunately I came here with taste buds ready for your dijon chicken sandwich (I've only had this once last year and I was craving it). However, to my dismay, it was no longer on the menu and in a panic, I had to quickly decide on another sandwich. Why do good things have to go? Why?? WHY!?! :( Despite my disappointment, I will continue to come back here (but only for lunch or take out - dinner wait is ridiculous).
Bread was cold and unappetizing, had to ask for the bread and the cream for the Italian soda. Food was good though. Waiter was kinda not there.

Our family had not been here for awhile.  Went for dinner - wait time 20-25 minutes.  It is always busy during the dinner rush hour.  Wish that they would expand their interior to seat more people.  Their menu had new items.  We tried the shrimp dynamite (appetizer) and carnitas soft tacos.  We also ordered their BBQ pizza, garlic Parmesan cream pasta, another pizza (name escapes me).  Everything was delicious including their tacos - homemade salsa and the spices were just right for me.  We had Jenn M. as our server.  She is EXCELLENT!!! Very attentive and Super Good Attitude.  She re-filled our drinks without asking, cleared our plates in an efficient matter so we had room for our entrees, and checked on us at the appropriate times.  When we come back in the future we will definitely ask that she be our server again!  Excellent service and overall our experience was great - tasty foods too :)

I have never had their pizza, except from the freezer section at Foodland, lol... but I am totally stuck on the Thai Crunch salad and hummus! I can't even try anything new that isn't a small appetizer! Oh well, guess that's just how it is for me. No surprises there.  The service, however, at this location lends itself more toward mediocrity than excellence. While friendly enough, staff are not terribly proactive... Often   ignoring mild and quiet customers, favoring the ones who are more vocal. Since I tend to be quieter, my needs are often overlooked here. Unfortunately I remember that feeling more than the positive experiences.  So, it's three stars... the food would earn 5, but service here brings the quality of the experience waaaaay down for me.

I don't know why I've never tried before here. Luckily, on our way to the airport with only 1 and 1/2 hours left to kill, Macaroni Grill made us mad and we walked out and found this place right across the way. We were seated immediately, our drinks were brought to the table, the menus and specials explained. Very friendly and efficient wait staff. We were checked on twice in 5 minutes and our orders were taken and brought to us in about 15 minutes.  My boys had the 4 cheese ravioli and the the chicken milanese and I had the chicken piccata. All I can say is the plates were GIGANTIC!! I couldn't even finish half of my food. Luckily my teenage sons were able to help me. Also the food was delicious. This is my new favorite restaurant to visit on Oahu when we want to have a casual sit down family meal. The prices were very reasonable also.  And we made it to the airport with plenty of time to spare. I think from start to finish it was under 45 minutes and we were on our way.

Ok... I have to say how extremely disappointed and upset I am that all of my favorites are no longer on the menu! WHYYYYY?!?!?! This just means I need to find new favorites. Safe to say that I like majority of the dishes they serve. I'm a huge CPK fan but the only reason this review is not getting 5 stars is because I can't believe that so many of the popular items have been taken off the menu. To the CPK management and higher ups: Here is a list of my favorites that you should definitely bring back onto your menu. - Norwegian Atlantic Salmon - Miso Shrimp Salad -Tomato Sun-dried Fusilli  Please and thank you!

I usually order the cranberry walnut chicken salad sandwich!!! Definitely a dish I recommend! I ordered that as usual and got the strawberry mojito... It was ok... More on the fruity side.... So far the pearl city location is the best! Even though it gets pretty busy.... The food comes out fast and always at the right temperature!!

I usually order the cranberry walnut chicken salad sandwich!!! Definitely a dish I recommend! I ordered that as usual and got the strawberry mojito... It was ok... More on the fruity side.... So far the pearl city location is the best! Even though it gets pretty busy.... The food comes out fast and always at the right temperature!!
Don't like coming to this CPK. Just because it's a really long wait... You can catch yourself waiting for a good hour on weekends, even if it's just 2 people
Don't like coming to this CPK. Just because it's a really long wait... You can catch yourself waiting for a good hour on weekends, even if it's just 2 people

In my book CPK is eh rather than ahhhhh!  While I give them credit for their creative pizzas-the only dish which I love here is the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine.  When I met Cassie T. for lunch here a while ago, I was left feeling a bit indifferent to this particular location.  There is a bit of a lunch crowd, so if you can-get there early.  Our server was okay.  I was impressed with the variety in lunch options and opted for the dual soup bowl.  It was a mixture of tortilla soup and creamed artichoke soup.  Passable, but nothing which left me dying to go back.  Yes, even with their "Don't Open It" thank you card (bring it back on your next visit and the manager opens it to see what you've won)-I'm opting to pass on a second visit any time soon.

Went there tonight cause we had one of those scratch off coupons, was only 10% so bummers, anyway I got two things from the supplemental appetizer menu, the korean tacos and the chips and guacamole.  Korean tacos was a good deal and pretty tasty but the guacamole was mostly corn with a small amount of guacamole to hold the corn together, very dissapointing. My main course was really good, the jumbalaya was full of shrimp, sausage and crawfish and very peppery. I used to really look forward to eating at CPK but over time I think their standards have fallen and with time its no longer a novel place to eat. But they were pioneers in their time and props for that.

But they were pioneers in their time and props for that.

I've eaten here many times but this review is based on my current outing to CPK last month.  We had a big girl's night there and we had the best waiter!! I really wish I hadn't forgetten his name but he is totally the best waiter I've ever had.  He was patient, accomodating, helpful, and friendly.  I cannot express how he made our night much more fun and stress-free.  We all know the food is usually great.  I love my orginal chop salad and I wished they would bring back the mushroom raviolli.  That was pretty delicious.  Anyway, great service and great food.  Will definitely go back again.

Order off the small cravings menu to sample several dishes at once. My personal favorite is the Mediterranean plate and Korean BBQ tacos - okay so they don't sound like they pair well togetther but whatever.  Personally I have a love-hate relationship with this restaurant because the menu will evolve over time. The good news is that new dishes make their way to the menu. The bad news is that my favorites get booted off. The good+bad news (yep, combo time) is the creation of the butter cake which I'm positive is a manifestation of Paula Deen. It makes you smile while eating it and curse it in memory while at the gym - standard Paula food.

Came here last night with some friends to catchup and noticed that there were changes with CPK. For one, their menu is condensed. They eliminated a lot off the menu. I noticed that they took off their Greek pizza and their Thai pasta and some of their pizza turned into thin crust. (I can't complain about thin crust, I actually prefer that)  I do like CPK for being family style friendly. We ordered the BBQ Chicken salad and added avocado to it - it was delicious.  we had the jamaican jerk chicken pizza - quite spicy. It was okay I felt that there were not enough garnishing on our pizza. more crust than anything.  we had alredo fettucine pasta which I can't judge because I didn't eat it. What I normally would order and is my fave on the menu (and is still offered) is: +avocado egg rolls. it melts in your mouth and they offer two sauces for dipping. +Sicilian pizza. - its for meat lovers. I love meat. It has italian sausage, spicy ham, salami and its usually loaded. (can you tell I like my food spicy?)  Their Mojito is delicious here. no particular favorite flavor, they are all good.  The service is always good here though. I have never had a bad experience which is why I always do return.

Let me tell you, I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE CPK! But lately, it seems they are plotting against me and taking all my favorite dishes off the menu. We went there for dinner last night and knew exactly what we wanted to order as soon as the waiter got to our table (yes, we are frequent visitors of CPK). We ordered the usual spinach artichoke dip (can't go to CPK and not order this), boyfriend got the garlic cream fettucine with chicken and mushrooms, and unfortunately, I wasn't able to find my favorite pizza on the menu. So I opted for another pizza was which was spinach and artichoke pizza -- not too sure what the exact name was but it was something like that. The pizza I ordered was not what I wanted when I got here. I had two slices, and couldn't eat anymore. It was too bland for my taste. I asked for light cheese, it came with lots and lots of cheese. I was a little disappointed so I had to ask my waiter about where my favorite pizza went. So I found out that CPK recently got a new owner, and had their menu changed. You'll see on your next CPK visit, the menu looks and feels different.  First, my favorite mushroom ravioli was taken off the menu about a year or two ago.. and now my chicken pesto pizza :(   PLEASE add those dishes back on your menu!!

Went to CPK Ala Moana a few months ago and decided to try the fresh grilled peach salad which turned out to be canned, warmed peach salad.  Disappointing to say the least.  Then a couple of weeks ago I took a friend to Kahala Mall CPK and decided to order my FAVE Field Greens salad and was shocked to find that they had changed the recipe!!!  It was AWFUL, overly dressed with a super sour balsamic dressing.  CPK - are you using CHEAPER ingredients because of the economy????  You are LOSING me as a customer!  This salad used to be SO perfect,  needed nothing more than  a hungry patron.  It used to be perfectly seasoned and dressed.  It was a huge disappointment.

Is it me or am I imaging things when CPK doesn't excite me? I love to sit on the counter and watch all the action from the waitress,cooks and the food expeditor....... I'm getting excited.. We get seated at the counter and get greeted right away and server takes our drink order. ( Draft Beer oh yes! It's going up hill now!) Food: Classic Caesar: Not bad..Doesn't do anything for me. (Stuck in Neutral) Avocado Club Egg Rolls: I enjoyed the appetizer very much (Chugging Along Upwards) Peking Duck Pizza: I'm excited again! I was different from the original one. The condiments was separate along with the hoisin sauce. Which I liked because you could just drizzle the mount you wanted. You got me CPK! I love your service and I enjoy your pizza! I'm excited again!

We get seated at the counter and get greeted right away and server takes our drink order. ( Draft Beer oh yes! It's going up hill now!) Food: Classic Caesar: Not bad..Doesn't do anything for me. (Stuck in Neutral) Avocado Club Egg Rolls: I enjoyed the appetizer very much (Chugging Along Upwards) Peking Duck Pizza: I'm excited again! I was different from the original one. The condiments was separate along with the hoisin sauce. Which I liked because you could just drizzle the mount you wanted. You got me CPK! I love your service and I enjoy your pizza! I'm excited again!

I can never say no to pizza, and this place is no exception. I could probably go on for days about it, actually. Anyway, I've been making a lot of visits to this particular CPK because it's close to work, and it's in town, which is always convenient. The service can be hit or miss, though there is one server in particular who was incredible. She had short gray hair, a huge smile, and was very attentive without being "too" attentive. She placed my order wrong, apologized, and was nice enough to let me keep the extra pizza free of charge. You don't see that kind of thing very often in a restaurant these days. Most place will trash the whole thing or leave it for the workers to eat later on. I was very pleased with not only my pizza, but the whole dining experience that night. There were a few other occasions where the service was more or less like that of a Pizza Hut, and the whole reason I go out to eat at places like CPK is for the whole experience to begin with. I like energy, confidence, and knowledge as much as I like pizza. That is all.

They burnt half of my Peking pizza they offered to redo once they saw my face but I thought why did you serve it to me in the first place.  There also was only a few morsels of actual duck meat.  We had McDonalds drive thru on the way home.  Won't be back.

Seriously you can't go wrong eating here! Of course there is always an hour+ wait time on the weekends but it really is worth it! They have a huge selection of really good pizzas. I haven't tried one I didn't like so far. The service is top notch even though the place is always packed. They always refill my drink before I take the last sip of my current drink.  My favorites: -BBQ chicken pizza -Waldorf salad -spinach artichoke dip -chicken club spring rolls I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Located on the top deck of the Ala Moana Center you will find a bevy of restaurants, but our go-to is CPK.  Arrive early for lunch or dinner as this place fills up and generally has a waiting list. At least you can saunter out and watch the boats at the Waikiki Yacht Club, or try to locate the runners at Ala Moana Beach Park while waiting for your pager to light up. The food is great, sandwiches, salads, and of course pizza, but I am writing this review about their mango tea! I usually order my iced tea plain and then add my own sweetener. A friend frequently orders  the mango tea and I finally decided to try it. DELICIOUS AND REFRESHING!!!  If you are like me and do not usually order the fancy teas, take a bold leap of faith and try the mango tea!!!

My Girlfriend and I love to eat here really good food.  Service can always improve.  They are always polite just sometimes the wait takes forver.  I dont blame the server or the cook its just the situation of a busy restraunt.  The food is worth the wait.

Long before I was a yelper, CPK was my very favorite restaurant in the whole entire world. This was when I was in the 12th grade, a Senior in high school and thought to myself "How can anything else taste better than this?!" I remember trying to get a job as a hostess, having a group interview and not getting called back. Sure CPK didn't think I was that awesome, but hopefully since then, I've proven them wrong on some level.  As my world view has evolved since the 12th grade, but CPK still remains a solid choice when hitting the mall. It's a place everyone in the family feels comfortable and you can get a damn good salad that eats like a meal. I like sharing a full salad and pizza with my boyfriend, and we usually leave with a full belly. They still offer free bread but you have to make sure to ask for it. This particular location is very busy so during peak hours you can expect to wait a good 30-60 minutes for a table depending on the size of your party. If you've only got two in your party, see if you can grab a seat at the bar as there's less of a wait. If you're ordering take-out you'll still have quite a wait ahead of you so plan wisely and call well before you plan to pick-up.  Yelp 365 Challenge: #226/365 (The World View)

I don't know why I've never tried before here. Luckily, on our way to the airport with only 1 and 1/2 hours left to kill, Macaroni Grill made us mad and we walked out and found this place right across the way. We were seated immediately, our drinks were brought to the table, the menus and specials explained. Very friendly and efficient wait staff. We were checked on twice in 5 minutes and our orders were taken and brought to us in about 15 minutes.  My boys had the 4 cheese ravioli and the the chicken milanese and I had the chicken piccata. All I can say is the plates were GIGANTIC!! I couldn't even finish half of my food. Luckily my teenage sons were able to help me. Also the food was delicious. This is my new favorite restaurant to visit on Oahu when we want to have a casual sit down family meal. The prices were very reasonable also.  And we made it to the airport with plenty of time to spare. I think from start to finish it was under 45 minutes and we were on our way.

Order off the small cravings menu to sample several dishes at once. My personal favorite is the Mediterranean plate and Korean BBQ tacos - okay so they don't sound like they pair well togetther but whatever.  Personally I have a love-hate relationship with this restaurant because the menu will evolve over time. The good news is that new dishes make their way to the menu. The bad news is that my favorites get booted off. The good+bad news (yep, combo time) is the creation of the butter cake which I'm positive is a manifestation of Paula Deen. It makes you smile while eating it and curse it in memory while at the gym - standard Paula food.

I've eaten here many times but this review is based on my current outing to CPK last month.  We had a big girl's night there and we had the best waiter!! I really wish I hadn't forgetten his name but he is totally the best waiter I've ever had.  He was patient, accomodating, helpful, and friendly.  I cannot express how he made our night much more fun and stress-free.  We all know the food is usually great.  I love my orginal chop salad and I wished they would bring back the mushroom raviolli.  That was pretty delicious.  Anyway, great service and great food.  Will definitely go back again.
Fricken joke of a place. Shoot me please.. Workers were nice so 2 stars.

CPK has always been that go-to restaurant with consistent service. When you're in Alamoana and you want to treat yourself to something special... go to CPK. The wait can be long in lunch and dinner rush hour (12pm and 6:30pm-8:30pm) but they have some great dishes you can try. First off, it's Alamoana. Parking shouldn't even be an issue unless it's the holiday shopping season. Prices are reasonable. I've never seen an item menu exceed $18 (and it's pretty damn good). You can get some pretty filling stuff for under $9.. such as the infamous Spinach Artichoke Dip. Delicious and calorie filling by the way :0  I love their pasta dishes. Lemon caper picatta chicken, fetticuine alfredo... mmm. As for their salads? How can you not love the Thai Crunch? I'm just drooling thinking about it. The desserts are lovely! The Butter Cake with a whipped cream topping blends into one heavenly experience. Their pizzas can be a hit or miss on my experience but I usually go with the popular BBQ chicken. It's a little small but it's something you can try. Once you step in, the decor just uplifts you. The ocean view, the balanced interior design, and one of the most cleanest bathrooms I've ever visited! Great place. All the time. From Alamoana, Waikiki, and Hawaii Kai--CPK rarely disappointed me from great service to great food.

Wow, today's visit with the sis was awesome.  Got there just in time to not have to wait.  They were on it today from the moment we were greeted at the door to the time we left.  Our server was Sean today and he was awesome.  We started off with that Spinach Artichoke Dip and some strawberry lemonade.  Sean was quick and even brought us bread and butter, which I always think is funny because sometimes they bring it and sometimes they do not.  Anyway, Sean was a really nice guy, made wonderful suggestions on the peach salad with apple wood bacon to compliment the Habanero Carnitas pizza we got.  The salad was delicious, however, next time i'll ask for the cheese on the side.  The pizza was delicious!  If you do not like spicy-be warned, this baby packs some heat, but we loved it.  It had shredded pork, red onion and the sauce was cilantro pesto.  If the pizza doesn't pack enough spice, then wow yourself with the side of salsa it comes with.  Service was quick, friendly and we left with bellies satisfied.  Thank you CPK for always being the ladies choice for lunch and dinner.

Love love love CPK , the food there is always worth it in my opinion. Love to try random items there and i have yet to be disappointed with it. Great customer service whenever i go there. I usually order water to drink and i don't remember it ever being empty. They visit you frequently to see if everything is ok but yet , not too much as to bother you and your guest!

Love love love CPK , the food there is always worth it in my opinion. Love to try random items there and i have yet to be disappointed with it. Great customer service whenever i go there. I usually order water to drink and i don't remember it ever being empty. They visit you frequently to see if everything is ok but yet , not too much as to bother you and your guest!

The wait: it was 6pm (yeah, the worst time to come here) especially on a Saturday night. We set our time limit to an hour, and checked in when the hostess said it would be 35 minutes to seat us. It was about 40 minutes of waiting in the courtyard until we decided to check with the hostess on how much longer our table would be. She apologized for the extended wait time and said it would be another 10 - 15 minutes because they were really busy. We eventually got in an hour from first arriving there (that was fine since that was our cap time anyway). Menu: I always get the same thing when I come here. Thai chicken spring rolls for an appetizer & a pepperoni, mushroom, NO sausage pizza for my entree. My auntie decided to go with the shrimp scampi which was off their "healthy" section. She did not realize this even though our waiter did try to explain that that particular dish came with half pasta with shrimp & the other half zucchinis (earlier when he was suggesting items from the menu while taking our drink orders). Our waiter had an accent so you really had to try and listen to what he was saying above the high volume background noise from other tables. My cousin ordered the Peking duck pizza which is an item they previously served and recently put back on the menu.  Food: the spring rolls were delish as always. I can't get enough of that amazing peanut sauce. My pizza was good, although I made a mistake of getting extra cheese in place of sausage. I love cheese, but extra cheese on this pie is not necessary. The Peking duck pizza was very thin according to my cousin and he did not care for it much. My auntie as I assumed did not eat any of her zucchinis. I thought it was strange she ordered from the low calorie section of the menu, that entree was only 550 calories. She loved the shrimp scampi and pasta though.  At the end, our waiter asked if we needed (3) boxes, we asked for (2) and he questioned if my auntie liked her food since she only ate half her plate and did not care to pack up the rest. We explained she did not realize what she ordered, she just wanted shrimp scampi and not all those veggies. He brought it up to his manager who then came to our table and apologized that the dish was not satisfying and understood why we could have gotten confused. She took the dish off our bill!! I couldn't believe it. Now thats what you call good customer service.  I love this CPK:-)

I love going to this CPK!  The staff is always friendly and responsive to what your needs are and the food is never disappointing.  I tend to go to this location during lunch during the work week so I usually end up sitting on the counter with my friend.  I am in love with their new Roasted Vegetable salad, it's absolutely delicious!  Also, their Thai Chicken Pizza is to die for.  Usually a friend of mine and I will go and get one of each and just split it.   The food is a little pricy, but for the most part you get good portions.  I do wish that you  didn't have to ask for the bread and that they would offer it to you though, that would be nice!

Fricken joke of a place. Shoot me please.. Workers were nice so 2 stars.

Had the Cobb salad and tried the artichoke dip. Pretty good. Had to wait 30mins for a table (Saturday night). Service was pretty good (Joni? I think). Entrees showed up (4 people) pretty close together. Don't like the new uniforms and menu is a bit confusing. Unsure why the cocktails and beer section of the menu lack prices. Not a fan of that. Server was nice about it though and willing to get exact prices. If they're going to turn CPK into a more family restaurant they should take reservations. Overall not bad but not a standout except the service.

CPK is one of my all time favorites. I love that they have small portions and plenty of salad options. I have been to CPK (possibly) a hundred times. I usually get Chicken waldorf salad, BBQ chop salador roasted vegetable sandwich with cesar salad. I also like the moroccan salad, the quinoa/arugula salad and the tomato/broccolini pasta. The spinach, artichoke dip is a given. No other spinach, artichoke dip even compares.  Recently, I've tried to step out of my "usuals". I first tried the grilled chicken chimichurri  because I love the chimichurri sauce at Kit and Kitchen. BOYYYYY was I disappointed. The chicken was way too salty and the sauce was awful!!! AWFUL! The only good part was the grilled vegetables. But, it was definitely not worth the $15.60.......On another occasion, I tried the cedar plank salmon ($18.60). Wowwwww! New fave. I honestly liked the corn succotash just as much as the salmon, maybe even more. So end of story: I still love CPK, but will stay far far away from the chicken chimichurri. The online ordering process on   makes pick up super easy too!

Although the wait is long to get in, it's well worth it.  If you go during Saturday lunch hour, the wait is probably around 30 minutes.  But once you get in you get served right away.  That's one thing that CPK doesn't ever falter on...customer service.The staff is so friendly When we go there we ALWAYS order an appetizer which is the spinach/artichoke dip.  My 3 year old loves it too.  She loves dipping her chip into the dip, which makes her feel like a big girl...lol.  What's even better is when you put the dip on the fresh bread that they offer you. We almost always order a half order of the chinese chicken salad.  The half order is probably good enough for 3 people.  I used to order the BLT PIZZA, but they discontinued it.   So now I order the asparagus/spinach spaghettini with chicken...that is sooooo delish.  Mouth watering.

CPK is always pretty steady. Service was pretty slow here though. I had the Thai crunch salad- very good. I also tried their new chips & an avocado/corn dip. The waiter said it was spicy, but it wasn't at all. It was still good, just not what I expected.

31 Yelps Review Challenge 10/31 One of my top 5 restaurants ever. Yum yum yum. I try new things here all the time and I've rarely ordered anything that I truly didn't like. October is always a good time to head to CPK because that means it's pumpkin cheesecake season! This location is super busy, so I often take advantage of the online ordering and takeout.

Originally tried to go to Waikiki, but there was so much traffic, we decided to just go to the AlaMoana location.  I been here a few times before, honestly never really a big fan of it. I mean the food is okay and taste good, I just its just not really my cup of tea.  When we arrived, there was a 15-20 minute wait. No big deal. So we decided to enjoy the view of the beach while we waited for a table. Finally got called in sat more in the back. Our waiter was Cory. He was extremely nice and very on it! He was very efficient when filling our waters and answering our questions regarding the menu.  THE GRUB. We ordered Avocado Club Egg Rolls (SUPER DELISH!) and the Peking Duck Pizza (The hoisin sauce made me feel like I was eating a PHO pizza Ha-Ha).

The service at CPK is top notch and never seems to disappoint me. The waitresses and waiters here know how to treat their customers and make you feel like guest in their house. Other restaurants should consider hiring CPK employees because they know what customer service is all about.

The service at CPK is top notch and never seems to disappoint me. The waitresses and waiters here know how to treat their customers and make you feel like guest in their house. Other restaurants should consider hiring CPK employees because they know what customer service is all about.

I'm a big fan of Hawaiian pizza.  These guy's have the advantage of having the freshest pineapple possible and it was evident.  Very gooood.  Nice location, good value and good service.  The GF really enjoyed her pizza too.  Would have given five stars if it weren't for the meth addict hanging outside our window eating scraps of food that other people left on their tables in the food court.  Really not CPK's fault, mall security should have maybe been on that a little better.  Worthwhile!

Today I'd like to give a shout out and recognize a dear friend that only appears or stops by once a year.  Although the visit is somewhat brief, I am always excited when its Fall because I know I will soon be reunited.  And so today I'd like to tell you all about my sweet friend, the Seasonal Pumpkin Cheesecake. As most would know, pumpkin flavors or pumpkin related foods are most popular during the fall period of every year...i.e.: pumpkin latte, pumpkin pie, and of course pumpkin cheesecake.  Although cheesecake itself is traditionally sweet, I truly enjoyed my portion of the pumpkin cheesecake today because I felt it was a not too sweet overall.  At times, if a dessert or cheesecake is overly sweet I tend not to finish it entirely (this has happened at the Cheesecake Factory).  The pumpkin cheesecake is a decent portion/size that you can choose to share or keep all to yourself and is accompanied by a generous portion of whip cream as well.  The pumpkin flavor is blended well with a hint of spice, and when combined with the whip cream makes for a wonderful end to a meal. Bottom Line:  Treat yourself (and others hopefully) to a slice of Pumpkin Cheesecake.

Excellent Pizza (had the classic Hawaiian) and the shrimp salad was remarkable as well. Nice ambience, service, location, and decor. We sat at the counter for a fun view of the huge pizza oven . Great to end a day of shopping.

31 Yelps Review Challenge 10/31 One of my top 5 restaurants ever. Yum yum yum. I try new things here all the time and I've rarely ordered anything that I truly didn't like. October is always a good time to head to CPK because that means it's pumpkin cheesecake season! This location is super busy, so I often take advantage of the online ordering and takeout.

CPK is great no matter where it is.  It is even better when you get a free pizza for Veteran's Day.  This particular CPK was kind of crowded because it is in the Ala Moana Shopping Center; but even though the wait was stated as 50 minutes, it only took about 20 until being seated.  This 20 minutes went by fairly fast because of the easy access to drinks at the Mai Tai Bar right next door.  Once seated, the service was great and the food came out very fast.  Overall, this CPK was the best one I have ever been to.  I would definitely go back.

My brother wanted to eat here so we went in at LUNCH, saw how busy they were and figured it might be awhile for our group of 8. There was already a line just to put your name down. It was cool that they gave us a vibe thing that'll let us know when our table was ready, I asked the girl if it could reach to Neiman Marcus and she took my number just in case. They said the wait would be 45 minutes, so I figure I walk around Macy's, not even 20 minutes later the thing vibed and 5 minutes later my cell phone rang. We were immediately seated and our server came shortly thereafter. The food was delicious. The avocado springrolls my brother ordered for appetizers hit the spot. We dined on garlic alfredo with chicken, shrimp and mushrooms and it was also delicious. Our glasses were constantly topped off with our choice of beverage and the service was quick.

I got hungry at the mall...and I thought I was pretty screwed since I'm on this special eating plan where it's basically vegan, no oil.  I sat down, and asked for a vegan, no oil dish and they said basically they didn't have anything...and suggested that I'd have salad with no dressing. So I did....and I added avocados. I think they used oil when making the walnuts and pears in the salad...but they said there was no oil...so I just believed them... Thanks CPK for working with such an awkward request. I'll be sure to return when I'm able to eat food-food again.  Yelp 365 Challenge #197/365

It's a chain!  It's a CPK!  It's... it's... awesome!  Yes, CPK can be 5-stars for many, many reasons.  First, they are always evolving their menu which is something I really appreciate.  I mean, for a huge corporate chain to constantly be adding and removing items means they have to be listening to their consumers.  That's a big plus! I'm always a little saddened when personal favorites go away (Miso Shrimp Salad... whyyyyyy???) but I can count on something new and exciting to fill its spot.  CPK always has friendly staff, either because all staff are just trained to love me or the more realistic explanation is that the staff are really, really awesome. This isn't fine dining, this is CPK and what you get is good quality food, good prices, great service and a great time all around.  This is what restaurant dining should be, especially with a place as busy as CPK it is a pleasant surprise to always be treated like you're welcome there.

I used to love California Pizza Kitchen and it was my favorite restaurant back in the day.  Now CPK is just  okay to me, a place I would go to eat if I couldn't decide where else to eat.  CPK is always a safe choice. I most recently met with one of my old supervisors.  I had the tomato basil spaghettini.  It was ok, could probably have used more tomato. I also had a slice of my supervisor's pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage pizza.  It was good, but there are other places that make better pizza.  We also split the chocolate souffle cake with ice cream.  It was yummy, especially since I was craving something chocolatey.   My all-time favorite go-to dishes are the spinach artichoke dip, the sun dried tomato fusili, grilled vegetable sandwich, and the vegetable pizza. Service was great, the host was nice and so was our server.  CPK at Ala Moana is always busy, but it's a good choice if you don't know where else to eat.

Ok... I have to say how extremely disappointed and upset I am that all of my favorites are no longer on the menu! WHYYYYY?!?!?! This just means I need to find new favorites. Safe to say that I like majority of the dishes they serve. I'm a huge CPK fan but the only reason this review is not getting 5 stars is because I can't believe that so many of the popular items have been taken off the menu. To the CPK management and higher ups: Here is a list of my favorites that you should definitely bring back onto your menu. - Norwegian Atlantic Salmon - Miso Shrimp Salad -Tomato Sun-dried Fusilli  Please and thank you!

Let me tell you, I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE CPK! But lately, it seems they are plotting against me and taking all my favorite dishes off the menu. We went there for dinner last night and knew exactly what we wanted to order as soon as the waiter got to our table (yes, we are frequent visitors of CPK). We ordered the usual spinach artichoke dip (can't go to CPK and not order this), boyfriend got the garlic cream fettucine with chicken and mushrooms, and unfortunately, I wasn't able to find my favorite pizza on the menu. So I opted for another pizza was which was spinach and artichoke pizza -- not too sure what the exact name was but it was something like that. The pizza I ordered was not what I wanted when I got here. I had two slices, and couldn't eat anymore. It was too bland for my taste. I asked for light cheese, it came with lots and lots of cheese. I was a little disappointed so I had to ask my waiter about where my favorite pizza went. So I found out that CPK recently got a new owner, and had their menu changed. You'll see on your next CPK visit, the menu looks and feels different.  First, my favorite mushroom ravioli was taken off the menu about a year or two ago.. and now my chicken pesto pizza :(   PLEASE add those dishes back on your menu!!

Came here last night with some friends to catchup and noticed that there were changes with CPK. For one, their menu is condensed. They eliminated a lot off the menu. I noticed that they took off their Greek pizza and their Thai pasta and some of their pizza turned into thin crust. (I can't complain about thin crust, I actually prefer that)  I do like CPK for being family style friendly. We ordered the BBQ Chicken salad and added avocado to it - it was delicious.  we had the jamaican jerk chicken pizza - quite spicy. It was okay I felt that there were not enough garnishing on our pizza. more crust than anything.  we had alredo fettucine pasta which I can't judge because I didn't eat it. What I normally would order and is my fave on the menu (and is still offered) is: +avocado egg rolls. it melts in your mouth and they offer two sauces for dipping. +Sicilian pizza. - its for meat lovers. I love meat. It has italian sausage, spicy ham, salami and its usually loaded. (can you tell I like my food spicy?)  Their Mojito is delicious here. no particular favorite flavor, they are all good.  The service is always good here though. I have never had a bad experience which is why I always do return.

CPK has always been that go-to restaurant with consistent service. When you're in Alamoana and you want to treat yourself to something special... go to CPK. The wait can be long in lunch and dinner rush hour (12pm and 6:30pm-8:30pm) but they have some great dishes you can try. First off, it's Alamoana. Parking shouldn't even be an issue unless it's the holiday shopping season. Prices are reasonable. I've never seen an item menu exceed $18 (and it's pretty damn good). You can get some pretty filling stuff for under $9.. such as the infamous Spinach Artichoke Dip. Delicious and calorie filling by the way :0  I love their pasta dishes. Lemon caper picatta chicken, fetticuine alfredo... mmm. As for their salads? How can you not love the Thai Crunch? I'm just drooling thinking about it. The desserts are lovely! The Butter Cake with a whipped cream topping blends into one heavenly experience. Their pizzas can be a hit or miss on my experience but I usually go with the popular BBQ chicken. It's a little small but it's something you can try. Once you step in, the decor just uplifts you. The ocean view, the balanced interior design, and one of the most cleanest bathrooms I've ever visited! Great place. All the time. From Alamoana, Waikiki, and Hawaii Kai--CPK rarely disappointed me from great service to great food.

CPK is great no matter where it is.  It is even better when you get a free pizza for Veteran's Day.  This particular CPK was kind of crowded because it is in the Ala Moana Shopping Center; but even though the wait was stated as 50 minutes, it only took about 20 until being seated.  This 20 minutes went by fairly fast because of the easy access to drinks at the Mai Tai Bar right next door.  Once seated, the service was great and the food came out very fast.  Overall, this CPK was the best one I have ever been to.  I would definitely go back.

Why are CPKs ALWAYS crowded all the time?!  It must be because the food here is reliable, you'll get exactly what you order every time.  This location however is definitely one of the most crowded ones due to the mall crowd.  You could definitely wait hours here for at table during peak times.  I've never had an issue here though and the service is definitely great and friendly.   CPK menu has changed recently, excluding a lot of the items that I really loved, including the portabello mushroom ravioli!!  :(  SO SAD!  I wish they would bring that back!!

Why are CPKs ALWAYS crowded all the time?!  It must be because the food here is reliable, you'll get exactly what you order every time.  This location however is definitely one of the most crowded ones due to the mall crowd.  You could definitely wait hours here for at table during peak times.  I've never had an issue here though and the service is definitely great and friendly.   CPK menu has changed recently, excluding a lot of the items that I really loved, including the portabello mushroom ravioli!!  :(  SO SAD!  I wish they would bring that back!!

CPK is CPK pretty much anywhere you go.  Consistent and tasty, I've never had a bad experience.   For those who've never been, be sure to ask for bread, because they won't bring it to you automatically. You have to ask.

CPK is CPK pretty much anywhere you go.  Consistent and tasty, I've never had a bad experience.   For those who've never been, be sure to ask for bread, because they won't bring it to you automatically. You have to ask.

Pros: Service, host, cleaning tables -  fast Crispy crust, tasty cheese Peach salad marinated perfectly Young waitress with black hair had great timing cause you want your pizza hot Cons:  One pizza could have a browner crust Not the cheapest ****** They have their act together but sometimes you need to get lucky with the good wait help.

Pros: Service, host, cleaning tables -  fast Crispy crust, tasty cheese Peach salad marinated perfectly Young waitress with black hair had great timing cause you want your pizza hot Cons:  One pizza could have a browner crust Not the cheapest ****** They have their act together but sometimes you need to get lucky with the good wait help.

What happened to CPK Ala Moana?  Used to love this place but this last month, we ordered take out salads for lunch and what a disappointment! We called in at 10:30am. I ordered the Moroccan salad (half order because I heard the servings were nice sized).  I was looking forward to trying this salad mainly because it had beets in it!  I LOVE LOVE LOVE beets!  We were told our takeout would be ready at 11:30am. My co-worker ran over (we work near the mall) and came back a bit perturbed since it wasn't ready till 12:05pm!!  Were they busy, you ask?  No more than usual! Anyways, when I get my $12 dollar half salad, I pull out this tiny container that was only half full!!  Manini to the Max!  I swear it was less than 2 cups of salad! I thought to myself, this better be good!  NOT!!!!! Yellow lettuce mostly, a few bits of this and that and 4, quarter inch cubes of my beloved beets.  What an absolute ripoff!!! I then started to ask my clients as they sat in my chair (I'm a hairstylist), if they eat at CPK Ala Moana and of my lunch disappointment.  And what do I find out?  Favorite menu items GONE!  Wait time for orders LONG!  Received orders in and out of restaurant SMALLER!  Reason for all  these changes?  You guessed!  NEW OWNERS!!! Guess what disgruntled hairdressers do as they cut their clients hair?  Besides creating a fabulous new "do" for you, we talk, gossip and BITCH   about horrible eating establishments!!!! Word's out!  Where do we tell our clients NOT to go eat??!  Guess??!

Met some friends at Ala Moana and they wanted to eat here.  Got in line and were told it would be 60 minutes.  Well, ok, busy Saturday night, went over and had a beverage elsewhere and came back on time and were now told we were 2 or 3 from getting seated.  30 minutes later finally called in for seating.  Look at the seating list and a dozen people below us on the list have been seated already, so they don't honor seating on a 1st come 1st serve basis, but apparently on some special case situations.  (we were only a party of 4). To her credit the hostess did apologize, after I asked about the list discrepancy.  Ordered one of their small plate appetizers, it was fine, but no plates for the table.  Meals were served and one of the meals was served cold.  Ordered a 2nd round of drinks and the beer was served in a broken glass.  Fortunately we saw if before it totally shattered and ruined everyone's clothes. Other than one cold pasta meal the food was O.K. but not worth an hour and half wait and being shuffled to the end of the reservation line.  Plenty of other places available.

I couldn't decide if I should give this 3 stars or 4. Overall it is a 3, but you know what you're looking for when you go to a CPK so while it does not even close to compare to non-chain, more upscale restaurants, my star rating is relative to other CPKs and similar restaurants. I have eaten here probably five times now, and gotten takeout once. My dine-in experiences have always been good- prompt and friendly service, good food. My favorites are the peach salad and the Chipotle Chicken pizza (paraphrasing the names, sorry.) The salad is refreshing and the combination of the carmelized peaches, pecans, and white balsamic vinaigrette is delicious. I love the ingredients on the Chipotle pizza and they blend well together. Their strawberry mojito is also very good. The only negative experience I've had here was when I got takeout. I was quoted 30-35 minutes over the phone, and we arrived around 20 minutes later expecting to have to wait for our food. Happily, it was already ready, but unfortunately it had already gotten cold. Not just lukewarm, but straight up cold. Imagine if I had shown up when they told me to, 10-15 minutes later. The to-go person was friendly but they need to work on their takeout quote time accuracy. Other than that one detail, we've always enjoyed our meals here. Wide variety to choose from and conveniently located
