Good, middle-of-the-road dining option in Ala Moana! Appetizers are pricey, but entrees and salads save the meal. The bread has also changed since the last time I visited, the old stuff was better!

I'm only giving this place five stars because of their desserts. My friends and I decided that whenever we were out and about in town that we would make CPK our dessert spot. I always order the Belgian chocolate souffle cake, and it's so good! The ice cream scoop is HUGE and the brownie underneath is always perfect. However, last Saturday the hot fudge was a little, weird. It didn't taste bad, it just didn't have the consistency of hot fudge. I can't describe it, but other than that the dessert was amazing. Next time I need to try the red velvet cake, but the butter cake looks good too. I always can't decide whenever it comes to desserts but I must make it a plan to try every item on the dessert menu at least once! And there isn't much selection so after I try everything I can go back to my favorite, or maybe I'll have a new favorite...you never know...

Open on New Year's Day!  Yay! There are only two restaurants in Ala Moana I can tolerate:  Nordstroms Cafe and CPK!  The rest are junk, especially the food court! I love how customer-oriented CPK is.  On two occasions, our server was Sean and he was great!   Friendly, super fast, and gave us bread right away!  He even remembered us from before. My son has multiple food allergies and the manager and chef both came to our table to discuss meal alternatives.  I loved that.   The tortilla soup was kinda boring, but the avocado egg rolls were pretty tasty! Their pizzas are just the right size to have a few slices and then take the rest to go.  The Thai chicken pizza worked for me. We also had some spinach-artichoke dip left, and the manager got us extra chips to take home!   CPK makes the best caesar salads too.  They do not skip out on cheese and croutons either!  No one comes close! Thank you CPK!

A major shocker between my friends and I is that I dislike eating pizza. This stems from my college days where eating pizza is an almost every day occurrence. It doesn't taste horrible to me, but I lack the "eagerness" to eat pizza. Thankfully, CPK carries food other than pizza and that's a good thing. Their food is pretty good and prices aren't very high. I've tried their pizza before and although I dislike pizza,  I have to admit, it is delicious. Their BBQ chicken pizza is awesome with cilantro, but alas, it is just pizza, albeit good pizza. The pastas and salads are what I love about them. My favorite has got to be their Chinese chicken salad. Other commendable dishes include their Caesar, original BBQ chicken chopped salad, and asparagus spinach spaghettini.  Service has always been good here. Keep in mind CPK in Ala Moana is very busy most of the time, and the servers are friendly and fast. 100 Reviews, 1 Day 6/100 January 12, 2013

Since this review, I guess CPK has spoken to Josh. How do I know? Because Josh's girlfriend (whom is an acquaintance) has sent me threatening messages on facebook. She made it very clear if I do not take my review down, she will have her "big local sister" (exact words she used, lol?) come to my house and "kick my ass". This review is definitely staying here. CPK needs to not only train their employees better, but look into who they are hiring...

Shopping with girlfriends can certainly work up an appetite - especially maneuvering through the crowds at Ala Moana on a Sunday.  We decided to stop by CPK to satisfy our pizza craving. We had pizza and the Thai chicken salad.  I am not a frequent CPK customer, so I did not have any set expectations. Both entrees were good, but what blew me away was the fantastic service! Our waiter, Jacob, was awesome! He was  knowledgeable, and professional. His timing was perfect, he never kept us waiting or rushed us to hurry.  His service is what really made the CPK experience stand out and what drove me to write this review.   5 stars Jacob!

I really hate most chains but this is a good place for quick bite to eat when you are shopping.
I really hate most chains but this is a good place for quick bite to eat when you are shopping.

Have always liked going here for good salads and pizza but the last several times have been disappointing.  The portions are definitely smaller, especially their salads.  The full size should be a meal but they are not, at least not for me.  Our take out order was even smaller than the size served in the restaurant.  The price is the same for takeout but why are the portions smaller?  Our pizza also had so few of the toppings I though maybe they fell off in the box.   Have to find another place to get good dinner size salads

Have always liked going here for good salads and pizza but the last several times have been disappointing.  The portions are definitely smaller, especially their salads.  The full size should be a meal but they are not, at least not for me.  Our take out order was even smaller than the size served in the restaurant.  The price is the same for takeout but why are the portions smaller?  Our pizza also had so few of the toppings I though maybe they fell off in the box.   Have to find another place to get good dinner size salads

I'm personally a fan of the Kahala location over this one, because even though both restaurants are always packed, the layout of Kahala is less claustrophobic, and you don't feel as hurried to eat quickly and get out so someone else can sit.  I've ordered takeout a few times here, and it's nice to order and then be able to walk around and shop while I'm waiting.  The food is consistently tasty, the menu is large enough for the adventurous types (not met), and service is generally friendly.

I'm personally a fan of the Kahala location over this one, because even though both restaurants are always packed, the layout of Kahala is less claustrophobic, and you don't feel as hurried to eat quickly and get out so someone else can sit.  I've ordered takeout a few times here, and it's nice to order and then be able to walk around and shop while I'm waiting.  The food is consistently tasty, the menu is large enough for the adventurous types (not met), and service is generally friendly.

Very busy location, but aren't they all?  I don't think I've ever been to a CPK where we didn't have to wait.  Really enjoyed the roasted veggie salad.  Last time I was in Honolulu, we made it here twice.

Very busy location, but aren't they all?  I don't think I've ever been to a CPK where we didn't have to wait.  Really enjoyed the roasted veggie salad.  Last time I was in Honolulu, we made it here twice.

Thai pizza horrible, salty dried shredded carrots, not fresh. They give cheap quality white bread now and you have to ask for it. The table and walls are dirty and there was a urine smell where we were seated. Service was very slow. I used to go here a lot, food quality has tanked and prices still going up.

location: Fort Lewis, Joint Base Lewis-McChord, WA
review: I love this place! I get the wheat crust and veggie pizza. For an appetizer the wheat bread. The people are friendly and quick service.  I will defiantly be back there.
Love CPK. Totally addicted to BBQ chop salad with avocado and margherita pizza or three mushroom pizza. Yummmeeee!!!
Love CPK. Totally addicted to BBQ chop salad with avocado and margherita pizza or three mushroom pizza. Yummmeeee!!!

I've never had a bad experience at CPK, but I don't go there that often because it's a little pricey to eat on a regular basis; I think I've only been three times. I usually get the Thai Chicken Pizza but this last time I decided to try something new. I got the Peking Duck pizza. There was duck, green onions, and hoisin sauce, but also bean sprouts, which, while not unwelcome, were kind of weird and not Peking duck-y.  Also it was a thin crust pizza. I think I might be a little biased against thin crust to begin with, but I feel like if it's supposed to be like Peking duck, it should be regular crust, to emulate the doughy fullness of the steamed buns. This was probably my first thought as I bit into my pizza... and I feel like if pizza is your main thing, it shouldn't have such glaring problems. The food is not bad, but it's not great, especially for the price. The same goes for the service and the setting. I can't bring myself to give them three stars because they haven't done anything wrong, per se. But nothing is great, especially the value. 3.5 stars.

When I want to just grab a salad and soup, this place totally works.  It is really difficult to find a healthy meal in Honolulu.  I have been to this location at least four times in the last year or so.  In the past, the service and food has been very average.  It seemed like the staff did not want to be there.  Now there is a very good energy right when I walked in and the bartenders were very friendly and helpful.  I had the tortilla soup and arugula salad with feta, sun dried tomatoes and served with a lemon vinegerette.  The salad was excellent.  I give this place ***1/2.  I want to see more consistency before I add more stars.
Excellent service, even on a very busy night.  Food was very good.  We had to have a change in food after eating on the Sapphire Princess cruising across the Pacific for 4 days.  This hit the spot.

The last time that I dined at this restaurant my daughter had fallen asleep in her infant car seat (that easily clicks in and out of her stroller), so we left the stroller folded up at the front of the restaurant and were told we could bring her car seat to the table with us.  Once we got to the tight little table our waiter told me that I could just set her on the floor between our table and the neighboring group.  I did as he said, but tried to tuck her as much as I could on our side partially under the table.  How sad.  It was a packed house as usual, so it was quite loud, but thankfully my daughter was good about sleeping through anything. My Mom and I waited and waited to place our usual orders of Thai Crunch Salads and some refreshing pink lemonade and iced tea on the side.  We waited for our drinks and bread to arrive and nothing came.  Then finally our salads came and I had noticed that everyone around us had bread at their table, so I asked for bread as well.  In the midst of all the chaos, I observed our waiter drip water multiple times on my daughter's carrier and almost trip on her twice with dirty plates.  I kept apologizing and tucking her further under our table.  I never fidgeted with her once, so she remained in the same spot the whole time.  I only moved her multiple times after he kept running into her.  No other waiter was doing that and he was the very person who told me to put her there.  =( After that experience I haven't been back.  Sadly this was one of my favorite spots to have lunch with my friends while shopping at the Mall.  I always tolerated their consistent wait of fifteen minutes to an hour for a seat, but not anymore.

Met a friend for lunch & we both really enjoyed ourselves.  The food & the service was great, until our waitress brought us the dessert menu.  We looked through the menu, decided what we wanted & waited.  15-20 minutes later, we're still waiting.  She visited the tables around us, but did not stop at ours.  Did she forget about us?  We tried several times to get her attention but no luck.  Finally got the manager's attention & asked for the check.  When he brought it to our table, he asked us if it was the correct one (???).  What a disappointing ending to an otherwise awesome meal.
Excellent service, even on a very busy night.  Food was very good.  We had to have a change in food after eating on the Sapphire Princess cruising across the Pacific for 4 days.  This hit the spot.

When I want to just grab a salad and soup, this place totally works.  It is really difficult to find a healthy meal in Honolulu.  I have been to this location at least four times in the last year or so.  In the past, the service and food has been very average.  It seemed like the staff did not want to be there.  Now there is a very good energy right when I walked in and the bartenders were very friendly and helpful.  I had the tortilla soup and arugula salad with feta, sun dried tomatoes and served with a lemon vinegerette.  The salad was excellent.  I give this place ***1/2.  I want to see more consistency before I add more stars.

I love CPK, on most days.  Honestly, it has a little bit of everything for everyone and so it's my go to place when we can't decide where to eat.  Also, I would give their BBQ chicken pizza and california club egg rolls 5 stars without hesitation. But today, I was so unhappy with the restaurant that I almost wanted to complain to the manager, which is something I NEVER do.  I was about to rage (it runs in my Korean genes), but I knew that there was no coming back from rage...So my boyfriend calmed me down but I was unhappy throughout my meal and didn't get to enjoy my food at all. Basically, CPK has a new "wait list" feature where you can call ahead to be placed on the wait list.  I called at 7:20 and told them I would be there in 15 minutes.  They said they could have me seated around 7:50, which I said was fine.  I get to the counter to check in and she tells me that I'm not on the list...only to find my name scribbled on a piece of scratch paper on the side, NOWHERE near the wait list.  So she apologizes and says she will have us seated immediately and as soon as the next table opens up.  I thank her and go outside to sit.  8:10...and no news.  I go inside and ask when we will be seated and she asks me for my buzzer and when she realizes it didn't buzz, she looks at me like I'm crazy.  So then I explained that they FORGOT to put me on the wait list in the first place, and when they start getting flustered I realize that they totally forgot to put me back on the wait list when I checked in and they messed up the first time.  Then they get SUPER accommodating and have us seated within 5 minutes.  Customers shouldn't have to "complain" multiple times to fix the mistakes of the employees.  I'm not one to complain frequently or be rude to people who serve my food.  I understand that mistakes happen and I was cool about it.  When you mess up twice within a 30 minute period, that's not okay.  Do your damn job.  And if you're advertising a new "wait list" feature, make sure everyone's on the same page and doing it correctly. I've never had an issue with CPK's food or service before.  I usually love the friendly staff and their food is awesome.  But service is a make it or break it deal for me.  I was very unsatisfied.  If any of you ever decide to utilize their call ahead wait list feature, make sure you verify with them that they're actually going to write your name down.  Because apparently it's not obvious that should be done in the first place?

Aw man... this CPK is just as bad as Kahala now! The have the crappy sourdough bread blocks instead of the fresh white bread. Their waiters dress all any kine (pastels). In my opinion, the help just acts too casual and laid back! This time, I had a sandwich and got no choice of bread... no more garlic cheese or onion. I got a hard dried out chiabatta bun. So junk! Bring back the original CPK! CPK is no longer the favorite it used to be.

Had an early dinner with the PRSSA ladies. Supporting our club for next years' funds. We got seated at the booth and the lighting... It was dark. We were near the kitchen. I debated between the lettuce wraps and wild mushroom pizza. The pizza won, because I was still craving some! Their pizza is pricey though, I could get two bigger pizzas at Papa John's. ( ) There was a TV overhead so most of the time my eyes averted up there. The ladies were talking about drinks and saw how the bartenders made it. A bit of alcohol, a whole bunch of ice and some other beverage. Lol good thing I'm not a drinker. Our plates came out at the same time. Our waiter came back once in a while to check up on us and to re-fill our water. When we were full offered us the dessert menu. No, I gots me a gallon of chocolate ice cream at home. That's pricey too. Our waiter messed up our orders on our receipts. So my order got my neighbor's drink and I just got her dinner. It worked out in the end. It's going to be a while before I come to any CPK for a bite to eat. And as it got later in the evening there were more people coming into the restaurant. So much the buzzers were being handed out.
A favorite place to get great food, service, and a relaxed & comfortable atmosphere for a great price. The Chinese Chicken salad and the BLT Pizza are winners you can always count on
A favorite place to get great food, service, and a relaxed & comfortable atmosphere for a great price. The Chinese Chicken salad and the BLT Pizza are winners you can always count on

normally i don't go to big chain restaurants, but after ignoring cpk for years i tried it cos my friend chose.  food was meh. nothing special at all, salad didn't seem fresh, plus i got food poisoning that evening.  and i have a strong stomache, can't remember that happening since i was a kid! also u can do much better elsewhere for da price... it's not like they need my business anyway.

I think all CPKs have the same standard of food, which is decent. I am just going to review the location.  It's located in the mall with many other restaurants around the area.  It gets really crowded because the mall crowd is trying to grab lunch or dinner.  I hated the experience because of the location, the food and service was great though!

Giving 1 Star.  Told our party of ONLY 5 that the wait would be 30 Minutes, and we waiting for 1 Hour and 10 Minutes for our table.  All the dishes were terrible, and I got food poisoning!  Being stuck on the toilet all night is no fun because uncooked foods or dirty hands.

Busy atmosphere, very good passion fruit monitor and Waldorf salad was good able to split with my friend. Hawaiian pizza was ok, thin strips of ham with fresh pineapple I would have preferred more cheese, I don't like tons of cheese either! It was rather spendy....

Pretty good food. I have only eaten pizza there, but it is way better than ordinary pepperoni from any delivery place.

As always excellent food. I love the original bbq chicken pizza...had the best service in a long time anywhere from Dannah! Great time!

CPK is always a good go to place for me when I want to eat out but not sure where.  Or if you got a group of picky eaters there is usually something on the CPK menu that'll satisfy everyone.  Plus if you try something new and you don't like it then they will replace it with your usual favorite menu item.  Also now they have a rewards program called "Pizza Dough" and you can get free dessert and other stuff.  Also I've notice they are changing things, such as their plates and glasses, their uniforms and their bread.  Now it is toasted and comes with herbs in olive oil.  If you don't eat it fresh though it will get hard. I like this location because it's a nice sit down restaurant in Ala Moana Shopping Center that isn't too expensive.  Expect long waits during prime times, but they give you a pager that you can roam around a limited distance and still shop around.  :D  I usually get good service here, but it really just depends on who you get. My go to food items are: Spinach Artichoke Dip (sub for pita bread). BBQ Chicken Salad with extra BBQ sauce and Cholula, Wild Mushroom Pizza, Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken, and Tortilla Soup.

I love CPK but this location really needs some work! I came here for take out and placed my order online. I had to wait 30 minutes for this order. Wasted my lunch break and no apology from the manager. Yet he apologizes to a couple of ladies who were only waiting 10 min. Honestly, they need to stop paying so much attention to the delivery orders. They need to learn how to prioritize their take out and have better staff

Went in for dinner tonight with my sister. Ask for a few recommendations on what to drink, I ended up getting a strawberry banana smoothie (Nothing Special). My sister got the carribian something sangria. It was pretty good. Our food was good too. Why I'm giving this a four star is because our waiter was really nice. She checked up on us, asked if our food was ok and did everything in order. It was as if she treated us how she would like to be treated as a guest. She also gave us a card that we need to register for, when we spend 100 dollars (accumulated) we get 5 dollars off our bill. NEATO!

Service was great, food was great. My waiter was awesome. But the manager kept looking at us like we were gonna fine and ditch and always popped up and gave us this creepy stare like we were up to no good. Lol idk everything else is perfect, just not that make manager who always thinks I'm gonna dine or ditch or something. Creepy!! but it's all good I guess.

I've been eating at CPK for years at many different locations. It is always a great place to go to when you want to eat fancy pizzas. I came in around 11:30am and it was already packed. Luckily, we didn't have to wait for a table.  Our waitress was sweet. She brought in bread right away. She explained how they no longer serve the sliced white bread with butter because they replaced it with cubed sourdough bread with an olive oil and herb dip. Yummy! Don't mind the new change at all. My favorites: -white pizza: cheese, spinach, and garlic. I can do without bacon and chicken on it. I like it as is.  -cheese: plain and simple. -bbq chicken: classic. Love the bbq sauce! -butter cake: the best thing on the menu! So rich! I always get it with vanilla ice cream. Love the combo of warm and cold. Very buttery! I always look forward to this.

I love this place!  The only thing is that there's always a wait because this is such a popular spot! Great pizzas, pastas, and salads!  I love the Sicilian and Hawaiian pizza.  I am a fan of the thin crust pizzas.  Once u eat the pizza here then it would be very hard to eat pizza from Pizza Hut or any other pizza spot.  I also love the Thai Crunch salad...so damn good!  Great place to come with friends and simply pig out and try a bit of everything! The lettuce wraps here are yummy too!

Pretty darn good, best place at this spot in the mall, nice views of waikiki and ala moana beach park.. Friendly staff, reasonable price..pizza should've been much better and it could've been 5 stars..

Christmas shopping at Hawaii's largest and most popular shopping center can be tiring sometimes. So, we decided to have a sit down table service lunch and relax a bit. California Pizza Kitchen was agreed to and was shown to a table not to my liking. I spoke up and it wasn't a problem to be shown another table with a view of the ocean. A plus for good service. Our server, named Love, almost immediately showed up with the menus and asked if we would like anything to drink. A short while later, Love returned with our Iced Tea drinks. After perusing the menu, we decided on the Moroccan Spiced Salad and a Sicilian Thin Crust Pizza. The pizza crust was both crispy and chewy. Just the way we love it! The amount of sauce was just right to give it taste and not make the pie soggy. The toppings were both tasty and sufficient enough to get some in nearly every bite. 4 stars for the pizza! And now for the salad. The Romaine was fresh and crisp, the avocado was ripened perfectly but the beets seemed like it was out of a can. The peanuts were not roasted enough and the dates were an extremely rare topping on the Moroccan Spiced Salad. The amount of dressing tossed with the salad was adequate. However, having been to Morocco, we didn't detect a hint of any Moroccan spices. In fact, the dressing was very bland and was just there to moisten the Romaine Lettuce. A lot of black pepper, Parmesan Cheese and chili flakes finally made the salad palatable. 2 stars for the salad. The ambience was fine and Love provided excellent service. She kept our iced tea glasses filled and our table clean without being obtrusive. 4 stars for ambience and 5 stars for Love's service! I would return again and recommend this establishment to others. But, stay away from the Moroccan Spiced Salad! Although it's a recommended choice on the menu, it's a loser!

The Ala Moana branch serves very good food consistently.  The service is always fast and friendly.  The managers are upbeat and helpful. It's the prettiest branch too with lots of windows looking over the ocean.  Kahala often serves wilted salads with slimy bits of lettuce which are slapped onto the plate.  I love the chicken waldorf and roasted veggie salads and mushroom pizza at Ala Moana -- always very fresh and arranged attractively on the plate. The only problem for me is the loud music/noise from the bar next door in the evenings. Seating in the section overlooking the ocean is less noisy and you might get a view too!  The wait is never as long as they estimate.

Why 3 stars?  Well read on.   First off I'd like to say that the service is always amazing.  Every time I've gone the waiter/waitress was friendly and always checked back to see how we were doing.  They also seemed knowledgeable about the menu.  I like how the staff looks professional and you can tell who is an employee and who is not.  They're all friendly, even if they aren't your waiter.  Although the wait can sometimes take up to an hour or more, I do notice that the bussers move quickly, once a table is empty, to clean up and set up for the next customers.  If this were solely about service they'd receive 5 stars.   However, to me the service outshines the food.  I've tried about 4 different pizzas, 2 different pastas, and the artichoke dip with chips (which is pretty good).  I think people are paying more for the brand than the food.  I think the price they charge for their food items are a tad too pricey for my blood and it doesn't really reflect the quality.  The pastas are whatevs and the pizzas are okay.  I've tasted better pizza at "lower-end" restaurants.   This is one of those places that just sounds cool to eat at.  To me it's just alright but I wouldn't make this a normal place to eat at.

Always a convenient, tasty option for pizza and beer! First of all, love the convenient location.  Being located in Ala Moana Center, it's so easy to come here as a pit stop from shopping or a precursor to drinks at Beer Garden/Mai Tais.  Or just because!  However, BECAUSE it's located in Ala Moana, the wait can be pretty long.  I've had dinners on weeknights ranging from 20-50 minutes of wait time.  I can only imagine how long it is on weekends! The food here is delicious and consistent.  I'm a creature of habit, so me and my BF always order the: 1) Jamaican Jerk pizza (Spicy sweet Caribbean sauce, authentic Jamaican spices, Nueske's applewood smoked bacon, onions and bell peppers), and 2) Original BBQ chicken chopped salad with avocado, BBQ sauce, housemade herb ranch and cilantro. Together, these options are the PERFECT blend of greasiness and healthiness, sweetness and savoriness, spice and creaminess, and texture!  Most of the salads and pizzas run in the $15 range, so it can be a little pricy, but I guess you pay for what you get: a consistently delicious meal that satisfies a craving only CPK can give and fulfill! When I come here without my BF, I try to venture out of our normal menu items.  Most recently, I discovered another new fave: Wild Mushroom pizza with chicken (Cremini, Shiitake, Portobello and white mushrooms, Mozzarella and wild mushroom walnut pesto) -  I LOVE mushrooms, and this was the PERFECT pizza for me.  Tons and tons of delicious flavored mushrooms on original crust pizza.  Definitely a mushroom-lover's must-try! I also love their variety of drinks.  There's a full bar in the restaurant, so they serve beer, wine, cocktails, smoothies, coffee, you name it! All in all, definitely a fan.

I also love their variety of drinks.  There's a full bar in the restaurant, so they serve beer, wine, cocktails, smoothies, coffee, you name it! All in all, definitely a fan.
Good, middle-of-the-road dining option in Ala Moana! Appetizers are pricey, but entrees and salads save the meal. The bread has also changed since the last time I visited, the old stuff was better!

I'm only giving this place five stars because of their desserts. My friends and I decided that whenever we were out and about in town that we would make CPK our dessert spot. I always order the Belgian chocolate souffle cake, and it's so good! The ice cream scoop is HUGE and the brownie underneath is always perfect. However, last Saturday the hot fudge was a little, weird. It didn't taste bad, it just didn't have the consistency of hot fudge. I can't describe it, but other than that the dessert was amazing. Next time I need to try the red velvet cake, but the butter cake looks good too. I always can't decide whenever it comes to desserts but I must make it a plan to try every item on the dessert menu at least once! And there isn't much selection so after I try everything I can go back to my favorite, or maybe I'll have a new favorite...you never know...

The last time that I dined at this restaurant my daughter had fallen asleep in her infant car seat (that easily clicks in and out of her stroller), so we left the stroller folded up at the front of the restaurant and were told we could bring her car seat to the table with us.  Once we got to the tight little table our waiter told me that I could just set her on the floor between our table and the neighboring group.  I did as he said, but tried to tuck her as much as I could on our side partially under the table.  How sad.  It was a packed house as usual, so it was quite loud, but thankfully my daughter was good about sleeping through anything. My Mom and I waited and waited to place our usual orders of Thai Crunch Salads and some refreshing pink lemonade and iced tea on the side.  We waited for our drinks and bread to arrive and nothing came.  Then finally our salads came and I had noticed that everyone around us had bread at their table, so I asked for bread as well.  In the midst of all the chaos, I observed our waiter drip water multiple times on my daughter's carrier and almost trip on her twice with dirty plates.  I kept apologizing and tucking her further under our table.  I never fidgeted with her once, so she remained in the same spot the whole time.  I only moved her multiple times after he kept running into her.  No other waiter was doing that and he was the very person who told me to put her there.  =( After that experience I haven't been back.  Sadly this was one of my favorite spots to have lunch with my friends while shopping at the Mall.  I always tolerated their consistent wait of fifteen minutes to an hour for a seat, but not anymore.

I love CPK, on most days.  Honestly, it has a little bit of everything for everyone and so it's my go to place when we can't decide where to eat.  Also, I would give their BBQ chicken pizza and california club egg rolls 5 stars without hesitation. But today, I was so unhappy with the restaurant that I almost wanted to complain to the manager, which is something I NEVER do.  I was about to rage (it runs in my Korean genes), but I knew that there was no coming back from rage...So my boyfriend calmed me down but I was unhappy throughout my meal and didn't get to enjoy my food at all. Basically, CPK has a new "wait list" feature where you can call ahead to be placed on the wait list.  I called at 7:20 and told them I would be there in 15 minutes.  They said they could have me seated around 7:50, which I said was fine.  I get to the counter to check in and she tells me that I'm not on the list...only to find my name scribbled on a piece of scratch paper on the side, NOWHERE near the wait list.  So she apologizes and says she will have us seated immediately and as soon as the next table opens up.  I thank her and go outside to sit.  8:10...and no news.  I go inside and ask when we will be seated and she asks me for my buzzer and when she realizes it didn't buzz, she looks at me like I'm crazy.  So then I explained that they FORGOT to put me on the wait list in the first place, and when they start getting flustered I realize that they totally forgot to put me back on the wait list when I checked in and they messed up the first time.  Then they get SUPER accommodating and have us seated within 5 minutes.  Customers shouldn't have to "complain" multiple times to fix the mistakes of the employees.  I'm not one to complain frequently or be rude to people who serve my food.  I understand that mistakes happen and I was cool about it.  When you mess up twice within a 30 minute period, that's not okay.  Do your damn job.  And if you're advertising a new "wait list" feature, make sure everyone's on the same page and doing it correctly. I've never had an issue with CPK's food or service before.  I usually love the friendly staff and their food is awesome.  But service is a make it or break it deal for me.  I was very unsatisfied.  If any of you ever decide to utilize their call ahead wait list feature, make sure you verify with them that they're actually going to write your name down.  Because apparently it's not obvious that should be done in the first place?

The service is hit or miss. Once I ordered take out for my husband, son and myself.  The gal at the take out counter must have been new (trying to give her benefit of the doubt) but on top of that she seemed very apathetic. Even if she had made alot of errors (which she did), if she acted a bit like she cared, it would have helped. Our order was finally ready after around 40 minutes, but then she gave us the wrong food so we had to wait even longer until they gave us the food that we had ordered (cheese pizza for son, not pepperoni--Moms, you know how picky they can be!, then she got the wrong drinks, good thing I checked).  May still try again, we'll see.

I like CPK. They make tasty food, but being a restaurant chain, it's all standard, and the feeling of 'love' is not in the food. Service is SPECTACULAR here. Major props to my last waiter, Bartek(?)! He deserves a raise, CPK! Attentive, gives great suggestions, and was super friendly even though we stayed almost an hour past closing time. Almost willing to make this review 4 stars, just for the service. Almost.
I only get takeout but I love the southwest-style BBQ chicken salad. Artichoke dip is good too.

Always a great go-to restaurant! The people food and service are usually great, however the wait can tend to be extremely long. The portions did get smaller and the prices remains the same or have one up a bit but besides that it need does seem to disappoint. However beware that their salads are 1000 calories!

My 5th time at CPK only because my partner loves Pizza. Oh well, the recent one that I ordered was Garlic Cream Fettuccine. OMG! It was really delicious!! By the way, they replaced their bread onto sourdough which makes me wanna cry whenever I bite it!!! Huwaaa!!! So tough even with the olive oil dip. By the way, my Garlic Cream Fettuccine doesn't come with any bread or salad at all and made me want to grab something to pair for it. So, I asked the server if it's possible if I can have at least another bread?? Oh yes?? Hmmm i checked the tab if she charged me for that another round of sourdough but fortunately it's free. I don't know if they could give you another round for free though. But, hey, if she give it for free then will take it.

Well, CPK is my favorite restaurant of all time. I feel like everything is decently healthy (it's not, according to the nutritional facts, but we'll save that for another conversation), the servers are consistent and it's always good for friend outings or dates.  My favorite dishes are: tricolore salad pizza, mushroom pizza, fish tacos, lettuce wraps, margarita pizza and quinoa arugula salad. I pretty much love everything on the menu but if I eat the, say, California club salad, I'll gain 20 lbs instantly so I tend to stay away from easy fare like that. I like that they're always introducing seasonal entrees and desserts. The mixed berries with cream topping desert was soooo good. Oh and I like the passion fruit mojitos! I come to CPK Ala Moana, on average, once a week and I can never get enough. Once, we had a waiter with B.O., but for the most part, the place always smells great! :P One of the UH-Manoa clubs I belong to did a fundraiser here (bring in a coupon on a designated day, the club receives 20% of the purchase) and we raised a fair amount of money. The server was so cool about adding other parties' bills to our coupon so that we could earn a little more.  Lastly, props to the cool Filipino manager lady who walks around. She always comes by to say hi to my mom and I and sometimes she jokes around about the stinky waiter. Love her.

Loud, busy, and nuts! This place is crazy on Friday nights!...at least when I went. The choices are great, the service is nice, but dang it is a bit pricy! Of course it IS Ala Moana so I can't be upset at it. Right now they have a Korean BBQ Pizza flavor special which I must say was great! My dad got the Habenero Pizza which was the best, deliciously spicy! I chose the California Pizza I believe with avacado, bacon, and lettuce. Twas great but started tasting like a salad after a while. I suggest going early dinner before it gets roudy and loud. Also, don't be late so you don't have to face a potentially monstrous line!

I love this place!  The only thing is that there's always a wait because this is such a popular spot! Great pizzas, pastas, and salads!  I love the Sicilian and Hawaiian pizza.  I am a fan of the thin crust pizzas.  Once u eat the pizza here then it would be very hard to eat pizza from Pizza Hut or any other pizza spot.  I also love the Thai Crunch salad...so damn good!  Great place to come with friends and simply pig out and try a bit of everything! The lettuce wraps here are yummy too!

Heres why I love this place! I order salads here alot. Kailua CPk as well. They are always consistent and fresh and yummmy and seriously it costs less than going to whole foods salad bar. Today we shared a garlic chix pizza on whole grain crust and a salad.  Nothing less than excellent and my friend had a beer and it was $15. Each. Seriously;)) this is the place to go;)))

Random night out...but always perfect and always good way to go!!! CPK! With and amazing server CALYN and her kind and greeting manner, it top off our night right. White pizza and Caesar salad topped with salmon! Not too long of a wait especially for a Saturday night. Server was good but I feel it was more so our server then anything. Always do it right at CPK!!!

White pizza and Caesar salad topped with salmon! Not too long of a wait especially for a Saturday night. Server was good but I feel it was more so our server then anything. Always do it right at CPK!!!

CPK never disappoints. Ate here many times and the food is always of great quality and very tasty. My fav is the chicken picatta. Love the tartness of the lemon and the salty capers. The chicken breast is always moist and juicy- not dry like most restaurant served chicken breast. The only reason I removed one star is due to the moderately high prices. One slice of red velvet cake is close to $8! Yummy but not sure if it's worth 8 bucks?

CPK never disappoints. Ate here many times and the food is always of great quality and very tasty. My fav is the chicken picatta. Love the tartness of the lemon and the salty capers. The chicken breast is always moist and juicy- not dry like most restaurant served chicken breast. The only reason I removed one star is due to the moderately high prices. One slice of red velvet cake is close to $8! Yummy but not sure if it's worth 8 bucks?

Never disappoints. The prices are on par with the food quality. Workers are always in a good mood. I like it when they know you're a looking for them for a refill or you just want to order another item off the menu. I also love how they give those cards with discounts.  I've always had dinner here, the wait can get up to 45-60 minutes if it's a party of 5 or more and if you're eating on a weekend.    Finally had lunch here during the Christmas holidays and service was pretty good. Food came in quick.

Thai pizza horrible, salty dried shredded carrots, not fresh. They give cheap quality white bread now and you have to ask for it. The table and walls are dirty and there was a urine smell where we were seated. Service was very slow. I used to go here a lot, food quality has tanked and prices still going up.

If you haven't visited CPK lately, the menu has changed a bit. They used to serve bread with butter, but now it's been replaced! Actually, the new bread is horrid. It's served with olive oil, which I don't mind, but the bread was rock hard; it was difficult to chew since the crust was seriously so stiff!  Anyway, I also tried the Peking Duck Pizza. It's been off the menu for awhile and the new version is not as good as I remembered it to be. Basically you get a cheese pizza with pieces of duck and on the side you have your cucumbers, scallions and hoisin sauce. After one slice it was difficult to eat, since it was extremely salty! Is it always like this? or was the prep cook heavy handed with the salt? Either way, I had it boxed up and it's been in the fridge ever since... soon it'll be in the trash.  The images of the desserts looked really good. I've heard great things about the salted caramel pudding, but I'm not sure when I'll be back to try it.

I'm writing this review outside of the restaurant because my 7:00 reservations have apparently moved to 8-8:30. Without any notifications. I showed up to my 7:00 reservations at 6:50 only for them to tell me to wait another 60-90 minutes. What is the point in taking reservations if you are not going to have the tables ready in time? Very disorganized. We also asked them to wipe the benches outside because they're wet from the rain and all they do is hand us four napkins to wipe it ourselves. Pretty bad service so far. My appetite is already ruined.

Take-out service is excellent. Our order was incorrect when we arrived to pick it up and they resolved the problem quickly, plus they threw in a free salad. The food is consistently tasty, fresh, and helpful to the single, working parent!

Take-out service is excellent. Our order was incorrect when we arrived to pick it up and they resolved the problem quickly, plus they threw in a free salad. The food is consistently tasty, fresh, and helpful to the single, working parent!

Focaccia with Mediterranean Olive Oil - good Avocado spring roll - it's good, but you can't really taste the avocado Caribbean Sunrise Sangria - Refreshing and you can't taste the alcohol. Love it! Asian Plum Martini - Depending on who makes it, this is supposed to be on the sweeter (but not too sweet) side, not lemony. Beer - Can taste flat sometimes Spinach and Asparagus Pasta with grilled chicken (optional) -yummy, but the chicken is dry sometimes Margherita Pizza - good Ceasar Salad - i like it because it's not too lemony Between the food, drinks, and service.. i only gave 3 stars because of inconsistency. I've had other food items from here, but these are the only items I repeatedly order.

After hiking around all day, pizza sounded absolutely amazing. Service was excellent here and I thought the crust and the flavor of the pizza was above par.  We came here for a late lunch on a weekday and got right on.

After hiking around all day, pizza sounded absolutely amazing. Service was excellent here and I thought the crust and the flavor of the pizza was above par.  We came here for a late lunch on a weekday and got right on.

CPK is always good for a salad or a pizza.  This one is on the top floor of the Ala Moana Center (4th floor) with views of the marina and water out one side of windows.   We found service good, the pizza hot and fresh and the price what you would expect.   I love the bbq chicken pizza and the hubby always goes for the classic pepperoni.  Also good on the menu is the Waldorf Salad!   Great spot to get a bite!

CPK is always good for a salad or a pizza.  This one is on the top floor of the Ala Moana Center (4th floor) with views of the marina and water out one side of windows.   We found service good, the pizza hot and fresh and the price what you would expect.   I love the bbq chicken pizza and the hubby always goes for the classic pepperoni.  Also good on the menu is the Waldorf Salad!   Great spot to get a bite!

Open on New Year's Day!  Yay! There are only two restaurants in Ala Moana I can tolerate:  Nordstroms Cafe and CPK!  The rest are junk, especially the food court! I love how customer-oriented CPK is.  On two occasions, our server was Sean and he was great!   Friendly, super fast, and gave us bread right away!  He even remembered us from before. My son has multiple food allergies and the manager and chef both came to our table to discuss meal alternatives.  I loved that.   The tortilla soup was kinda boring, but the avocado egg rolls were pretty tasty! Their pizzas are just the right size to have a few slices and then take the rest to go.  The Thai chicken pizza worked for me. We also had some spinach-artichoke dip left, and the manager got us extra chips to take home!   CPK makes the best caesar salads too.  They do not skip out on cheese and croutons either!  No one comes close! Thank you CPK!

location: Fort Lewis, Joint Base Lewis-McChord, United States
review: I love this place! I get the wheat crust and veggie pizza. For an appetizer the wheat bread. The people are friendly and quick service.  I will defiantly be back there.

CPK is always a good go to place for me when I want to eat out but not sure where.  Or if you got a group of picky eaters there is usually something on the CPK menu that'll satisfy everyone.  Plus if you try something new and you don't like it then they will replace it with your usual favorite menu item.  Also now they have a rewards program called "Pizza Dough" and you can get free dessert and other stuff.  Also I've notice they are changing things, such as their plates and glasses, their uniforms and their bread.  Now it is toasted and comes with herbs in olive oil.  If you don't eat it fresh though it will get hard. I like this location because it's a nice sit down restaurant in Ala Moana Shopping Center that isn't too expensive.  Expect long waits during prime times, but they give you a pager that you can roam around a limited distance and still shop around.  :D  I usually get good service here, but it really just depends on who you get. My go to food items are: Spinach Artichoke Dip (sub for pita bread). BBQ Chicken Salad with extra BBQ sauce and Cholula, Wild Mushroom Pizza, Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken, and Tortilla Soup.

Went here with friends, seems like just about everyone comes with lots of friends.  It's just that kind of place.  Why I gave it 4 stars is because despite the fact that they are chain restaurant, they still are able to keep up with QQS, (quality, quantity, service). The prices are on par with what they have to offer, not too high.  It's a good family restaurant as well, kids do well here too.  Love the salads and that you can order half orders of all the salads.  The best time to come to the Ala Moana location is around 3 pm, no lines.

Love CPK!! I used to go here about 2-3 times a month. You will mostly always have great service and great food!!! The place is always busy and you'll still get great service. The food is awesome! 'Ono food and dessert but never can get to dessert cause I'm full off of the pupus (spinach artichoke dip) which is the best!!!  Overall, good food and good service cannot go wrong!!

During my most recent experience, I had a great time. The service was really good and it seemed like multiple servers helped us (whether it be refills, bagging our leftovers, or asking if we wanted dessert). The server we had was very courteous. He wasn't overbearing and he was really quick in making sure our orders came out. I give him 5-stars alone. My only issue was that the wait can sometimes be long (which is expected).

5-stars for food always being amazeballs, service has always  been a hit or miss at this location. We pretty much always order the Spinach/Artichoke dip, Kung Pao Spag., some type of pizza and a adult beverage. Hostess can be rude but they were okay this past weekend when we went and server was ok but just kept dissappearing when we needed refills n such. Probably a favorite over the other chain restaurants on the island.

Before I get to the reason why I gave this CPK 2 stars... let me talk about what they would have got... I absolutely LOVE CPK, everything about them! I usually go to the Pearl City and Ala Moana one and I've always enjoyed going there. Everything is great; the food, the service, and prices. CPK is one of the only places where I feel comfortable with trying new things on their menu. Their salads, pizzas, and pastas are always good. Normally, I would give them 5 stars! So why the 2 stars, you might ask... well lets make this long story short. Me and a friend ordered take out since we had to go back to work. We both ordered a pasta dish. As we ate it at work... I found.. what every customer fears to find... a long curly hair!!!! I couldn't believe it! I felt sick to my stomach after finding it. What was sad, but fortunate, was that I hardly touched my food before I found it. I was extremely dissapointed that CPK did something so unsanitary. I called them right away to speak with a manager and let them know, he apologized and offered a full refund or for a free meal the next time I come. To be honest, I would love to take their offer but I do not feel comfortable OR safe going back to that CPK location. This incident could have given them a 1 or no star, but I will always love CPK & their food. This rating is only for the Ala Moana location.

Aw man... this CPK is just as bad as Kahala now! The have the crappy sourdough bread blocks instead of the fresh white bread. Their waiters dress all any kine (pastels). In my opinion, the help just acts too casual and laid back! This time, I had a sandwich and got no choice of bread... no more garlic cheese or onion. I got a hard dried out chiabatta bun. So junk! Bring back the original CPK! CPK is no longer the favorite it used to be.

I like CPK. They make tasty food, but being a restaurant chain, it's all standard, and the feeling of 'love' is not in the food. Service is SPECTACULAR here. Major props to my last waiter, Bartek(?)! He deserves a raise, CPK! Attentive, gives great suggestions, and was super friendly even though we stayed almost an hour past closing time. Almost willing to make this review 4 stars, just for the service. Almost.

Blah... the past 3 or 4 visits (dine-in & take-out) were a bit of a let down. The portions on certain items, such as the spinach artichoke dip, have shrunken. The awesomely soft and delicious bread & butter has been replaced with stale baguette & olive oil. Fail. The last two dine-in experiences at Ala Moana were below the standard I have come to a expect at CPK. Slow service, constantly empty glasses (water/soda), having to ask twice for the check... sorry, but CPK is no longer my go to spot anymore.

I  love cpk no matter where I go.  They always provide consistency in their food and service.  I love their bbq pizza and garlic alfredo fettucini.  Affordable for the location and I love going to CPK when shopping at Ala Moana.

So upsetting! I think the customer service really sucks this year! So we ordered pita bread, and we get warm dough.. where it's still wet inside because it's UNDERCOOKED! ugh, so after sending it back, we get our entrees and my noodles are TOO HARD! So we send it back, then by the time I finally get it back, everyone is done eating... so I get my pasta to go! No apologies, no manager coming by, nothing! I used to love coming to CPK because of the sandwiches and the salads, but from now on, I'm not going to this location!

It's a chain. It's ok. The prices are a little high in my opinion, based on food quality. My feeling is very "meh" on this one. Kudos on the free wifi, though, as well as the chicken tortilla soup (YUM). Other than that the salads are ok-- I like the cobb with beets. Thin crust pizzas are ok too. I usually only go if I need a place with wifi or if I happen to be in that area of Ala Moana Mall.

I love coming here. Food is good and so is there service. Favorite dish is the bbq chicken chop salad. Seating is pretty quick during lunch hours...
I love coming here. Food is good and so is there service. Favorite dish is the bbq chicken chop salad. Seating is pretty quick during lunch hours...

Waaah!  They don't have the Greek pizza any more.  They won't allow me to be a boring creature of habit.  I tried the "Club" pizza (kind of like a club sandwich) and it was pretty good.  I still like this place, though it's no longer "Greek" to me!

Waaah!  They don't have the Greek pizza any more.  They won't allow me to be a boring creature of habit.  I tried the "Club" pizza (kind of like a club sandwich) and it was pretty good.  I still like this place, though it's no longer "Greek" to me!

Loved the atmosphere. Felt welcomed once I walked in her. The employee at the take out part of the place recommended that I'd try their egg roll. As you usual this place never let's me down when it comes to Customer Service. It deserved my 5 stars.

Loved the atmosphere. Felt welcomed once I walked in her. The employee at the take out part of the place recommended that I'd try their egg roll. As you usual this place never let's me down when it comes to Customer Service. It deserved my 5 stars.

A major shocker between my friends and I is that I dislike eating pizza. This stems from my college days where eating pizza is an almost every day occurrence. It doesn't taste horrible to me, but I lack the "eagerness" to eat pizza. Thankfully, CPK carries food other than pizza and that's a good thing. Their food is pretty good and prices aren't very high. I've tried their pizza before and although I dislike pizza,  I have to admit, it is delicious. Their BBQ chicken pizza is awesome with cilantro, but alas, it is just pizza, albeit good pizza. The pastas and salads are what I love about them. My favorite has got to be their Chinese chicken salad. Other commendable dishes include their Caesar, original BBQ chicken chopped salad, and asparagus spinach spaghettini.  Service has always been good here. Keep in mind CPK in Ala Moana is very busy most of the time, and the servers are friendly and fast. 100 Reviews, 1 Day 6/100 January 12, 2013

Since this review, I guess CPK has spoken to Josh. How do I know? Because Josh's girlfriend (whom is an acquaintance) has sent me threatening messages on facebook. She made it very clear if I do not take my review down, she will have her "big local sister" (exact words she used, lol?) come to my house and "kick my ass". This review is definitely staying here. CPK needs to not only train their employees better, but look into who they are hiring...

Met a friend for lunch & we both really enjoyed ourselves.  The food & the service was great, until our waitress brought us the dessert menu.  We looked through the menu, decided what we wanted & waited.  15-20 minutes later, we're still waiting.  She visited the tables around us, but did not stop at ours.  Did she forget about us?  We tried several times to get her attention but no luck.  Finally got the manager's attention & asked for the check.  When he brought it to our table, he asked us if it was the correct one (???).  What a disappointing ending to an otherwise awesome meal.

Had an early dinner with the PRSSA ladies. Supporting our club for next years' funds. We got seated at the booth and the lighting... It was dark. We were near the kitchen. I debated between the lettuce wraps and wild mushroom pizza. The pizza won, because I was still craving some! Their pizza is pricey though, I could get two bigger pizzas at Papa John's. ( ) There was a TV overhead so most of the time my eyes averted up there. The ladies were talking about drinks and saw how the bartenders made it. A bit of alcohol, a whole bunch of ice and some other beverage. Lol good thing I'm not a drinker. Our plates came out at the same time. Our waiter came back once in a while to check up on us and to re-fill our water. When we were full offered us the dessert menu. No, I gots me a gallon of chocolate ice cream at home. That's pricey too. Our waiter messed up our orders on our receipts. So my order got my neighbor's drink and I just got her dinner. It worked out in the end. It's going to be a while before I come to any CPK for a bite to eat. And as it got later in the evening there were more people coming into the restaurant. So much the buzzers were being handed out.

Christmas shopping at Hawaii's largest and most popular shopping center can be tiring sometimes. So, we decided to have a sit down table service lunch and relax a bit. California Pizza Kitchen was agreed to and was shown to a table not to my liking. I spoke up and it wasn't a problem to be shown another table with a view of the ocean. A plus for good service. Our server, named Love, almost immediately showed up with the menus and asked if we would like anything to drink. A short while later, Love returned with our Iced Tea drinks. After perusing the menu, we decided on the Moroccan Spiced Salad and a Sicilian Thin Crust Pizza. The pizza crust was both crispy and chewy. Just the way we love it! The amount of sauce was just right to give it taste and not make the pie soggy. The toppings were both tasty and sufficient enough to get some in nearly every bite. 4 stars for the pizza! And now for the salad. The Romaine was fresh and crisp, the avocado was ripened perfectly but the beets seemed like it was out of a can. The peanuts were not roasted enough and the dates were an extremely rare topping on the Moroccan Spiced Salad. The amount of dressing tossed with the salad was adequate. However, having been to Morocco, we didn't detect a hint of any Moroccan spices. In fact, the dressing was very bland and was just there to moisten the Romaine Lettuce. A lot of black pepper, Parmesan Cheese and chili flakes finally made the salad palatable. 2 stars for the salad. The ambience was fine and Love provided excellent service. She kept our iced tea glasses filled and our table clean without being obtrusive. 4 stars for ambience and 5 stars for Love's service! I would return again and recommend this establishment to others. But, stay away from the Moroccan Spiced Salad! Although it's a recommended choice on the menu, it's a loser!

Pretty darn good, best place at this spot in the mall, nice views of waikiki and ala moana beach park.. Friendly staff, reasonable price..pizza should've been much better and it could've been 5 stars..
I only get takeout but I love the southwest-style BBQ chicken salad. Artichoke dip is good too.

I  love cpk no matter where I go.  They always provide consistency in their food and service.  I love their bbq pizza and garlic alfredo fettucini.  Affordable for the location and I love going to CPK when shopping at Ala Moana.

the stars is for the lovely host. the wait is not bad at all, we called in 1hour early and got seated in 10min. but im not sure our waiter had a long day or what, he is not... i dont think he understand my order and feels like he just got dumped from his girlfriend or something. no smile, nothing. i ordered the hawaiian, thin crispy pizza and the whole thing is so soft like a taco!!!  thats not the end... when i got home, i couldnt find my leftover because he forgot to put it in!!!! OMG..! so pissed and thats not the worst. their bread is like rocks! cant even finish one piece with my favorite spinach dip! and my

I love CPK! However not as much as I did before. Lunch is a pretty good time to dine as it is not too busy. However dinner time is when it gets pretty nuts. If you're coming for a short time, then I would recommend sitting at the bar, if there's room. At least you can be seated right away. Recommendations for food, I like the original BBQ chicken pizza on honey wheat dough (remember you have to request the dough). The sauce is so delicious and the combination of chicken, red onions, and bacon (addt. $1 something) makes it awesome. The salads are awesome as well. I recommend the California Cobb with beets. For dessert, everything is good. I can't describe the butter cake but trust me, get it anyways. The chocolate soufflé cake is also good as well. Nice and soft and warm as it is straight from the oven. Try both with ice cream! CPK is great for dinner of two or for even a bigger party.

Lunch. Pizza. Beer.  At the bar. Great way to get away for and hour or so.  Watching them prep and bake you pizza right in front of you is a great way to nice break from a long hard day. Definitely order the pizza, it's always hot and fresh.

Lunch. Pizza. Beer.  At the bar. Great way to get away for and hour or so.  Watching them prep and bake you pizza right in front of you is a great way to nice break from a long hard day. Definitely order the pizza, it's always hot and fresh.

Definitely a fan of CPK in general. The quick-lo-down: Jamaican Jerk Chicken. Do it. Parmesan & Mushroom Flatbread. DO IT. Mango Lemonade. !?!?  This review will also encompass my most recent visitation to the Ala Moana location.  Me and my gf decided on CPK after viewing the nearby Hilton Friday Fireworks. What does that mean? Prime dinner time. The way was roughly an hour. No problem, I was expecting that already.  Once seated, our server - Noel, was great to us the ENTIRE night. I can't say I remember the last time I had exceptional service at CPK. CPK has added to their side dishes/appetizers, the flatbreads. Choose one and enjoy the yumminess. You're welcome. The Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza is just as good as it has ever been. My gf got an off-the-menu pasta, Tomato Basil Spaghettini. It was initially not as garlicky as she had hoped, but Noel took care of that with swiftness bring us back a re-warmed, re-tossed entree that suited her taste. He was also on top of my Mango Lemonade refills. YES! Dessert was actually the most disappointing: the butter cake. Their description for this item? "Just Try it." Tried it we did and disappointed I was. A warmed up pound cake that had a somewhat cheesecake-consistency center, it wasn't what I was expecting. But for the price, it's alright. I prefer the chocolate souffle cake instead.

They have gluten free pizza crust!!!  Oh my, yes, please! They also have a few gluten free small plate dishes available as well. Ok, now that I got that out of the way, here's the review... This CPK is located inside Ala Moana Mall, on the top level by Bubba Gumps and Mai Tai's.  This location is busy most of the time. My good friend and I got there around 6:20pm last night and was told that it'll be a 10 min wait.  By 7:05pm we were buzzed and lead to our table.  Boy, that was a long "10 mins".   We ordered half a plate of the peach salad (gluten free) and it was pretty tasty.  I ordered the mushroom, pepperoni and sausage gluten free pizza and my friend ordered the Thai pizza.  There's only 4 pizzas that are certified gluten free however they can make the other pizzas gluten free but there may be some cross contamination of gluten in the items.  So if you are seriously gluten free, then that is something to consider.   The server was knowledgeable in this area and was concerned when I wanted to add broccoli on my pizza.  I appreciated that he knew what he was talking about and didn't want me to get sick.  I told him that I wasn't going to explode if there was some cross contamination bcs I'm not seriously allergic, I'll just have issues later when I get home. The pizza came out great, I really enjoyed their gluten free crust, the sausage was tasty and there was just the right amount of sauce and cheese.  I was a super happy camper! I am super stoked that CPK has gluten free pizza (I haven't had pizza in MONTHS since going paleo this year and although this isn't paleo, it's alright since I can tolerate a certain amount of dairy and I'm ok with rice flour).  They do not have any gluten free desserts but hopefully they will in the future. So here's some tidbits of CPK, they have this rewards program for "dough", every $100 you spend, they give you $5 back and they throw in some free stuff occasionally.  You can sign up on their website but you have to download the app and then let your server know you want to collect your dough rewards when you are at the table. Also, you can buy gift certs from Costco for 20% off - score!  I need to go stock up since I can have their pizza again :) This location is convenient since I live in town and can get some shopping done however it gets quite busy for dinner and the wait can get a little long at times.

The wife and I had a great lunch their today.  Very up beat staff, our server Harole or Harloe (can't remember how to spell his name) was outstanding, food tastes great.  We will be returning to this CPK.

The wife and I had a great lunch their today.  Very up beat staff, our server Harole or Harloe (can't remember how to spell his name) was outstanding, food tastes great.  We will be returning to this CPK.

Being from California, this is one of the last places I really wanted to go to after moving here. But my boyfriend got a CPK gift card for Christmas, and so here we are. Their pizzas and flatbreads really are delicious. I especially liked the Spicy Chicken Chipotle. But it is a bit of money for thin-crust pizza. I got their Mushroom Sausage, which was a bit of a mistake. While delicious, I felt like it was a waste getting a type of pizza I could get anywhere else for cheaper. The Spicy Chicken Chipotle, on the other hand, is pretty unique and worth getting. Oh, and if you download the CPK app for iPhone or Android and register for their rewards program, you get a free small plate which includes their flatbreads.

I usually try to avoid CPK because I'm not really a *huge* fan of the food here, but since I just came back from South Korea and only ate Korean food for an entire year, I thought a change in flavor would do me some good. My friends and I were also looking for happy hour specials at other places but we just missed most of them and decided to just eat and drink here. We called ahead of time to ask how long the wait was for a group of four and were told that it would take about half an hour. We placed our names on the waiting list and headed towards the Ala Moana location. All four of us arrived, parked, and walked over to CPK in less than ten minutes and were seated about five minutes after we arrived. Once we sat down and were given our menus, our friendly server asked us if we wanted to start off with anything to drink and if we had any special requests at the time. All four of us ordered a glass of Blue Moon and asked for their complimentary bread (+additional servings). In less than five minutes, our server came back with our drinks and with enough bread for two rounds per person. We all ordered appetizers and our own dinner dishes after our server came back with more complimentary bread. We all shared the Spinach Artichoke Dip and I ordered myself a plate of Pesto Cream Penne with chicken. The Spinach Artichoke Dip is really nothing special; I felt like I could buy the same flavor at Don Quijote or some other supermarket. The Pesto Cream Penne was alright, but I could have sworn that I only counted four pieces of chicken. I paid $3.00 for four pieces of chicken. The portions for everything we ordered were either standard or on the larger side. I even had to ask for a take-out container for the pasta that I left over (which was about half the plate because I ate way too much starch here, whoops). My opinion remains the same about CPK -- I just can't find what some people find so amazing about the food here. I gave this location four stars because our server was friendly and energetic, came back constantly to check up on us, engaged in conversation with us from time to time, and gave us advice about what we should and shouldn't order. Apparently the flatbread dishes right now are on the smaller side for two people to share.
I love the BBQ chicken salad with avocado.   The service has been good so far, no complaints.

CPK !!! Need I say more. Who doesn't enjoy the multiple varieties of pizza. Anything from the very simple cheese to the somewhat complex chicken BBQ.  They do offer a wide assortment of pupus and pastas as well.  Location is great. Tons of parking. Service was adequate, nothing special. Prices are high, but it is the mall. It's popular, so expect a wait. **** It's where my wife and I went on our first date ****  Nuff said

Came here after a day of shopping.  Lemme tell ya, CPK always has a wait.  30 min this time, so not too bad. Ordered the Spinach Artichoke dip as well as a half-portion Thai Crunch Salad with avocado rather than chicken.  Always a great go-to place after a long day shopping, that is if you're willing to sit patiently for a table.

Jennifer, our waitress is exemplary and the food is healthy and delicious! Be sure to join the Pizza Dough club in your app stores to get free food! Today we scored a free pupu and a free desert!!!
Jennifer, our waitress is exemplary and the food is healthy and delicious! Be sure to join the Pizza Dough club in your app stores to get free food! Today we scored a free pupu and a free desert!!!
We had dinner here 1/25 and sever Jodi was absolutely fabulous!! We had a big party and service and food were perfect. It was a crowded Friday night but our experience was seamless!!
We had dinner here 1/25 and sever Jodi was absolutely fabulous!! We had a big party and service and food were perfect. It was a crowded Friday night but our experience was seamless!!
Good salads and pizza. A bit pricey for the portion size. Bread and dipping oil is great! Service at this location is hit or miss since it is in the mall, it is high traffic.
Good salads and pizza. A bit pricey for the portion size. Bread and dipping oil is great! Service at this location is hit or miss since it is in the mall, it is high traffic.

If you like Chucky Cheese you'll love Ala Moana CPK. I used to like going to Ala Moana CPK for soup and salad. Decent food, good service, convenient and well-run. Being a reader it was pleasantly quiet enough even during busy times. This place has changed and I fault management for not taking responsibility for the dining experience of their patrons.  On my last visit there were probably five or six different groups with double wide strollers and small kids. They were shrieking and howling continuously. The parents were gossiping with each other, totally oblivious of the screaming kids. Management was non-existent. Nothing against kids. When they are well-behaved they can be a joy. In the "old days" parents used to remove screaming ill-tempered children from a restaurant or movie theater. Too bad, I used to like CPK. I won't be going back. I still call in a take-out once in a while but I'll avoid dining in.

We came to eat on a Tuesday night around 8:00 and surprisingly there was no wait at all.   They were also very accommodating, they allowed me to use my coupon expiring in a couple of days even though i didn't print it out.  As always the food was delicious, they also have this new policy where you can try something new and if you don't like it they'll make you your favorite dish to replace it.  The server even told us when my friend asked about the fish tacos. But she really enjoyed her fish tacos, we also had the spinach mushroom flatbread, which was delicious! And i had the Italian Chopped salad, my favorite, i didn't feel like trying something new.   It was a good experience!

Good, ol' reliable CPK! They have friendly servers, good pizza and are affordable. How can you go wrong?  I've pretty much always had a good experience with CPK at Ala Moana. Granted, the crowd can be a little insane, but there's always take out! I use their carry out ap, so that I can avoid the crowds. They still give you bread and olive oil if you ask for it! Most of their pizzas are delicious, though I do have my favorites like the Spinach Artichoke pizza and Chipotle Chicken. My only beef is with their non-pizza items. I thought the cedarwood salmon and their fish tacos were terrible and overpriced. When at CPK, stick to pizza and their famous spinach artichoke dip!  Servers are always very polite and quick to refill drinks. They always make sure to check up on you and are very accomodating. No complaints in this department.  Overall, pretty good food and consistent service. I can see why they are so popular and I'm sure they'll be around for a long time.

After a big walk around the center we gave onto the hunger. To be honest I didn't have any expectations and the decor didn't add to this feeling. Boy, was I wrong. The pizza was excellent, like really excellent. I had the Tostada as it sounded so different to pizzas I have had before, it was different but in a good way. It was a huge portion but I managed to eat a fair whack of it. The easiest way is to scrunch it up pretending it is a taco. Husband enjoyed the Original BBQ Chicken and added bacon. Miss Muffin had the kids Hawaiian and loved it, she also enjoyed the $1 dessert.  A great place to go to have a break from all the shopping.

This review was going to be another 1-star, but CPK management and an awesome server saved the day! CPK frequently advertises their call-ahead function, where you can call about an hour before your party wants to eat and be added to the waiting list. It is a consolation since they do not take reservations. After hearing about it for some time, I decided to try it. My relatives were in town so we had a large party of 9. Crazy on a Friday night. I called ahead at 6:30pm and said we wanted to come in around 7:30. The hostess seemed confused at the thought of a call ahead and transferred me to her manager, who also had a slight attitude problem. Anywho, an hour to get together a table, no sweat right? Welllllll we waited until after 8:00pm. We kept checking on the table and they said the people at "our table" were taking a while to leave. I don't know how restaurants work, so I was understanding but increasingly hangry. I didn't appreciate that they kept making excuses, and the hostesses seemed irritated that they had to accommodate such a large party. The manager eventually offered us drinks, but it was a little too late. When we were finally seated, all of us were a little irked. However, the manager started us off with complimentary appetizers. Honestly for a restaurant that is so busy that they don't need to take reservations, I did not expect such hospitality from the manager. He also came back during dinner to make sure we were doing okay. Our server was very charismatic and accommodating as well. She didn't make a fuss at all when we asked to split the check three ways. Overall, I left appreciative of the management who took accountability for the mishap and did whatever possible to remedy the situation. I wouldn't rely on call ahead in the future though. Just expect a wait and enjoy some shopping.

CPK has always been a favorite destination of mine and my friends.  I went around 4'o'clock and there was no wait.  I ordered the same thing I get almost every time I come here, the California Club Sandwich w/ chicken on the herb-cheese bread.  Upon receiving my order, I noticed that there were hair-like fibers on top of my sandwich.   This same scenario happened to me about two or three weeks ago at this exact location.  At the time, I told my waiter (I think his name was Chase) and he apologized about it and called his manager over.  I'm not sure what her name was, but she was very nice.  She saw that there were these hairs on the bread and took the meal off our check and even gave us a dessert for free.   Today when I had told my waitress, she said that she would talk about it with her manager and even the cooks in the back.  She came back to tell us that they use a towel to hold the hot bread while cutting it.  I was a little grossed out about this (Who knows how many times they have washed that towel, or even if people's sweaty hands have touched the towel that touches my bread).  She offered to get us another meal (Not on the house), but I refused politely because I was very hungry so I didn't eat the portion of the sandwich that had the hair on it.  She told me that she would get her manager to come over, but after 5-10 minutes, he wasn't coming so I had to remind her to get her manager.  When he came by the table, I had recognized him from the last time I was there (The first scenario about two/three weeks ago).  In that previous scenario, I remember him only because he was being rude to my friend and I when I nicely asked him what he had just served to the table next to us and what was in the dish.   So when he had showed up at our table this time, he asked me where the hair-like fiber was and I showed him.  When my friend told him "That is basically like eating parts of a towel", he said "No, it isn't basically eating parts of a towel." He then proceeded to tell us that he could "barely see it" (Regardless if he could barely see it, it was still there which still made it gross!) The whole time speaking to us, he was being rude once again.  He offered to get us another meal (Again, not for free) but we refused.  My friend and I were both very irritated.   After leaving our table, we got looks from the other workers as my friend and I were talking about the situation.  Even our waitress and her shadow seemed very awkward talking to us after everything had happened.  We saw the manager speaking to the head cook (I'm assuming?) right near us which I thought was rude, 1) To be speaking about the matter right by our table.  I didn't get his name (which I should have) but he had short black hair and a beard/mustache.   One reason why I assumed he was being rude was because we are teenagers.  Just because we're teenagers doesn't mean people can treat us like that.  We're customers regardless, and I'm sure that the manager wouldn't speak rudely to other, older customers.   After this incident happening twice, I am never coming to this CPK location again.  The towel thing disgusted me but so did the service of the manager and the other waiters/waitresses.  I have eaten the California Club Sandwich probably twenty or thirty times before, and now that I think about it, there were probably pieces of towels on those sandwiches too.  I hope the manager and the other waiters and waitresses see this so they know what not to do.  If I ever do come to this CPK again and it happens once more, I will be very disappointed and will have to speak with the other managers about who they promote and who they hire.

CPK in Ala Moana, what could be a better combination? After some shopping, it is a great place to have lunch or dinner. I enjoy their Chopped Salad, and their pizza (of course). Service is pretty friendly. Just watch out for dinner time, when the wait for a table can hit an hour. With all the options to eat at Alaz, this is still one of my tops.
