Amazing carmelized peach salad with grilled chicken breast. Service is hit or miss at this location. Ordering to go? DO NOT ORDER ONLINE. They have lost my order multiple times. Ask for the complimentary bread and herb olive oil, it is tasty!

Food is ok but a bit pricy considering portion.  Most uncomfortable when u have  more than a couple cops seated on each corner of restuarant trying to find trouble.  They should be hanging outside near dirty stairway where most lewd kids are hanging around. It was also noted that some poor kid got stabbed to death here last. Dont wanna have dinner in a place where the officials are trying to profile everyone.  I say they do better and stand outside near staircase and really protect us....my dinner experience started to taste a bit sour especially when u have someone stare at every food u put in your mouth. Just plain rude! Go do your jobs and keep eye on real trouble outside. But then again...they also were checking out female waitresses! Some class eh!

It's been a l o n g time since I've eaten at CPK. Not sure why...I guess it just hasn't been in my radar. Used to be that CPK was the place I'd treat myself when I worked extra hard or got a big tip. Now that I moved from Pearlridge Mall and Aiea, I just don't think about eating here. So it's a bit of nostalgia facing me as I sit on the bar waiting for my Shop A Lea bud to show up. I'm having my old faves: Chinese chicken salad and checca. I am surprised at how much I still enjoy these dishes!  My waiter Dave is attentive, fun and gives great service. The place is clean and bright. All in all a great place to kill an hour! Service - 5 stars Food - 5 stars  (especially for chain food!) Convenience - 5 stars  Overall - 5 stars

Great place. The food was very tasty! The service was ok once we got going (it took forever for the server to come over once we were seated). We went on a Friday night and only had a few minute wait. Would definitely recommend!

Great place. The food was very tasty! The service was ok once we got going (it took forever for the server to come over once we were seated). We went on a Friday night and only had a few minute wait. Would definitely recommend!
Jambalaya is always great...service superb!!!  The prices has increased which the portion or quality has not changed much???

We came to eat on a Tuesday night around 8:00 and surprisingly there was no wait at all.   They were also very accommodating, they allowed me to use my coupon expiring in a couple of days even though i didn't print it out.  As always the food was delicious, they also have this new policy where you can try something new and if you don't like it they'll make you your favorite dish to replace it.  The server even told us when my friend asked about the fish tacos. But she really enjoyed her fish tacos, we also had the spinach mushroom flatbread, which was delicious! And i had the Italian Chopped salad, my favorite, i didn't feel like trying something new.   It was a good experience!

Food is ok but a bit pricy considering portion.  Most uncomfortable when u have  more than a couple cops seated on each corner of restuarant trying to find trouble.  They should be hanging outside near dirty stairway where most lewd kids are hanging around. It was also noted that some poor kid got stabbed to death here last. Dont wanna have dinner in a place where the officials are trying to profile everyone.  I say they do better and stand outside near staircase and really protect us....my dinner experience started to taste a bit sour especially when u have someone stare at every food u put in your mouth. Just plain rude! Go do your jobs and keep eye on real trouble outside. But then again...they also were checking out female waitresses! Some class eh!

This place is consistent and I appreciate that.  I rarely venture away from the avocado rolls and soup as my personal combo. Today I added the tacos and flatbread.  Grandma and I split everything and really loved the rolls but didn't care much for the flat bread.  Service was great. Only hiccup was that our tacos had avocados and those were served with some skin and a knob. Small overlook but basic food handling should have avoided that. Hence the score of 4.

Service is always friendly here! I love their BBQ chopped salad! This is the only place that I will go intentionally for the salad! Fried Macaroni and cheese, meh I'll pass on that the next time. Bf had fish taco which he liked!

All my life I have never been much of a risk-taker. I tend to stick to the known and comfortable things in life. This includes dining. There are however days in which I am hit with a particular craving for something new and exciting. On a recent trip to Oahu, I experienced this craving while shopping at the Ala Moana mall. After some time spent wandering and contemplating, I decided on the popular and well-known California Pizza Kitchen.  While I had eaten their frozen pizzas from the local supermarket before, I was intrigued with the idea of trying their freshly made ones. Upon entering the restaurant, my eyes swept the room while I gauged the surrounding moods. Although quite crowded and with every table occupied, the atmosphere was light and happy, with families laughing and enjoying their food. The large glass windows further fostered the lighthearted ambience of the restaurant, since they let in all the natural light while also providing a great view of the ocean.  As for the numerous amounts of diners, this was to be expected of a prominent restaurant located in one of Honolulu's main hubs. Surprisingly however, the wait time was much shorter than they had originally stated. In retrospect, this was most likely due to the quality service. One of the friendliest waiters I had ever met brought out every order in a timely fashion, and he always made sure to check up on us when he passed by. Patrons also got the sense of really being able to trust the cooks, since there was no division of the kitchen from the dining area, and they made the pizzas in a fantastic brick oven right in front of you.  Moving on to the food, the most concise yet all-encompassing way to describe it was delectable! I am known to be quite the picky eater, especially when it comes to salad. However I had absolutely no complaints about their Caesar salad. In fact, it was probably the best restaurant salad I had ever been served! The presentation of the soup and pizza was quite impressive, and the complimentary rosemary bread and olive oil dipping sauce was an added bonus! Pizza happens to be one of my favorite foods, and just thinking back on that meal makes my mouth water.  I would highly recommend dining at the California Pizza Kitchen to families, or to groups of friends on an outing. Not only are the food and service of excellent quality, but also the pricing is unexpectedly reasonable for the generous portions that we had been served. Convenience-wise, I would not suggest making a special trip to go to the particular California Pizza Kitchen that I had dined at, if you are just planning on going out for a meal. I say this with good intentions, seeing as you would have to first find parking at the mall, then maneuver through the crowded walkways until you could find an escalator to take you to the next floor, and repeating this until you get to the fourth floor where the restaurants are located. However, if you were someone like me who was already at the mall, and exhausted and hungry after hours of shopping, then I would highly recommend this restaurant to dine at while resting your aching feet. California Pizza Kitchen, you definitely earned 5-stars from me!

I am from New York, so I might of rated this kind of low for that reason. I love the BBQ chicken pizza and the bread, and the peach salad. Overall thou I would rather have New York style pizza. Thou this is a good spot if youre not able to get NY style pizza.

location: Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam, United States
review: I am from New York, so I might of rated this kind of low for that reason. I love the BBQ chicken pizza and the bread, and the peach salad. Overall thou I would rather have New York style pizza. Thou this is a good spot if youre not able to get NY style pizza.

I eat at CPK maaaaaybe 2-3x a year, and when I do, it's always a treat! This time was no different, the food was on point. I don't remember the name of my pizza (see pic) but it was YUMMY! Very fresh tasting and did not make me feel like taking a long nap afterwards.  -2 stars because although I was seated immediately for my part of 3, it took forever for our bread and drinks to arrive. The service was very slow. I was also disappointed because it seems that they have that "my section" attitude here. We called out to a waitress who ignored us (after making eye contact with us) and walked over to "HER section". I hate this kind of system. I understand you may have your own section but that does not mean to neglect everyone else. Peeve of mine since working in the food business a few years ago.
Always busy but I still love this location, second is Waikiki, then Kahala [avoid Pearlridge]. Great customer service. Food is tasteful and consistent.

This is a good place to have some lunch because the food was very good and the customer service was even better. I have to say the chicken garlic pizza was the best that I have eaten there.
This is a good place to have some lunch because the food was very good and the customer service was even better. I have to say the chicken garlic pizza was the best that I have eaten there.

This place is consistent and I appreciate that.  I rarely venture away from the avocado rolls and soup as my personal combo. Today I added the tacos and flatbread.  Grandma and I split everything and really loved the rolls but didn't care much for the flat bread.  Service was great. Only hiccup was that our tacos had avocados and those were served with some skin and a knob. Small overlook but basic food handling should have avoided that. Hence the score of 4.

Used the Slice of the Prize and got a free dessert.  Yeah!  No one won the big prize yet so I still had chance.  Waiter service was just alright.  The waiter/waitress are a hit or miss kind of thing.  Sometimes you get a good one and sometimes not :(   Well, the waiter was a miss this time around...you could tell he really didn't want to accommodate but if you really wanted something, he would.  Now what kind of service is that?  When a customer asks for something, you should get it and not say that it'll take awhile but if you still want it he could get it for you.  Duh,  I wouldn't ask if I didn't want you to get it.    Although service is not always 5 star and it's pricey, I still go back because I love the food.

I always dread coming to cpk amc, so when my best friend asked me to meet her I was hesitant. BUT, we were seated within 5min (I think we was lucky cause someone left and we walked in). Anyways, the food is always on point. We always get the spinach dip as appetizer. The girl Who helped us was Maile (not sure on spelling, sorry girl) and she was awesome. She was on point, grabbing our orders and helping us with our drinks, refills and clearing plates. I wanted to try the new strawberry mango cooler (which everyone should try) but it's a virgin drink so I asked her what alcohol would go great and she didn't know but went the extra mile to ask her boss or whoever was in the front and they recommended mango rum. The drink was divine  I would have stayed and had like 3more but I had to work early. Oh and Tiffany was very nice, she greeted us at our table (even though she wasn't our waitress, she was standing next to our table I think ) and talked to us for a good 5min. I don't know about you guys but I like going to places and the people working are interactive and talk to their clients. The vibe was good, food was good, service was good, compared to cpk Pearl ridge (service wasn't like this). Def changed my mind about this place.  Thank you Maile, Tiffany and that boss lady in the black and brown blouse.  I will be coming back!!

Above and beyond! CPK manager noticed that the screw in my eye glasses was popping out. He pulled a screwdriver from his pocket and quickly repaired them! Our party of 3 went on to have the most enjoyable and delicious lunch!! Everything was perfect!
Great "healthy" menu and options.  Service was good considering the crowd.

A bit disappointed.. For a table for two, my other half and I were given a buzzer and was told the wait was 10-15 minutes, which was fine. Two minutes later our buzzer beeps so we transfer from the outside bench to the line at the hostess. Two-parties of two(couples) got seated before us.. Right in front of our face!!!!! And now we have a crappy table while they have an amazing booth for just simply walking in.... LIKE ALRIGHT.... That's why I stay at the pearlridge one because at least they have better manners

We had strawberry field salad - it had watermelon too. Refreshing. Flatbread spinach and mushroom - could be bigger. Strawberry shortcake with ice cream - delicious .... Bread with butter- nice and warm....seasonal items come while they still have it.

We had strawberry field salad - it had watermelon too. Refreshing. Flatbread spinach and mushroom - could be bigger. Strawberry shortcake with ice cream - delicious .... Bread with butter- nice and warm....seasonal items come while they still have it.
Always reliable food wise but prices have gone up and it can be tough to get a table here sometimes.
Always reliable food wise but prices have gone up and it can be tough to get a table here sometimes.
CPK... no matter which one...always so busy...always have to wait a bit, but always a good go-to place with your favorite go-to dishes.  I got the Thai Pizza this time. Didn't disappoint.
CPK... no matter which one...always so busy...always have to wait a bit, but always a good go-to place with your favorite go-to dishes.  I got the Thai Pizza this time. Didn't disappoint.

Good, ol' reliable CPK! They have friendly servers, good pizza and are affordable. How can you go wrong?  I've pretty much always had a good experience with CPK at Ala Moana. Granted, the crowd can be a little insane, but there's always take out! I use their carry out ap, so that I can avoid the crowds. They still give you bread and olive oil if you ask for it! Most of their pizzas are delicious, though I do have my favorites like the Spinach Artichoke pizza and Chipotle Chicken. My only beef is with their non-pizza items. I thought the cedarwood salmon and their fish tacos were terrible and overpriced. When at CPK, stick to pizza and their famous spinach artichoke dip!  Servers are always very polite and quick to refill drinks. They always make sure to check up on you and are very accomodating. No complaints in this department.  Overall, pretty good food and consistent service. I can see why they are so popular and I'm sure they'll be around for a long time.

A good place to go for quick lunchtime meals...if you sit at the counter. When the noontime rush arrives, expect to wait awhile for a table. The prices are a little bit high, and some of the dishes seem a bit over salted, but there are plenty of lower-fat options, as well. If you sit a the counter, the bar tending and wait staff will give you very friendly, personalized service.

the service at the bar was amazing!  probably because it was overseen by the front of the house manager.  the rest of the place was not that great.  the people who worked at the host stand looked really frazzled and were messing up big time on peoples place in line but over all, they do a good job expecially being that they are always slammed.

Service is on point! Ambience is modern, welcoming, lively and the place is clean! Prices are high but just about everything here is above par so it's worth it. We ordered dumplings, pepperoni pizza (they are small, good for lunch but personal size if you're eating for dinner) and ordered another, white pizza, because we were still hungry. Food was good! Drinks were refilled before we were finished. I love that! Multiple waiters checked in to make sure everything was going well. I love that too! The tiramisu wasn't authentic but it was pretty good. Next time we know to order another meal, maybe pasta along with a pizza. They have a good sized menu so finding something good shouldn't be a problem. See you soon CPK!

Although this mall is a cluser f17ck, this is my favorite CPK location on the island. We always get the works pizza and pasta. Nothing special about the salads. Eat here if you don't want to feel totally disgusted with yourself after binging on pizza. Our wait is never long, consistent service, and great for groups.

We loooovveee CPK.   We have tried Alamoana, Pearlridge and Kaneohe location and so far none had disappointed us.  Service have been awesome in all area.  They are friendly,  quick and very attentive to their customers.  The facilities are also kept neat and organized.  Price range are also very reasonable with a good portion size. Our favorites: Chicken Lettuce Wraps Spinach Artichoke Dip and Chips Jambalaya Pasta The Original BBQ Chicken Chop Salad California Club Sandwich Tequila Lime Pasta w/Chicken Complimentary Bread Kids: Fried Chicken Pasta with Tomatoe Sauce We also signed up for a "pizzadough" account and because majority of the people have smart phones it is a free app that all you need to do is check in and for making so much purchases at some point you will receive different deals such as a free small plate or $5.00 off next purchase.

Came here after playing games at Dave & Busters tonight (none of us ate anything or had anything to drink) and decided to eat here at California Pizza Kitchen. I got a salad, and my friend got a pasta. My friend complained about the pasta not sitting well and his stomach feeling upset from eating it. He is now throwing up and very hot!

Come here so often with my little sister. The service can be a hit or miss, depending on who's serving you and what time of day it is.  The menu is very extensive and there is something for everyone. Great restaurant for kids and pasta lovers. I personally love the Sicilian thin crust, the fettuccine alfredo, meat lovers pizza, and the spinach artichoke dip.

It is a great atmosphere!  Sara the bartender is very Awesomeness!  Food is great!  When coming back to Hawaii I will eat here again!
It is a great atmosphere!  Sara the bartender is very Awesomeness!  Food is great!  When coming back to Hawaii I will eat here again!

Our waiter barely was there. Ordered our food and checked on us once. the crispy mac and cheese was ok. The cheese on the plate was hard when it was given to me and it was sort of dry. The fish tacos tasted very weird. I only ate the chips and salsa that came with it.

Our waiter barely was there. Ordered our food and checked on us once. the crispy mac and cheese was ok. The cheese on the plate was hard when it was given to me and it was sort of dry. The fish tacos tasted very weird. I only ate the chips and salsa that came with it.

After a big walk around the center we gave onto the hunger. To be honest I didn't have any expectations and the decor didn't add to this feeling. Boy, was I wrong. The pizza was excellent, like really excellent. I had the Tostada as it sounded so different to pizzas I have had before, it was different but in a good way. It was a huge portion but I managed to eat a fair whack of it. The easiest way is to scrunch it up pretending it is a taco. Husband enjoyed the Original BBQ Chicken and added bacon. Miss Muffin had the kids Hawaiian and loved it, she also enjoyed the $1 dessert.  A great place to go to have a break from all the shopping.

Used the Slice of the Prize and got a free dessert.  Yeah!  No one won the big prize yet so I still had chance.  Waiter service was just alright.  The waiter/waitress are a hit or miss kind of thing.  Sometimes you get a good one and sometimes not :(   Well, the waiter was a miss this time around...you could tell he really didn't want to accommodate but if you really wanted something, he would.  Now what kind of service is that?  When a customer asks for something, you should get it and not say that it'll take awhile but if you still want it he could get it for you.  Duh,  I wouldn't ask if I didn't want you to get it.    Although service is not always 5 star and it's pricey, I still go back because I love the food.

Whether it's San Diego, Hawaii, Guam, the moon, Mars, and beyond, there are not many pizza outlets as consistently good everywhere you go like California Pizza Kitchen!  Kicking in to my lunch time at the beautiful Ala Moana mall I felt the inner Cali side of me arising when it came time to eat!  Typical for summer, it was very busy but the good thing is that I was alone at took a chair at the bar area. Though I'm still bumming that CPK took away my all time favorite of theirs - the carne asada pizza - what was left behind never came close to driving me away.  This time, I did CPK with a Hawaiian twist.  That is, I went for the Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza - with absolutely no regrets! This version had the normal stuff you would expect on a BBQ chicken pizza - along with a great mix of pineapple and a sweet BBQ sauce!  With a side salad, all worked out well and I left somewhere between very happy and I'm fully stuffed in need of a wheel barrel to roll me out of there! Service was solid and though all went well with my meal and service, a nearby customer complained about his lemonade cooler and the waitress immediately fixed him a new one.  Customer service like this is what keeps us coming back and makes places like CPK very successful!  I know I'll be back! Recommend: HIGH They'll get VERY HIGH when they bring my carne asada pizza back - And maybe 5 stars!

We were going to go to Mai Tai Bar for some pupus but they were packed so we decided to go over to CPK at Ala Moana.  Although it was busy we were able to get seating at the bar where you can see them making the pizza.  Although it seemed like someone had just finished eating and the counter wasn't clean yet they fixed that up in a beat.  Our server was super friendly and got our drinks quick.  Once we ordered the food came quick as well.  I was up for dessert which our server did a good job explaining the different types.  I went with the strawberry shortcake and ice cream.  Once we finished up I was impressed by the manager who came over and gave us a couple of coupon cards for our next visit.  I have to say from start to finish our experience was excellent.

I lit-trally haven't been here in years cause I never liked this place. BUT, wouldn't turn down a friend's request to dine here, since it's her fave place and it was her bday. Ok ok, we'll give it a chance.  First of all, when I checked in on Yelp, I noticed that if you sign up for their rewards program, you get a free "small plate". LOVE free stuff! Seriously sign up for the "pizza dough" rewards card!  The server promptly came to our table and was SO helpful in telling us how to download the apps on our phones to redeem the rewards (my friend also got a free dessert on her card!) and that he would split our checks since normally only one card can be used. Awesome! For the small plate, we got the Crispy Mac N Cheese (reg $4.95 but we got it for free) - YUM. It came with 3 balls of fried, breaded, mac n cheese. Not oily at all, perfectly crisp with a melty inside. Spinach Artichoke Dip ($10.95) - um, dah, you need to get this. Who doesn't order this when coming to CPK? Warm, melted cheese, spinach, artichoke... yeah. I ordered the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza (minus the sausage cause I'm not a fan of tubed meat $16-something?? because i added TRUFFLE OIL which was an additional $1.50) - besides what toppings is obviously on this pizza, it had fresh basil mmm. holy hannah, I LOVE truffle oil and so glad they offer it as an add-on for only $1.50. Other pizza places I've gone to charge up to $3 for this. yikes. Their pizza was surprisingly delish! I used to hate (really, hate) their pizzas before but I feel like they've really improved and I totally would come back!! Our server was so helpful and attentive.  The only downside is it gets bananas-busy! Gross - I don't really like the feeling of being rushed out of a restaurant or waiting 30+minutes for a table unless the place is to-die-for. Glad we lucked out on being seated immediately because us grandmas eat at 5:30pm. :) Bravo, CPK, you've changed my view of you. Thank you to my friend who chose this place. I'll def be back!

2 stars for the service 1 star for the food 5 stars for the trouble-shooting/problem-solving Average score: 2.67 FOH Experience: HOST EXPERIENCE:  I called ahead and the host that answered the phone was polite and accommodating. I told her that we were a party of 6 with 1 wheelchair patron and a child (that didn't need any high chair or booster). She noted that they were slow and that our party will be taken care of, but would note that we were on our way. We arrive, and the host checks us in and says she had the table set up already for us. We ended up at a long booth and at the end of the table there was a pole in the middle (NOT WHEEL CHAIR ACCESSIBLE LIKE WE REQUESTED) - We asked my cousin if he minded and he said he will just move himself on the booth instead.  SERVER EXPERIENCE: Our server was a young lady who was polite. Proper server etiquette is to accommodate the children first as they are they hardest customers to please. When she dropped off all the adult drinks she did mention, "I will be right back with that chocolate milk, I will make it from scratch." Which I believe that was nice to mention, but still ....  We were still waiting for the rest of our party to arrive, and when they did we kind of sat there for what felt like 15 minutes before the waiter returned. She then took our meal order and drink order (alcoholic beverages). I'm sorry, but I know I do not look over 65 years of age so you should be carding everyone regardless. Not only can you lose your job, but you could also shut down the restaurant. Needless to say, she did not card me - or my cousin who just recently became of age. Regardless if we are old enough to drink for whatever reason, I would like to see some business etiquette displayed.  The appetizer came out at the same time as everything else; except the salad. Which turned out to be mine. Everyone was served while my salad either was not even made yet or was sitting at the window. Took about 5 minutes after everyone else to get the salad to me BOH QUALITY CONTROL: FOOD QUALITY:  (1) Avacado Club Egg Rolls: Good (2) Buffalo Chicken Pizza: Came out COLD (3) Garlic Cream Fettuccine: Good (4) Bianco Flat Bread: Decent (5) Keiki Butter Pasta : COLD - Chicken: Soggy - Microwave kind (6) Quinoa Salad: GOOD - Or so I thought! READ ON FOR WHY!!!!  Other: Our server, who although was nice to us, was presumably off the clock because she did not come to deliver our food (common - that's what an expediter is for so its ok) but we saw her leave the restaurant and then come back and chat it up with the host without checking up on us.  The male who delivered our drinks was the one who took over service. The original girl passed by us and then changed into her regular clothes and then just said thank you and left. Proper etiquette would be to introduce the server that will be taking over so that there is no confusion.  My cousin actually ordered a lemon drop, but didn't realize that ordering it blended wouldn't be the best option. As the server, you should know your menu inside and out including the drink menu. The objective is to up-sale and keep the patron satisfied with minimal returns. Had she asked my cousin what is her taste preference was she could have either suggested a different drink or mentioned that ordering it blended would not provide her with optimal taste. Instead of just saying "yeah we can make it however you like - whatever you like"  We were the last customers of the evening and didn't realize that we were the only ones left in the restaurant. So we got out quick. PROBLEMS THE NEXT DAY: I opened up my quinoa salad ready to chow down since I didn't finish it at the restaurant and then towards the end I look down and I found a small worm that was squished. I know that worms tend to be stuck to salads and that's fine - its more protein, but when I pay $10+ on a salad I expect it to be bug free thank you! MANAGEMENT:  So I called to complain and spoke to a manager who was more than accommodating. She took my complaint seriously, and offered to send a couple of vouchers for a second chance experience. I don't eat here often, but everyone deserves a second chance. ** NOTE: I did not use any names because my reasoning behind my review is not to get anyone fired or to have any one reprimanded personally. The employee is not the only one at fault, if the employees are not performing to the standard of the company it could only mean that the training is not sufficient enough. I did NOT tell the manager that I spoke with that the young lady did not card myself or my cousin because that could lead to immediate termination. Although ethically speaking I should have, I gave her a pass because she seemed as if she throughly enjoyed her job and that should be appreciated.

2 stars for the service 1 star for the food 5 stars for the trouble-shooting/problem-solving Average score: 2.67 FOH Experience: HOST EXPERIENCE:  I called ahead and the host that answered the phone was polite and accommodating. I told her that we were a party of 6 with 1 wheelchair patron and a child (that didn't need any high chair or booster). She noted that they were slow and that our party will be taken care of, but would note that we were on our way. We arrive, and the host checks us in and says she had the table set up already for us. We ended up at a long booth and at the end of the table there was a pole in the middle (NOT WHEEL CHAIR ACCESSIBLE LIKE WE REQUESTED) - We asked my cousin if he minded and he said he will just move himself on the booth instead.  SERVER EXPERIENCE: Our server was a young lady who was polite. Proper server etiquette is to accommodate the children first as they are they hardest customers to please. When she dropped off all the adult drinks she did mention, "I will be right back with that chocolate milk, I will make it from scratch." Which I believe that was nice to mention, but still ....  We were still waiting for the rest of our party to arrive, and when they did we kind of sat there for what felt like 15 minutes before the waiter returned. She then took our meal order and drink order (alcoholic beverages). I'm sorry, but I know I do not look over 65 years of age so you should be carding everyone regardless. Not only can you lose your job, but you could also shut down the restaurant. Needless to say, she did not card me - or my cousin who just recently became of age. Regardless if we are old enough to drink for whatever reason, I would like to see some business etiquette displayed.  The appetizer came out at the same time as everything else; except the salad. Which turned out to be mine. Everyone was served while my salad either was not even made yet or was sitting at the window. Took about 5 minutes after everyone else to get the salad to me BOH QUALITY CONTROL: FOOD QUALITY:  (1) Avacado Club Egg Rolls: Good (2) Buffalo Chicken Pizza: Came out COLD (3) Garlic Cream Fettuccine: Good (4) Bianco Flat Bread: Decent (5) Keiki Butter Pasta : COLD - Chicken: Soggy - Microwave kind (6) Quinoa Salad: GOOD - Or so I thought! READ ON FOR WHY!!!!  Other: Our server, who although was nice to us, was presumably off the clock because she did not come to deliver our food (common - that's what an expediter is for so its ok) but we saw her leave the restaurant and then come back and chat it up with the host without checking up on us.  The male who delivered our drinks was the one who took over service. The original girl passed by us and then changed into her regular clothes and then just said thank you and left. Proper etiquette would be to introduce the server that will be taking over so that there is no confusion.  My cousin actually ordered a lemon drop, but didn't realize that ordering it blended wouldn't be the best option. As the server, you should know your menu inside and out including the drink menu. The objective is to up-sale and keep the patron satisfied with minimal returns. Had she asked my cousin what is her taste preference was she could have either suggested a different drink or mentioned that ordering it blended would not provide her with optimal taste. Instead of just saying "yeah we can make it however you like - whatever you like"  We were the last customers of the evening and didn't realize that we were the only ones left in the restaurant. So we got out quick. PROBLEMS THE NEXT DAY: I opened up my quinoa salad ready to chow down since I didn't finish it at the restaurant and then towards the end I look down and I found a small worm that was squished. I know that worms tend to be stuck to salads and that's fine - its more protein, but when I pay $10+ on a salad I expect it to be bug free thank you! MANAGEMENT:  So I called to complain and spoke to a manager who was more than accommodating. She took my complaint seriously, and offered to send a couple of vouchers for a second chance experience. I don't eat here often, but everyone deserves a second chance. ** NOTE: I did not use any names because my reasoning behind my review is not to get anyone fired or to have any one reprimanded personally. The employee is not the only one at fault, if the employees are not performing to the standard of the company it could only mean that the training is not sufficient enough. I did NOT tell the manager that I spoke with that the young lady did not card myself or my cousin because that could lead to immediate termination. Although ethically speaking I should have, I gave her a pass because she seemed as if she throughly enjoyed her job and that should be appreciated.
Pretty standard food. Same in L.A. same in Chicago. Decemt service and was easy given all the work I had to do running around setting up business partnerships.  Quick stable reliable.
Pretty standard food. Same in L.A. same in Chicago. Decemt service and was easy given all the work I had to do running around setting up business partnerships.  Quick stable reliable.

Being from California, this is one of the last places I really wanted to go to after moving here. But my boyfriend got a CPK gift card for Christmas, and so here we are. Their pizzas and flatbreads really are delicious. I especially liked the Spicy Chicken Chipotle. But it is a bit of money for thin-crust pizza. I got their Mushroom Sausage, which was a bit of a mistake. While delicious, I felt like it was a waste getting a type of pizza I could get anywhere else for cheaper. The Spicy Chicken Chipotle, on the other hand, is pretty unique and worth getting. Oh, and if you download the CPK app for iPhone or Android and register for their rewards program, you get a free small plate which includes their flatbreads.

This review was going to be another 1-star, but CPK management and an awesome server saved the day! CPK frequently advertises their call-ahead function, where you can call about an hour before your party wants to eat and be added to the waiting list. It is a consolation since they do not take reservations. After hearing about it for some time, I decided to try it. My relatives were in town so we had a large party of 9. Crazy on a Friday night. I called ahead at 6:30pm and said we wanted to come in around 7:30. The hostess seemed confused at the thought of a call ahead and transferred me to her manager, who also had a slight attitude problem. Anywho, an hour to get together a table, no sweat right? Welllllll we waited until after 8:00pm. We kept checking on the table and they said the people at "our table" were taking a while to leave. I don't know how restaurants work, so I was understanding but increasingly hangry. I didn't appreciate that they kept making excuses, and the hostesses seemed irritated that they had to accommodate such a large party. The manager eventually offered us drinks, but it was a little too late. When we were finally seated, all of us were a little irked. However, the manager started us off with complimentary appetizers. Honestly for a restaurant that is so busy that they don't need to take reservations, I did not expect such hospitality from the manager. He also came back during dinner to make sure we were doing okay. Our server was very charismatic and accommodating as well. She didn't make a fuss at all when we asked to split the check three ways. Overall, I left appreciative of the management who took accountability for the mishap and did whatever possible to remedy the situation. I wouldn't rely on call ahead in the future though. Just expect a wait and enjoy some shopping.

We were going to go to Mai Tai Bar for some pupus but they were packed so we decided to go over to CPK at Ala Moana.  Although it was busy we were able to get seating at the bar where you can see them making the pizza.  Although it seemed like someone had just finished eating and the counter wasn't clean yet they fixed that up in a beat.  Our server was super friendly and got our drinks quick.  Once we ordered the food came quick as well.  I was up for dessert which our server did a good job explaining the different types.  I went with the strawberry shortcake and ice cream.  Once we finished up I was impressed by the manager who came over and gave us a couple of coupon cards for our next visit.  I have to say from start to finish our experience was excellent.

On a Friday evening, I expected a little bit of a wait but with relative from out of town that don't have a CPK, you have to give in.  We did the call ahead thing - that was useless.  We still waited one hour.  When we tried to inquire about the table, we were made to feel like we were lucky that they were even giving us one.  Really those girls that work in the front have a power trip of some kind.  They need to get off their high horse because they are in the service industry.  We called at 6:30 and were told 7:30 and didn't get seated until 8:45.    As the mom of the group I kept quiet until I couldn't take it anymore and at the end after waiting for one hour and our table being given away several times, I had it out with them being told that they had customers to wait on.  I reminded her that we were customers too that had been waiting for more than one hour.  I told her to get the manager right away.  This was like the third time we requested the manager. The manager came and he handled it very well.  He apologized and it was done very well.  I recognize him as someone from the industry for a long time and he was very professional and courteous.  I give him 5 stars for how he handled it.  We were finally seated about 15 minutes later and were given comp appetizers from the manager.  That was nice but the table was cramped and pushed up against the window so very uncomfortable for the people with their backs to the window. The food was 4 stars and the service was 5 stars - I forgot her name but she was excellent.  But all in all the evening was pretty much ruined because we could not go shopping and it took us 3.5 hours to have dinner of which only one hour was actually sitting down and eating. Unfortunate as this is one of my favorite places to eat.

Horrible service,  I always seem to have a problem coming to CPK at this location. The host (kevin or something.  Real local looking guy with long hair in a bun) said it would be a 15 minute. Not bad for about 1 o clock with a party of two. 20 minutes later I went to double check where we were on the list; turns out they past our name.  Our buzzer did not go off, nor did I receive a phone call. The host apologized and promised that we would recieve the next available table, we were only a party of two so it didnt seem like it would be a long wait. Another 20 minutes went by and STILL NO BUZZ OR PHONE CALL. I checked again and turns out the host forgot. We were seated immediately, however we recieved no help or water for over 10 minutes. Our server (Tiff, i think) did not seem interested in helping us at all. She took our orders and did not return until our waters were empty for 10 minutes. The only employee that should be working here is Noel.  After delivering our food, we requested for more bread... And he brought us our bread!  At least CPK got our orders right. Bottom line is we will not be returning.

CPK has always been a favorite destination of mine and my friends. We come to this location quite often, and even some of the staff recognizes us. Today, when my friend and I came for lunch, we both ordered the California Club Sandwich with the herb/cheese bread. Upon receiving our order, my friend noticed that there were fiber-like hairs on top of her sandwich.  This happened to her last time as well. When that happened, our waiter told his manager and she came by our table, and was being very nice and offered to take it off our check and even gave us a free dessert.  Now this time, when we told our waitress she said she would talk to her manager and the kitchen staff. She came back from speaking with someone in the kitchen, to tell us that they use towels to hold the bread when they cut it (Gross, what if their kitchen staff uses their sweaty hands to cut the bread?! Their sweat would seep through these towels and contaminate our meal.) the manager didn't approach us until we asked our server where he was. This time, a male manager came by, and was being rude, telling us we "weren't technically eating towel" and how he could barely even see it (it was still there and it was still gross regardless if he could "see it" or not). He didn't offer us anything!

I have always loved the food at cpk! Recently we had Devon as our server and he was amazing!! Really informative and attentive! He also recommended the butter cake which I never had before and now I can't imagine living without it! Food & service is five stars!!! Thanks Devon!

Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip . Spinach Artichoke Dip.  In case you haven't tried it, that's my Always must order !  The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped, Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Hawaiian BBQ Chicken, California Club, are Must. Their appetizer: bread with balsamic vinegar and oil it's really good too ! Server Chase gave good recommendation, helpful and fast.

Last night my friend and I went to CPK for a drink after shopping. We didn't expect much just a casual drink after the stores closed, but, WOW, the service was amazing. We sat at the bar and were taken care of by several people. Sara and Devon were outstanding. They were so attentive, cheerful and they recommended delicious food and drink options! They really made an average night so fun!! Mahalo!

Me and my wifey had a great evening at cpk. Great food and great customer service. Our server had blonde hair and glasses. And my girl said she was on point the whole time
Me and my wifey had a great evening at cpk. Great food and great customer service. Our server had blonde hair and glasses. And my girl said she was on point the whole time

Great food as usual and tonight we has exceptional service from Joey. Our drinks were refilled before we even realized they were almost empty. Our food was hot and served in record time. We were also happy to only have to wait about 10 minutes on Friday night for a table of 5. I would highly recommend going here.

Great food as usual and tonight we has exceptional service from Joey. Our drinks were refilled before we even realized they were almost empty. Our food was hot and served in record time. We were also happy to only have to wait about 10 minutes on Friday night for a table of 5. I would highly recommend going here.

My last review did little justice to my favorite restaurant. I love the Ala Moana location, not only do they offer one hour call ahead, but this restaurant is in the perfect spot to watch the fireworks on a Friday night.  Although this place can get quite busy, I've never received bad service or left this place hungry. I've never had anything here I haven't liked, pizza, salads, and even their appetizers are delicious! I like to explore their menu, they say if you try something new and you don't like it, they'll replace it with one of your regulars - no pressure!  I don't really have any complaints. For a chain restaurant, they really exceed my expectations. I love CPK and I swear we visit this place at least once a week.

I usually try to avoid CPK because I'm not really a *huge* fan of the food here, but since I just came back from South Korea and only ate Korean food for an entire year, I thought a change in flavor would do me some good. My friends and I were also looking for happy hour specials at other places but we just missed most of them and decided to just eat and drink here. We called ahead of time to ask how long the wait was for a group of four and were told that it would take about half an hour. We placed our names on the waiting list and headed towards the Ala Moana location. All four of us arrived, parked, and walked over to CPK in less than ten minutes and were seated about five minutes after we arrived. Once we sat down and were given our menus, our friendly server asked us if we wanted to start off with anything to drink and if we had any special requests at the time. All four of us ordered a glass of Blue Moon and asked for their complimentary bread (+additional servings). In less than five minutes, our server came back with our drinks and with enough bread for two rounds per person. We all ordered appetizers and our own dinner dishes after our server came back with more complimentary bread. We all shared the Spinach Artichoke Dip and I ordered myself a plate of Pesto Cream Penne with chicken. The Spinach Artichoke Dip is really nothing special; I felt like I could buy the same flavor at Don Quijote or some other supermarket. The Pesto Cream Penne was alright, but I could have sworn that I only counted four pieces of chicken. I paid $3.00 for four pieces of chicken. The portions for everything we ordered were either standard or on the larger side. I even had to ask for a take-out container for the pasta that I left over (which was about half the plate because I ate way too much starch here, whoops). My opinion remains the same about CPK -- I just can't find what some people find so amazing about the food here. I gave this location four stars because our server was friendly and energetic, came back constantly to check up on us, engaged in conversation with us from time to time, and gave us advice about what we should and shouldn't order. Apparently the flatbread dishes right now are on the smaller side for two people to share.

I always dread coming to cpk amc, so when my best friend asked me to meet her I was hesitant. BUT, we were seated within 5min (I think we was lucky cause someone left and we walked in). Anyways, the food is always on point. We always get the spinach dip as appetizer. The girl Who helped us was Maile (not sure on spelling, sorry girl) and she was awesome. She was on point, grabbing our orders and helping us with our drinks, refills and clearing plates. I wanted to try the new strawberry mango cooler (which everyone should try) but it's a virgin drink so I asked her what alcohol would go great and she didn't know but went the extra mile to ask her boss or whoever was in the front and they recommended mango rum. The drink was divine  I would have stayed and had like 3more but I had to work early. Oh and Tiffany was very nice, she greeted us at our table (even though she wasn't our waitress, she was standing next to our table I think ) and talked to us for a good 5min. I don't know about you guys but I like going to places and the people working are interactive and talk to their clients. The vibe was good, food was good, service was good, compared to cpk Pearl ridge (service wasn't like this). Def changed my mind about this place.  Thank you Maile, Tiffany and that boss lady in the black and brown blouse.  I will be coming back!!

the service at the bar was amazing!  probably because it was overseen by the front of the house manager.  the rest of the place was not that great.  the people who worked at the host stand looked really frazzled and were messing up big time on peoples place in line but over all, they do a good job expecially being that they are always slammed.

A good place to go for quick lunchtime meals...if you sit at the counter. When the noontime rush arrives, expect to wait awhile for a table. The prices are a little bit high, and some of the dishes seem a bit over salted, but there are plenty of lower-fat options, as well. If you sit a the counter, the bar tending and wait staff will give you very friendly, personalized service.

Celebrating birthday lunches with the office is no easy task for an establishment, at least in my opinion. You often have numerous issues, food takes too long, can't split the check, etc etc etc. Believe me, I've stopped eating at certain establishments because of how they handled our group.  That didn't happen here at CPK! We were warmly greeted by several staff upon our arrival. I was told they don't take reservations but we could call in our orders before arriving. 18 of us came in at lunch, were promptly seated near a window and given drink menus by our server, Kona. He was an awesome server who seemed to really enjoy what he was doing, always making sure drinks were filled and orders were put in quickly. Needed more sauce? No problem. More bread? It's coming right out. Want a refill on your drink? He already had it in hand. Kona restored my faith in CPK as a place to eat at...and I'm sad to know his last day was today. Hopefully the staff can keep up the good work and service that he showed today.  As soon as our drinks were brought out, the food was being placed in front of us. The servers all seemed to help each other out and there wasn't very long of a wait for everyone to get their dishes. I ordered the half sized portion of roasted veggie salad. I originally wanted it with chicken but couldn't justify paying $4 extra bringing my half portion salad to cost $15. Overall, the salad was tasty and quite filling for a half portion.  The only reason I can't give CPK 5 stars was the prices seem a little high for me and the wait for our bill was a bit long. I think they forgot about me for a while as I was the last one to receive my bill only after we pointed out that I didn't receive it.  Overall, I wouldn't mind coming here again and hope that they can maintain their level of service as it was very impressive :)

First of all I made a yelp account just to comment on the wonderful service I received. I think my waitresses' name was Sharoness or Ness. Well anyway I ordered the shrimp scampi zucchini fettuccine and the lemon was a bit over powering for my taste. I'm not the type of person to complain but when Ness came over to check on us she could instinctively tell I didn't like it and offered to order something else. I've never sent back food before just because I didn't like it. I guess I'm paranoid people will mess with my food if I send it back,  but Ness was very professional, personable, and she knew how to do her job well. Of course the shrimp scampi was comped and I didn't feelso embarrassed so i ordered the Kung pao spaghetti which I absolutely loved. So thank you to  Ness at cpk for the excellent service and making me feel comfortable and taken care of.

Great place to catch a quick lunch. If you do, try to get a seat at the bar and look for Jenski (everyone here has a nickname on their name tag). She's funny and quick witted, and that's half the experience here.

Great place to catch a quick lunch. If you do, try to get a seat at the bar and look for Jenski (everyone here has a nickname on their name tag). She's funny and quick witted, and that's half the experience here.

CPK has always been a favorite destination of mine and my friends.  I went around 4'o'clock and there was no wait.  I ordered the same thing I get almost every time I come here, the California Club Sandwich w/ chicken on the herb-cheese bread.  Upon receiving my order, I noticed that there were hair-like fibers on top of my sandwich.   This same scenario happened to me about two or three weeks ago at this exact location.  At the time, I told my waiter (I think his name was Chase) and he apologized about it and called his manager over.  I'm not sure what her name was, but she was very nice.  She saw that there were these hairs on the bread and took the meal off our check and even gave us a dessert for free.   Today when I had told my waitress, she said that she would talk about it with her manager and even the cooks in the back.  She came back to tell us that they use a towel to hold the hot bread while cutting it.  I was a little grossed out about this (Who knows how many times they have washed that towel, or even if people's sweaty hands have touched the towel that touches my bread).  She offered to get us another meal (Not on the house), but I refused politely because I was very hungry so I didn't eat the portion of the sandwich that had the hair on it.  She told me that she would get her manager to come over, but after 5-10 minutes, he wasn't coming so I had to remind her to get her manager.  When he came by the table, I had recognized him from the last time I was there (The first scenario about two/three weeks ago).  In that previous scenario, I remember him only because he was being rude to my friend and I when I nicely asked him what he had just served to the table next to us and what was in the dish.   So when he had showed up at our table this time, he asked me where the hair-like fiber was and I showed him.  When my friend told him "That is basically like eating parts of a towel", he said "No, it isn't basically eating parts of a towel." He then proceeded to tell us that he could "barely see it" (Regardless if he could barely see it, it was still there which still made it gross!) The whole time speaking to us, he was being rude once again.  He offered to get us another meal (Again, not for free) but we refused.  My friend and I were both very irritated.   After leaving our table, we got looks from the other workers as my friend and I were talking about the situation.  Even our waitress and her shadow seemed very awkward talking to us after everything had happened.  We saw the manager speaking to the head cook (I'm assuming?) right near us which I thought was rude, 1) To be speaking about the matter right by our table.  I didn't get his name (which I should have) but he had short black hair and a beard/mustache.   One reason why I assumed he was being rude was because we are teenagers.  Just because we're teenagers doesn't mean people can treat us like that.  We're customers regardless, and I'm sure that the manager wouldn't speak rudely to other, older customers.   After this incident happening twice, I am never coming to this CPK location again.  The towel thing disgusted me but so did the service of the manager and the other waiters/waitresses.  I have eaten the California Club Sandwich probably twenty or thirty times before, and now that I think about it, there were probably pieces of towels on those sandwiches too.  I hope the manager and the other waiters and waitresses see this so they know what not to do.  If I ever do come to this CPK again and it happens once more, I will be very disappointed and will have to speak with the other managers about who they promote and who they hire.

Service is always friendly here! I love their BBQ chopped salad! This is the only place that I will go intentionally for the salad! Fried Macaroni and cheese, meh I'll pass on that the next time. Bf had fish taco which he liked!

Service is on point! Ambience is modern, welcoming, lively and the place is clean! Prices are high but just about everything here is above par so it's worth it. We ordered dumplings, pepperoni pizza (they are small, good for lunch but personal size if you're eating for dinner) and ordered another, white pizza, because we were still hungry. Food was good! Drinks were refilled before we were finished. I love that! Multiple waiters checked in to make sure everything was going well. I love that too! The tiramisu wasn't authentic but it was pretty good. Next time we know to order another meal, maybe pasta along with a pizza. They have a good sized menu so finding something good shouldn't be a problem. See you soon CPK!

On a Friday evening, I expected a little bit of a wait but with relative from out of town that don't have a CPK, you have to give in.  We did the call ahead thing - that was useless.  We still waited one hour.  When we tried to inquire about the table, we were made to feel like we were lucky that they were even giving us one.  Really those girls that work in the front have a power trip of some kind.  They need to get off their high horse because they are in the service industry.  We called at 6:30 and were told 7:30 and didn't get seated until 8:45.    As the mom of the group I kept quiet until I couldn't take it anymore and at the end after waiting for one hour and our table being given away several times, I had it out with them being told that they had customers to wait on.  I reminded her that we were customers too that had been waiting for more than one hour.  I told her to get the manager right away.  This was like the third time we requested the manager. The manager came and he handled it very well.  He apologized and it was done very well.  I recognize him as someone from the industry for a long time and he was very professional and courteous.  I give him 5 stars for how he handled it.  We were finally seated about 15 minutes later and were given comp appetizers from the manager.  That was nice but the table was cramped and pushed up against the window so very uncomfortable for the people with their backs to the window. The food was 4 stars and the service was 5 stars - I forgot her name but she was excellent.  But all in all the evening was pretty much ruined because we could not go shopping and it took us 3.5 hours to have dinner of which only one hour was actually sitting down and eating. Unfortunate as this is one of my favorite places to eat.

The servers all seemed to help each other out and there wasn't very long of a wait for everyone to get their dishes. I ordered the half sized portion of roasted veggie salad. I originally wanted it with chicken but couldn't justify paying $4 extra bringing my half portion salad to cost $15. Overall, the salad was tasty and quite filling for a half portion.  The only reason I can't give CPK 5 stars was the prices seem a little high for me and the wait for our bill was a bit long. I think they forgot about me for a while as I was the last one to receive my bill only after we pointed out that I didn't receive it.  Overall, I wouldn't mind coming here again and hope that they can maintain their level of service as it was very impressive :)

5 stars for Matt!  He wasn't our server but he helped my friend and me with our iced tea and lemonade refills and got us extra sauces and limes for our BBQ chicken salad.  The food was delicious as always but next time we want Matt as our server, ours couldn't be found for most of our meal.

5 stars for Matt!  He wasn't our server but he helped my friend and me with our iced tea and lemonade refills and got us extra sauces and limes for our BBQ chicken salad.  The food was delicious as always but next time we want Matt as our server, ours couldn't be found for most of our meal.

Wow, I'm surprised I haven't wrote any reviews for CPK. Whenever I'm at Ala Moana, I usually come here for lunch or dinner. Lunch time is usually not bad because it's not really busy, but dinner time is horrible! You can't make any reservations as well, so you're pretty much lucky, or stuck with waiting. If you're stuck, I recommend (if you are of age) to just kill some time at Mai Tais next door.  Over the years there has been many changes with CPKs menu. One major change (which I dislike very much) is the what they do with their Wild Mushroom pizza!!! I spoke with multiple servers on different occasions if I could have the pizza cooked how it "used to be". Sometimes the servers are useless and say they can't because they are either lazy, or the kitchen is lazy. On one occasion I spoke with the main manager and he explained that they are going on a "healthier" route with some of the pizzas, so the mushrooms on the Wild Mushroom pizza is not sautéed anymore and are raw and fresh along with the other vegetables. He had them cook it how they did before though, it was really nice of him! There was another time when me and my friend was having dinner and in her pizza she found..... OMG I was freaking out when she was like she bit into something... luckily it wasn't a bug.... BUT it was kind of just as gross, it was cardboard..... WTF CARDBOARD? It really made me think, why is there cardboard in the pizza?? Is the pizza previously frozen or something? Because I know CPK has their frozen pizzas they sell at the market. LOL... idk but my friend is one of "those" customers who went straight for the main manager, who was the same guy that helped us before (he's really nice) and he apologized and our meal was on the house lol. He even said we could order dessert, and of course that is what we did. They made another pizza and our dinner was comp'd. Now this is how a business should be run. There aren't many places that do these types of things, but that is why I've been a returning customer for all these years. I mean their food is alright, but it's because of that one managers service.

The food was good,but the service was awful. It was a bad experience unlike our experience at the Kahala Mall location ,where we enjoyed both the service and food. We weren't satisfied because once they seated us,it was like they totally forgot about us and we needed to get a manager to have someone take our order which they did an hour later and our drinks were terrible!!! Never order a drink with mint leaves in it because it was rotten!!! Also our appetizers came during the meal and my little niece age 5 was getting fussy because of such a long wait to be served. The feeling of being ignored and given such poor service is my reason for a horrible review!!!

Today it was very annoying, serivce wise.  1. I called an hour before we arrived to this restaurant so that we can put in the wait list. However, they told us that they will call us once a table is ready. It has been 20 minutes but no one called us about our table and so we decided to follow up and it turns out that they have FORGOTTEN! I mean what is the point of doing an hr ahead call if they would forget about their customers. That was just plain unorganized. we arrived at 6:30pm and we got seated almost at 7pm  2. as we were seated, the guy who served us DID NOT made us feel like we are acknowledge or even asking "how is everything going", this server is just plain rude, as in as soon as he handed the food, he just walks away as if he is in the hurry which makes us felt that he did not really want to serve us. In other words, he was NOT really around whneever we need to have a refill, we had to asked other servers to do the work for him. Overall, this person almost ruined our dinner by his fucking atittude, lacking of customer service skills. I am very disappointed to get this experience. Usually, servers here will be more welcoming and I would always come here cause of the great food. I do not think I would be coming back here soon, I am sorry!

To keep this short and sweet, our server was mediocre. Not fantastic, not terrible. I had to remind d him three times that I had ordered water and I get the feeling that he kind. of blew off our table via lack of attention. I'm glad we didn't get apps bc every table near us that did had gotten theirs when their entries came out. To me, that's bad form. I don't want to starve over the little bit of bread they give you until all of my food comes out at once and the servers try to squeeze all the plates on the table. The major fault of this place that I found was that both myself and my husband got horribly sick from eating here. We both had ordered the cali cllub/cob/whatever salad, only his was in his pizza. The good thing about this place is that at least their bathrooms are semi decent. Unfortunately I had to observe this while I was blowing chunks.

I love the BBQ chicken salad with avocado.   The service has been good so far, no complaints.

Above and beyond! CPK manager noticed that the screw in my eye glasses was popping out. He pulled a screwdriver from his pocket and quickly repaired them! Our party of 3 went on to have the most enjoyable and delicious lunch!! Everything was perfect!

I lit-trally haven't been here in years cause I never liked this place. BUT, wouldn't turn down a friend's request to dine here, since it's her fave place and it was her bday. Ok ok, we'll give it a chance.  First of all, when I checked in on Yelp, I noticed that if you sign up for their rewards program, you get a free "small plate". LOVE free stuff! Seriously sign up for the "pizza dough" rewards card!  The server promptly came to our table and was SO helpful in telling us how to download the apps on our phones to redeem the rewards (my friend also got a free dessert on her card!) and that he would split our checks since normally only one card can be used. Awesome! For the small plate, we got the Crispy Mac N Cheese (reg $4.95 but we got it for free) - YUM. It came with 3 balls of fried, breaded, mac n cheese. Not oily at all, perfectly crisp with a melty inside. Spinach Artichoke Dip ($10.95) - um, dah, you need to get this. Who doesn't order this when coming to CPK? Warm, melted cheese, spinach, artichoke... yeah. I ordered the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza (minus the sausage cause I'm not a fan of tubed meat $16-something?? because i added TRUFFLE OIL which was an additional $1.50) - besides what toppings is obviously on this pizza, it had fresh basil mmm. holy hannah, I LOVE truffle oil and so glad they offer it as an add-on for only $1.50. Other pizza places I've gone to charge up to $3 for this. yikes. Their pizza was surprisingly delish! I used to hate (really, hate) their pizzas before but I feel like they've really improved and I totally would come back!! Our server was so helpful and attentive.  The only downside is it gets bananas-busy! Gross - I don't really like the feeling of being rushed out of a restaurant or waiting 30+minutes for a table unless the place is to-die-for. Glad we lucked out on being seated immediately because us grandmas eat at 5:30pm. :) Bravo, CPK, you've changed my view of you. Thank you to my friend who chose this place. I'll def be back!

Horrible service,  I always seem to have a problem coming to CPK at this location. The host (kevin or something.  Real local looking guy with long hair in a bun) said it would be a 15 minute. Not bad for about 1 o clock with a party of two. 20 minutes later I went to double check where we were on the list; turns out they past our name.  Our buzzer did not go off, nor did I receive a phone call. The host apologized and promised that we would recieve the next available table, we were only a party of two so it didnt seem like it would be a long wait. Another 20 minutes went by and STILL NO BUZZ OR PHONE CALL. I checked again and turns out the host forgot. We were seated immediately, however we recieved no help or water for over 10 minutes. Our server (Tiff, i think) did not seem interested in helping us at all. She took our orders and did not return until our waters were empty for 10 minutes. The only employee that should be working here is Noel.  After delivering our food, we requested for more bread... And he brought us our bread!  At least CPK got our orders right. Bottom line is we will not be returning.
This is my favorite place when i go to mall and the only down part is the waiting time, i think they can acomidate more people if they change their seating set up.
This is my favorite place when i go to mall and the only down part is the waiting time, i think they can acomidate more people if they change their seating set up.
Big fan of this place and would go back there again, their pizza rocks, try to go there not in rush time because you need to wait outside and to me that was the only down side.

Pizza was great service was good. The pizza was hawaiian and I usually don't like the ham on Hawaiians but this was really good ham... Tasted a little bacony.  They were a little busy but nothing offensive.

Pizza was great service was good. The pizza was hawaiian and I usually don't like the ham on Hawaiians but this was really good ham... Tasted a little bacony.  They were a little busy but nothing offensive.

My go to items at CPK are garlic cream fettuccine with shrimp, Thai crunch salad and kung pao spaghetti with shrimp. The garlic cream fettuccine is amaaaazing. I love that it's a balance of both garlic and cream, plus I never leave with a garlicky breath.  The Thai crunch salad is my favorite! The peanut cilantro dressing is yummy. The kung pao spaghetti was a recent find for me. I love how interesting the combination of flavors with the texture of the spaghetti noodles is.

CPK !!! Need I say more. Who doesn't enjoy the multiple varieties of pizza. Anything from the very simple cheese to the somewhat complex chicken BBQ.  They do offer a wide assortment of pupus and pastas as well.  Location is great. Tons of parking. Service was adequate, nothing special. Prices are high, but it is the mall. It's popular, so expect a wait. **** It's where my wife and I went on our first date ****  Nuff said
Great "healthy" menu and options.  Service was good considering the crowd.

A bit disappointed.. For a table for two, my other half and I were given a buzzer and was told the wait was 10-15 minutes, which was fine. Two minutes later our buzzer beeps so we transfer from the outside bench to the line at the hostess. Two-parties of two(couples) got seated before us.. Right in front of our face!!!!! And now we have a crappy table while they have an amazing booth for just simply walking in.... LIKE ALRIGHT.... That's why I stay at the pearlridge one because at least they have better manners

Although this mall is a cluser f17ck, this is my favorite CPK location on the island. We always get the works pizza and pasta. Nothing special about the salads. Eat here if you don't want to feel totally disgusted with yourself after binging on pizza. Our wait is never long, consistent service, and great for groups.

I have always loved the food at cpk! Recently we had Devon as our server and he was amazing!! Really informative and attentive! He also recommended the butter cake which I never had before and now I can't imagine living without it! Food & service is five stars!!! Thanks Devon!

location: Union Square, San Francisco, United States
review: CPK has always been a favorite destination of mine and my friends. We come to this location quite often, and even some of the staff recognizes us. Today, when my friend and I came for lunch, we both ordered the California Club Sandwich with the herb/cheese bread. Upon receiving our order, my friend noticed that there were fiber-like hairs on top of her sandwich.  This happened to her last time as well. When that happened, our waiter told his manager and she came by our table, and was being very nice and offered to take it off our check and even gave us a free dessert.  Now this time, when we told our waitress she said she would talk to her manager and the kitchen staff. She came back from speaking with someone in the kitchen, to tell us that they use towels to hold the bread when they cut it (Gross, what if their kitchen staff uses their sweaty hands to cut the bread?! Their sweat would seep through these towels and contaminate our meal.) the manager didn't approach us until we asked our server where he was. This time, a male manager came by, and was being rude, telling us we "weren't technically eating towel" and how he could barely even see it (it was still there and it was still gross regardless if he could "see it" or not). He didn't offer us anything!
Big fan of this place and would go back there again, their pizza rocks, try to go there not in rush time because you need to wait outside and to me that was the only down side.

The food was mediocre and service was CRAP. They say us by the check out table an had those servers talking coughing laughing all WAAAY louder then my 2 youngsters.  I had to ask for Napkins more water etc....  They brought my 2 kids food 20 mins before our came out. The male servers was nice an smiled but that wasn't enough :-/ my daughters spiral mac an cheese was under cook. But my sons said there pizza was ONO. In all that was quite disappointing

Our waiter burtek we've had a few times always polite, fast , and accurate. Food is really good. Service here is good.

Call me crazy but I came here with a group of 18 for dinner! As we all know, CPK doesn't take reservations so it was definitely a risky dinner choice for such a large group. However, we gambled and we won so woohoo! So how did we do it? The secret is that you can call one hour ahead and get put on the wait list. The person who answered the phone was super surprised when he heard how many were in the party but quickly recovered and said he would see us soon. So I showed up a 10 minutes before 5pm, checked in with the front staff, and waited for the rest of the group to show up. A long table was all set up and waiting for us so that was awesome. A true test of how well-run a restaurant is, is how well they handle large groups, and I have to say CPK handled us like a pro! We got our drinks in no time at all and I swear our food arrived less than 15 minutes after we had all ordered. Considering how much we all ordered, I was quite impressed. Our drinks were frequently refilled and our waiter was never without a smile. Major props to our waiter, Maikai and the rest of the staff!!! Our group split into small groups to make it easier to order. My small group ordered the shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread, original BBQ chicken chopped salad, wild mushroom pizza on honey wheat dough, and the Sicilian (already on thin crust). Everything was so tasty and it was enough for five of us. My favorite was the Sicilian--this pizza burst with flavor and was so darn delicious. We substituted chicken for salami at no extra cost. I would totally get this again next time I dine at CPK. If you are not a Pizza Dough Rewards member yet, you should sign up! You can do it in person at the restaurant or via the app, which is what I did. I don't come to CPK super often but I am never disappointed whenever I do!

Although California Pizza Kitchen does not take reservations, you can call an hour before to have your party set in an early wait list.   I didn't know this until I actually called CPK Ala Moana and they told me to call an hour before to be wait listed so we wouldn't have to wait for so long.   CPK is a great family restaurant and is always an amazing place to just catch up!

Maybe it's just me... but I'm not convinced, neither am I a fan... service was bleh. Let me tell you about our waitress, she spoke so softly, could barely hear her... my husband and I looked at each other trying to figure out what she just said to us... I swear, she was whispering...  Food: My husband had the California Club Pizza and according to him it was "eh? I've had better". I, on the other hand, ordered the bolognese spaghetti. It was dry, needed a whole lot more of their meat sauce.  Seriously... it was really dry...  Service: Besides the fact that our waitress was whispering, service was okay. However, our waitress had stink arm pits!!! When she would refill our water, I always held my breath... it's awful!!! Get a deodorant!!! My search for an awesome pasta and pizza resto continues...

Although very busy, our estimated 30 minute wait was 15 minutes.  We were immediately greeted by Maile (Manager on Duty) who helped the server by taking our orders, helped other tables and made table rounds to make sure guests were satisfied and all needs met!   Great teamwork as servers helped each other bring out the orders to the tables. Maile was a role model and great team leader!  Food consistently great at CPK!

Came here on a Thursday night and there was no wait. Must warn though...come here on the weekends starting around 7 and you'll be waiting a couple minutes. I love all of their foods, but tonight I choose the Thai Crunch Salad. I recommend just getting the half portion of their salads because the full salads seems only a tad bit bigger....not worth $5 more for only a couple of spoonfuls of salad. My salad tonight was great and the chicken was perfect (sometimes the chicken seems a bit raw at other locations).  My server was Joei and she was awesome! She was very nice and we got to use our free small plates (for the CPK awards) with no issues :). She was very clear and patient. I love that.  All in all, come down here if you want a casual dinner with some awesome people. :D

CPK is a great place to hang out and grab some dinner with a group. Appetizers are great and easy to share. Their spinach artichoke dip is a classic and always good.  The only down side is the wait. Sometimes it takes an hour to get a table; however, I think it's worth the wait. Also if you're waiting a long time for your food, the manager sometimes gives you a free dessert. Don't rely on that comment though. It happens rarely.  I would say the Kung Pao Spaghetti is my top favorite. It is a Chinese cuisine, that is perfectly seasoned with the spices and looks phenomenal. Over all CPK is a great family/ group friendly place to have lunch or dine in. Two thumbs up!
The pizzas and pasta here are good but be prepared to wait a long time for a table during peak hours.  Prices are on the high side for what you get.  Typical mall restaurant.
