Good job jai California Pizza Kitchen ala moana team was great the Platinum margarita was great a great diverse team makes it all the more pleasant especially in Hawaii
Good job jai California Pizza Kitchen ala moana team was great the Platinum margarita was great a great diverse team makes it all the more pleasant especially in Hawaii

This is for the folks who grew up with CPK for family dinners, outings with friends, pre or post-movie meals (or during-movie meals if you were clever enough to sneak your CPK takeout into the movie in a big paper bag underneath a jacket). If you and I are anything alike, we both had our faaaaaavorite dishes & did not ever want to try anything new. I loved those plastic-covered menus, cold bread & butter packets (that came in a plastic bag if you got takeout), and the familiarity of it all. Well...yesterday I realized I had let about 5 years pass since I had been to a CPK, and only upon receiving a CPK gift card, had this realization set in. I couldn't wait any longer! I seized this perfect opportunity to use a Sunday afternoon to return to the chain restaurant Mecca! As our meal unfolded, I made a few observations: #1: CPK Ala Moana had been renovated. I'm assuming the others have as well. #2: CPK Ala Moana has a beautiful view of Ala Moana beach! #3: The menus are different....VERY different! Instead of the plastic cased tri-fold menu, they are now paper menus with choices on the two inside panels & the back. There's also a small meals menu. #4: Different (and smaller) menus means different (and less) food! Meaning they took away some of my favorite dishes!!! :( No more portabello mushroom ravioli, no more clam pasta, no more field green salad...just to name a few. :( Of course, they still had some classics like thai chicken pizza, kung pao pasta, and the two in a bowl soup, plus some new additions! #5: They ask you if you want bread, and bring you slices of warm french bread with dipping oil & herbs. A very classy improvement from the cold bread slices we grew up loving. (The old bread was especially good for dipping in the spinach artichoke dip! You know what I'm talking about!) ;) #6: They still give you a bendy straw for your water. :) #7: CPK is still as delicious & awesome as ever!!!!!!

Never did I think that "Rabbit Food" was going to be a staple in my diet, but CPK makes a delicious salad for a great price. This was a bit of a 180 choice, since we planned to go to a pub for Sunday Funday.  How weird is it that most breweries/pubs in Hawaii are not open on a Sunday? Football? Brew'd? REAL? Church? Caramelized Peach Salad (Full) add Chicken: The server was awesome, and she kept the perfect distance from our table that ensured a Funday with my lady. This salad is my go to at CPK and it paired nicely with the beer we desired. (Arrogant Bastard IPA.....shocked they had a good beer)  After, you can continue shopping or head to Mai Tai's for more drinks. Great location for continued success for the rest of your day/night.

BAD SERVICE. Went there for dinner with my family & waited about 10 minutes. We got our menus & utensils , no problem. No Waiter to give us Water or take our drink order. 2 tables close to us came in after us & got their drinks shortly after sitting down. What's up with that?  The Greeter was very apologetic in saying the Waiter didn't know our table was theirs. Went to eat at another place & got GREAT SERVICE.

BAD SERVICE. Went there for dinner with my family & waited about 10 minutes. We got our menus & utensils , no problem. No Waiter to give us Water or take our drink order. 2 tables close to us came in after us & got their drinks shortly after sitting down. What's up with that?  The Greeter was very apologetic in saying the Waiter didn't know our table was theirs. Went to eat at another place & got GREAT SERVICE.

My friends think CPK is my favorite restaurant because I eat here often, but I don't play favorites. And I don't think I eat here that often! To me, CPK is just a last resort because I like their food and I know I won't be disappointed.  I know some people give less stars because they don't like waiting to be seated but I don't think that should be a huge factor (unless your food takes long). Yes, there is almost ALWAYS a wait at any CPK but it's actually not that long of a wait. I would say the wait is about 10~20 minutes average.  When I go to CPK I usually go for the pizzas because 'California PIZZA Kitchen'. I've tried several of their pastas and it's just alright to me. Their pastas are pretty dry. I like my pastas saucey (if that's even a word).  If you want to start with appetizers, you must must must order the Avocado Club Egg Rolls. There are 3 rolls cut in halves so 6 pieces! The rolls are filled with avocado, chicken, tomato, cheese and bacon. They serve it with ranch and ranchito (tastes like chipotle) sauce. I prefer the ranchito over ranch. And I think everyone knows the classic Spinach Artichoke Dip.  For pizzas, I usually order 'The Works' which is basically a supreme pizza. But since you can get that pretty much anywhere else, I would recommend ordering something that's exclusive at CPK. During my last visit here, I ordered the 'White Pizza' with bacon. Just a heads up, this pizza does not have sauce. Instead, it has mozzarella, ricotta, parmesan, pecorino romano, spinach and roasted garlic. I miss their Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza so this is a good alternative to it.  Despite being busy, the service is prompt and attentive. You should also download the CPK Dough Rewards App on your phone. Every $100 you spend, you get $5 off your next visit! I recently used my $5 and I get another $5 off my next visit! It adds up if you frequent CPK like me.

We came in to take advantage of CPK's current Summer Strawberry promotion ($10 discount on purchases over $40) and to make use of my Pizza Dough bonus reward ($5).  Luckily, because our visit was during a weekday, there wasn't the "usual" long wait as we were greeted and seated right away.  We were seated at a great window tabletop that featured views of the Ala Wai Marina and part of Ala Moana Beach Park. Our server, Kirtus, was friendly, energetic and efficient.  I must congratulate him on having such a great memory as he effortlessly took our beverage and food orders without writing it down and delivering our food correctly. I also have to give credit to the kitchen and pantry for pacing the preparation of our meal. We ordered our usual California Cobb Salad, a hand-tossed White Pizza (mozzarella, pecorino, ricotta, Parmesan, Romano with sautéed garlic and spinach) with crisp bacon, iced teas and their featured strawberry shortcake.  Everything was served at peak temperature and the generous flavorful portions were consistent with the other CPK restaurants.   Our bill would have been closer to $50 for the two of us but with the Pizza Dough reward and promotion applied, we paid somewhere around $30.  We received top-notch service, delicious food and a gorgeous view while dining at this location.  I'm glad that I am a Pizza Dough member...why aren't you?

Better go early if you are eating there on the weekends for dinner. This place get really crowded and the wait time can be long. California Pizza Kitchen just changed their menu so they have a bunch of new items. I always get the spinach artichoke dip and Mushroom pizza. Try and check the toilet out after you take a dump the next morning after eating that artichoke dip. Anyways The service is pretty good here and they treat you like family. Prices got raised a little but I guess it is necessary.

Fastest service I had ever experienced! The food was exceptional too. The location was clean and the staff super courteous. I would also like to give a shout-out to our waiter Trevor. On top of the fact that he was super nice, he was super attentive and was always wearing a smile. I will definitely pay another visit real soon :)

Fastest service I had ever experienced! The food was exceptional too. The location was clean and the staff super courteous. I would also like to give a shout-out to our waiter Trevor. On top of the fact that he was super nice, he was super attentive and was always wearing a smile. I will definitely pay another visit real soon :)
It's really rare nowadays to find good service. Well this place has it. Good food, attentive waiters, clean and beautiful establishment. Refreshing to say the very least
It's really rare nowadays to find good service. Well this place has it. Good food, attentive waiters, clean and beautiful establishment. Refreshing to say the very least
Jodi my server was great, food was great, atmosphere was great. Overall, great experience and great tasting food!
Jodi my server was great, food was great, atmosphere was great. Overall, great experience and great tasting food!

Went there for the 1st time the day after Valentine's checked in and the lady told me it'd be 15 minutes to be seated. Gave me the buzzer and actually waited 30-40 minutes till our device buzzed! Other than that the waiter we had was awesome, the wait for the food didn't take very long & I got full from the food because it was good. Good for people who like bread, I'm a rice eater, but definitely will eat there again sometime!

Went there for the 1st time the day after Valentine's checked in and the lady told me it'd be 15 minutes to be seated. Gave me the buzzer and actually waited 30-40 minutes till our device buzzed! Other than that the waiter we had was awesome, the wait for the food didn't take very long & I got full from the food because it was good. Came in for dinner tonite with a party of four. When my food came out it wasn't up to my liking so I asked if they could fix it. To be really honest I was thinking they would just fix it and bring it right back out but they actually made a whole new dish. It took a little while for my dish to come back out but who could be mad when both managers came to the table to apologize and To see how everything was going. This here is what true customer service is and because of this I will be returning back to this location.

Place gets pretty busy so expect to wait. 45 minutes for a table. Food was great and our server Alison was awesome. She was very attentive and provides excellent customer service. Everything on the menu is delicious especially there Spinach Artichoke dip. Overall a great place to dine with a nice view in the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

Place gets pretty busy so expect to wait. 45 minutes for a table. Food was great and our server Alison was awesome. She was very attentive and provides excellent customer service. Everything on the menu is delicious especially there Spinach Artichoke dip. Overall a great place to dine with a nice view in the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

The California Club Pizza is the bomb diggity. It's basically a salad with slices of tomatoes and avocados on top of a cheese and bacon pizza. Just thinking about it makes me want to eat some. But it's 2:44am...so I can't. Boo.  The butter cake is fantastic.The cake is very buttery and is a perfect match with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I can't really describe it besides that it's like eating butter mochi with crunchy sugar granules on top.....with ice cream.  Don't forget your pizza dough rewards! They sometimes send out discounts to incentivise people to stop by.

I enjoy the pizza here. My favorite is definitely the Thai Chicken Pizza is one of my favorite pizza's to order from there. Definitely worth ordering. Your taste buds won't mind. Costumer service is also excellent.

Go figure that we go on vaca to Hawaii and eat at CPK lol...at least they are by the water and we got a window seat with a pretty view....so it didn't seem like we were at a franchise place.  So far, on our vaca this week, CPK has had the best service and didn't screw anything up. We all shared spinach dip, avocado bacon egg rolls (YUM!) and chicken ginger wontons (best out of the 3 appetizers). The frozen mango lemonade was tasty (but pricey at $4.19!) and I got a strawberry drink thingie. My friend got iced tea with free refills. For entrees we got thai pizza, thai salad (full with avocado) and full Caesar salad. Oh, their bread with the pesto Olive oil thingie is to die for. I think it comes with the meal, as we kept asking for refills and they didn't say there was a charge. Dessert was the chocolate cake and velvet cake (chocolate was better). All that was $110 for 3 people. Not an inexpensive meal, but for the amount of food we got, and it was prepared well, we were satisfied. Service was great at this CPK. Tip: ask for the bread and olive oil thingie to go if you have leftovers. We did and we had lunch at our hotel the next day. Yummy!

I called ahead of time to reserve a table between 5:30 6 or 6:30pm they told me it would be 10 to 15 minutes they would give me the next avalible table when I get there I get to the restruant to see if my table is ready in the mean time I was looking at the menu I went back to check if my table was ready they said no and I waited almost 1 hour for a table so I asked to speak to the manager and she said she would find us a table she said I'm sorry about the wait I don't know what happen ill be more then happy to give you a free appatiser or dessert after dinner I asked to see my bill so I could pay for it and we would take our time eating in the mean time the manger said I talked to the people in the front they thought you asked for a menu and were waiting to be seated she apologized again for the confusion but come to find out I payed full price for my meal I was not happy at all with the service

Our server Amanda was amazing and super friendly. Catered to our every need. Great service and great food.
Our server Amanda was amazing and super friendly. Catered to our every need. Great service and great food.

I have been to a few CPKs and Noel gave me the best service my girlfriend and I ever had.  Friendly customer service with a smile.  Checked on my table multiple times,  refills before my drinks were emtpy.  Food was as good as the rest.

I have been to a few CPKs and Noel gave me the best service my girlfriend and I ever had.  Friendly customer service with a smile.  Checked on my table multiple times,  refills before my drinks were emtpy.  Food was as good as the rest.

What I love about CPK... 1. 1 Minute Wait on a Friday night! You can call ahead and get placed on the wait list (don't need to waste time waiting there!) We arrived there and were seated in 1 minute. This is on a busy Friday night! 2. Child Friendly - Their highchairs actually have both straps to buckle it!! Amazing!! Well what's amazing is how many restaurant highchairs have one or none safety belts. Anyways, they have crayons and activity paper to keep kids occupied.  3. But we don't have to be occupied too long, because the food comes FAST!! I swear it's 5 minutes between ordering and receiving our appetizer and salad.  4. Foods consistent in taste from one CPK location to the next. Wish they would bring back the bruschetta though.  Plus buying GC for 20% off at Costco (Sams?) is always extra rewarding!
Great food and good service! Have to try the BBQ Chicken Pizza, Thai Chicken Pizza and Pesto Cream Penne! Also great menu selection for kids.
Great food and good service! Have to try the BBQ Chicken Pizza, Thai Chicken Pizza and Pesto Cream Penne! Also great menu selection for kids.

Our waiter burtek we've had a few times always polite, fast , and accurate. Food is really good. Service here is good.

My recent visit here with my cousin for lunch was great. Our waiter jason was always checking on us & happy. Just a great attitude all around. Need more waiters like him in other restaurants. The food was also awesome as well! The chicken spinach artichoke flatbread pizza & avacado eggrolls are my new FAVE from cpk. Will be back soon to get my free small plate :)

My recent visit here with my cousin for lunch was great. Our waiter jason was always checking on us & happy. Just a great attitude all around. Need more waiters like him in other restaurants. The food was also awesome as well! The chicken spinach artichoke flatbread pizza & avacado eggrolls are my new FAVE from cpk. Will be back soon to get my free small plate :)

The California Club Pizza is the bomb diggity. It's basically a salad with slices of tomatoes and avocados on top of a cheese and bacon pizza. Just thinking about it makes me want to eat some. But it's 2:44am...so I can't. Boo.  The butter cake is fantastic.The cake is very buttery and is a perfect match with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I can't really describe it besides that it's like eating butter mochi with crunchy sugar granules on top.....with ice cream.  Don't forget your pizza dough rewards! They sometimes send out discounts to incentivise people to stop by.

Been coming here for years and there's always a bit of a wait. However the consistency has always been the same so I can't complain. The garlic cream fettuccine is a must! And the spinach artichoke dip if you're extra hungry for an appetizer :)

I always get such great service at CPK. I always get checked up on. My drinks are never pasted half way before they're refilled again. I always get a hello. I always get a good bye AND have a nice day. And I always leave happy.  I live in Waikiki so it's the same distance to the one down the strip or inside the mall but either way I just want that pizza! I ordered the pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom and added the olives. It was just the right amount of everything. My friend had the California Club pizza but he's a bit more of picky eater than I am so he picked off most of the arugula and the avocado. I don't really think he ordered the right thing for himself so he didn't finish it. Our waitress was so friendly. She emitted friendly particles. My expectations of servers are always low and she was like the epitome of how all servers should be. Am I being dramatic? If I were it would only be because she was so awesome. Her name is Sarah, btw.  Last time I was there, we got to sit by the kitchen and see all pizzas come out. It's cool to look at especially with all the pizza boxes right next to it neatly aligned. I wish they delivered. I really do. I wouldn't order delivery from anywhere else if they delivered. My fridge would only be CPK pizza. My husband would be so mad! I would be happy even if my face broke out from a pizza-only diet.  When I lived in Washington there was a CPK across from the mall that I've always looked over and now I regret it. I regret not trying CPK sooner? Yes, I do.

3rd time coming to this location and as I said in my 2nd review I am a forever customer to this location!  Kyle was my server today and he went above and beyond as to what a server should be doing. He was fun and friendly the service was prompt, he always made sure I was happy all while not bothering me too much (of hate being bothered too much) he was a team player with other employees even offering to help them bus tables on his down time all while making sure everyone in his section was taken care of 5 stars to him AND this location.

Never have too much of a problem getting seated even at busy times.  Food is good also usually we get pizzas, a pasta dish, and the spinach artichoke dip (the best!). Their chocolate soufflé with ice cream is also good, but it varies every time I get it--it never looks like the picture ever! Lol but the taste is still there.  They have a rewards program also and you get "pizza dough" rewards ($5) for spending so much. Which is nice if you go there often. Or even if you don't they send you coupons and such once in a while   Never had a problem with the wait staff so far, all have been friendly.

I used to love this cpk.., unfortunately I found the food  so commercial and tasting like cardboard. I hope they improve. Take a little more time in their menu and cooking. Service was good.

The Ala Moana location of CPK is truly one of the busiest in the US.  With that said, there is usually a short wait for a table, longer for larger groups.  If you are going for a special occasion, I would contact them to see if you can make a reservation. The GOOD-The food comes out very quickly.  This makes for a quick turnover of tables, thus your wait time to get seated won't be extremely long.  Service is usually good.  The food is consistent. The BAD-As mentioned it's very busy, especially  during peak dinner hours.  It can be very frenetic and quite loud.  Added to that, the noise by the next door Mai Tai  Bar (CPK leaves the doors open usually).  The tables are quite close together so we are having to speak over the people  sitting next or nearby us.  At times the staff seem overwhelmed by the rush of people. The OVERALL-This CPK is a good dining option at AMC.  Good food and service help make it a decent dining experience for a mall.  I recommend for a quick bite so you can continue with shopping. RECOMMENDED-During the season, the fields  salad is awesome, fresh strawberries and watermelon.  Always a winner is the BBQ chicken pizza.  For a good change up is the California Club pizza.

I used to love this cpk.., unfortunately I found the food  so commercial and tasting like cardboard. I hope they improve. Take a little more time in their menu and cooking. Service was good.

Call me crazy but I came here with a group of 18 for dinner! As we all know, CPK doesn't take reservations so it was definitely a risky dinner choice for such a large group. However, we gambled and we won so woohoo! So how did we do it? The secret is that you can call one hour ahead and get put on the wait list. The person who answered the phone was super surprised when he heard how many were in the party but quickly recovered and said he would see us soon. So I showed up a 10 minutes before 5pm, checked in with the front staff, and waited for the rest of the group to show up. A long table was all set up and waiting for us so that was awesome. A true test of how well-run a restaurant is, is how well they handle large groups, and I have to say CPK handled us like a pro! We got our drinks in no time at all and I swear our food arrived less than 15 minutes after we had all ordered. Considering how much we all ordered, I was quite impressed. Our drinks were frequently refilled and our waiter was never without a smile. Major props to our waiter, Maikai and the rest of the staff!!! Our group split into small groups to make it easier to order. My small group ordered the shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread, original BBQ chicken chopped salad, wild mushroom pizza on honey wheat dough, and the Sicilian (already on thin crust). Everything was so tasty and it was enough for five of us. My favorite was the Sicilian--this pizza burst with flavor and was so darn delicious. We substituted chicken for salami at no extra cost. I would totally get this again next time I dine at CPK. If you are not a Pizza Dough Rewards member yet, you should sign up! You can do it in person at the restaurant or via the app, which is what I did. I don't come to CPK super often but I am never disappointed whenever I do!

Although California Pizza Kitchen does not take reservations, you can call an hour before to have your party set in an early wait list.   I didn't know this until I actually called CPK Ala Moana and they told me to call an hour before to be wait listed so we wouldn't have to wait for so long.   CPK is a great family restaurant and is always an amazing place to just catch up!

I've eaten here many times. Sometimes it's just been me with my two children. Sometimes it's been my husband and I alone. Once or twice I've had out-of-state relatives come along with my family. Mostly it's been just the four of us. I have never had a problem with regardless of which grouping of our family is there for a meal. Most of the time, the servers will take my kids orders first so they can get their food faster. That's excellent customer service, IMHO. The food is not anything stellar, but it is dependable. You want pizza? You can get a decent pizza with a variety of topping combinations. I used to live in NJ when I was growing up. My family bought pizza from a little old Sicilian man who had his shop down the street. I've been to Rome where the pizza crust is made so thin you can eat a whole pie on your own without thinking much about it. CPK pizza is pretty good for being a chain restaurant. I love the salads though. They are my whole reason for eating here. Italian Chopped. Roasted Veggie. California Cobb. Chinese Chicken. They are so good! I'd get one every day if I could. There are two things about this location that bother me. First, if you come at a peak time you might as well walk right on past. We came for lunch once and the wait for a table was 45 minutes. Nope. Second, it's loud. I guess it's just the acoustics of the restaurant itself. But if you are planning to sit and talk with your sweetie or you have a family member who doesn't hear as well as they used to, you might want to order take out instead of sitting in the restaurant.

I never get tired of eating at CPK. It's very conveniently located at Ala Moana Shopping Center on the top floor/center area.  I try to avoid peak food hours (lunch time/dinner) because it does get very busy here.  Went on a Sunday night around 7pm and the wait time wasn't too bad.  I'm guessing it was because the mall closes early on Sundays. I always get the Pesto Penne Pasta and add mushrooms (even though this is not an add on choice on the menu). I also love the White Pizza with bacon.  They also provide you with complimentary bread. Food items are pretty consistent every time and I never ran out of iced tea. I feel as though the wait staff has been getting better and better.  It seems as though they have gotten friendlier over the years and more attentive.

Let me give you a quick run down of how I grew up.  I grew up eating Chinese food.  At home, at the restaurants, at relatives' homes.  That's all I knew.  And I was not happy about it.  My idea of pizza was Pizza Hut, Papajohn's, Dominos, and Sbarros for a long time.  My parents did not care to take me out to any other cuisine other than Chinese food or fast food.   Sometime in late high school, a friend suggested we eat here to celebrate a birthday.  I fell in love with California Pizza Kitchen.  It is one of the earliest restaurants that opened my eyes to what "dining out" truly meant (compared to my childhood, you can see what I mean).  For years and years, I only ordered pizza from here because I LOVED it.  CPK was a treat.  I did not go here for just any reason.  Even after I discovered multitudes of delicious eateries in Hawaii and outside of the islands, I still love CPK.  Even as I slowly grew out of my tendency to eat at chain restaurants and hit up more hole in the walls, I still like it here as a stable option whenever eating with a group. This was the first CPK I ever ate at and in recent years, I have not been paying it enough visits.  This Ala Moana branch is BUSY.  It is CROWDED.  Account for waiting time!  The hosts are friendly, though, but unfortunately, reservations are not accepted.  As others have mentioned, waits can be anywhere from 20-60 minutes.   I came here for one of my birthday dinners this week (as it's the big 3-0, I decided to bring my parents out for something different, aka non-Asian).  The wait was only about 10 minutes since I made my boyfellow go early and put down his name. This time, we only ordered (between the 4 of us): wild mushroom pizza (5/5), california veggie pizza (3.5/5), chicken Caesar salad (4.5/5), and the two in a bowl soup (4/5).  My parents don't drink room temperature or cold water so I asked for hot water and the server nicely accommodated them. Other things over the years: Spinach dip (5/5) Yummy in the tummy... Margherita thin crust pizza (4/5) Chinese Chicken salad (5/5) YUM!!!! Thai crunch salad (4.5/5) Lovely combo of flavors Lettuce wraps (4/5) I would eat this each time if I could Fettucine alfredo pasta (3.5/5) It's decent Sesame Chicken dumplings (5/5) A little pricey but this is excellent
I don't understand why you would ring my buzzer thing when my table isn't ready! You sit me down, no water ready or bread. Cmon guys. I know you're busy but at least give me bread and water.

California pizza kitchen is a national chain and this restaurant has all the same menu items as the rest of the locations throughout the United States.  The one thing about this location in Ala Moana shopping mall is that it is usually very crowded. I would recommend going either at off times or early if you have a party of four or more. Our favorites include the Cobb salad, barbecue chicken pizza, and the California club pizza. You can't really go wrong with these three.
Up to this date, have always had a good meal at CPK.  Our server tonight, Maile, was great --quick and attentive.

We enjoyed our pizza here (better than others we've had on the island) and the fish tacos.  I also loved my fru fru girlie drink (a blackberry fizz something).  Good service, food, and cost ratio.  If you're looking for a good pizza and reasonably priced meal in the Ala Moana center, give this a try.

We enjoyed our pizza here (better than others we've had on the island) and the fish tacos.  I also loved my fru fru girlie drink (a blackberry fizz something).  Good service, food, and cost ratio.  If you're looking for a good pizza and reasonably priced meal in the Ala Moana center, give this a try.

I can't believe we came all the way to Hawaii and ended up eating pizza at the California Pizza kitchen.  That said it was a great experience.  The Pizza was fantastic,the Mai Tai's delicious and our server Joe was very attentive, friendly and swift. We originally planned on a local place called Inferno. Read the rating there to see why we chose CPK.  Thank you Joe and staff.

I can't believe we came all the way to Hawaii and ended up eating pizza at the California Pizza kitchen.  That said it was a great experience.  The Pizza was fantastic,the Mai Tai's delicious and our server Joe was very attentive, friendly and swift. We originally planned on a local place called Inferno. Read the rating there to see why we chose CPK.  Thank you Joe and staff.

Horrible online experience. Ordered online, got a message to call the store to confirm. When I did the "to go specialist" as she was titled was rude and obnoxious. She basically made me feel like an idiot, when the website clearly said "please contact the store to confirm order" Not only did she FAIL to review my order but she gave me attitude when I asked if I could buy the table bread they usually serve. I had someone pick up the order for me and she told him that the payment wasn't made. She explained that the "website always does that", well "To go specialist" why wouldn't you call me and inform me of the payment not being taken due to the "glitch" online. My name is clearly printed on the receipt upon which you got the order from. Nothing on my receipt reflected the specifications I made online and the woman wouldn't even help me add my pizza dough rewards to my over $100 order. Ridiculous service

I enjoy coming here...it's a cheerful place.  The service is consistently good and the food is delish.  I honestly haven't tried anything I didn't care for.  Besides their pizzas, I love their variety of awesome salads and appetizers.  My fave is the Chinese Chicken salad.  You have the option of ordering a half order or a full order.  A half order is quite filling especially if you're having appetizers or dessert.  The avocado Club Egg Rolls and Lettuce Wraps are also scrumptious.  Their Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake is the bomb!  I always save room for that happy ending!

I enjoy coming here...it's a cheerful place.  The service is consistently good and the food is delish.  I honestly haven't tried anything I didn't care for.  Besides their pizzas, I love their variety of awesome salads and appetizers.  My fave is the Chinese Chicken salad.  You have the option of ordering a half order or a full order.  A half order is quite filling especially if you're having appetizers or dessert.  The avocado Club Egg Rolls and Lettuce Wraps are also scrumptious.  Their Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake is the bomb!  I always save room for that happy ending!

For some reason, I always come here to grab lunch or a snack.  Is it so wrong to be from California and eating at a CPK?  LOL!  It's the only place where I'll have a Thai Chicken pizza.  But I've eaten here before and have had the bar-b-q chicken pizza and the pasta bolognese.  They have a decent wine list and some fun fru-fru cocktails. The service here is always consistently friendly and courteous!  Perhaps that's one of the reasons why I'd keep coming back.  We've sat in the dining room but I like sitting at the bar because you can watch the chefs making the pizzas.  It can get really busy at peak times but definitely worth coming too.  And if you're from California, they won't tell...LOL!

If you know Pizza, you know CPK. Not saying that it's downright the best pizza EVER, but with it's popularity and variety over the years, it's something everyone has tried by now. FIrst off, the wait. You KNOW there's going to be a wait everytime you go to CPK. It's not because this place is small or the service is slow, it's because its just that popular. But rememebr popularity isn't everything in a place. Being conveniently located on the 4th floor of Ala Moana, means there's a lot to do to kill time while waiting. And just FYI, we went to Longs on the OPPOSITE side of the mall and was able to get paged when it was our time to be seated. Atmosphere wise, there's always going to be a lot of people and this central location. There was maybe 2 tables with babies crying, 3 with little kids, and at least 2 happy birthdays (that the kids on the other table all sang along too as well). It is possible to set this place up for a date, but it won't seem like any special and seems the ambiance is more for a casual audience. The service is accommodating, and there hardly is a moment when my glass is empty. The food though, I would say is a hit or miss. Now i've been here a lot of times and not jus tmany of their different pizza's but also their side specials, chips, etc. Some I can say is just alright, meaning ok i'll put it in my stomach now because i'm hungry. While the other dishes are yes this brings out the flavor in the pizza im looking for. Dessert has changed over the years and I got chocolate soufflé cake ala mode, but open placing the plate on the table, the ice cream was already melted! The taste of it was still grand enough for my mouth to be satisfied and remember that it was treated well that night. Overall, this is a good place to eat with friends, get together, have pizza, have fun. It's a simple place with the appearance that many people believe you're getting a more classy Italian appearance. The variance in foods may not appeal to everyone, but some pizzas get your stomach satisfied just enough to go home happy.

This is a nice place to meet up with friends after a day of shopping. Atmosphere is good and the service is decent. Last night, there was a birthday party celebration at the table next to mines. I ordered a white pizza. You can tell the pizza was freshly made, but it was not seasoned at all. I could smell the garlic, but I would get really small bites of it.  I ordered a chocolate soufflé cake ala mode for dessert and basically came to me on a plate with either melted ice cream or whipped cream all over it.  Overall, I would say my experience there was decent. I would recommend it for a girls night out or a get together, but I wouldn't recommend it as an intimate place as a date night.

Maybe it's just me... but I'm not convinced, neither am I a fan... service was bleh. Let me tell you about our waitress, she spoke so softly, could barely hear her... my husband and I looked at each other trying to figure out what she just said to us... I swear, she was whispering...  Food: My husband had the California Club Pizza and according to him it was "eh? I've had better". I, on the other hand, ordered the bolognese spaghetti. It was dry, needed a whole lot more of their meat sauce.  Seriously... it was really dry...  Service: Besides the fact that our waitress was whispering, service was okay. However, our waitress had stink arm pits!!! When she would refill our water, I always held my breath... it's awful!!! Get a deodorant!!! My search for an awesome pasta and pizza resto continues...

We came in to take advantage of CPK's current Summer Strawberry promotion ($10 discount on purchases over $40) and to make use of my Pizza Dough bonus reward ($5).  Luckily, because our visit was during a weekday, there wasn't the "usual" long wait as we were greeted and seated right away.  We were seated at a great window tabletop that featured views of the Ala Wai Marina and part of Ala Moana Beach Park. Our server, Kirtus, was friendly, energetic and efficient.  I must congratulate him on having such a great memory as he effortlessly took our beverage and food orders without writing it down and delivering our food correctly. I also have to give credit to the kitchen and pantry for pacing the preparation of our meal. We ordered our usual California Cobb Salad, a hand-tossed White Pizza (mozzarella, pecorino, ricotta, Parmesan, Romano with sautéed garlic and spinach) with crisp bacon, iced teas and their featured strawberry shortcake.  Everything was served at peak temperature and the generous flavorful portions were consistent with the other CPK restaurants.   Our bill would have been closer to $50 for the two of us but with the Pizza Dough reward and promotion applied, we paid somewhere around $30.  We received top-notch service, delicious food and a gorgeous view while dining at this location.  I'm glad that I am a Pizza Dough member...why aren't you?

A co-worker suggested this place and I was a little concerned, because we ate at one back home in Chicago and hubby wasn't a fan. Well it turns out that if the one back home was this good, we would eat there again too.  We were both pleasantly surprised by how good it was. We shared the Hawaiian BBQ pizza and the potstickers. A co-worker had the Caribbean chicken jerk, which he said was his favorite.  We were all happy with our dishes. The pizzas had a nice crispy crust, with large chunks of chicken, a good amount of sauce, but not saturated and good flavor.  The potsticker had a nice searing on the outside, there were six of them which we all shared and a flavorful dipping sauce. There was a nice amount of meat inside each. We sat at the bar, otherwise there would have been a wait and the bartender was very attentive and fast at his job.  He was also very friendly.   The noise level was a little loud inside the restaurant, but not to the point where you couldn't have a conversation. We will be trying CPK once again when we are back in Chicago, to see if they are as good as we were able to experience here.

Corporal franchises food at its best. You could almost taste the machinery that manufactures the dough and everything being pretty much the exact stuff.  Food itself is okay, nothing too spectacular, and waiting service is also okay. A lot of weird combinations on the menu. In a nut shell: slighty better pizza than pizza hut, at a slightly better cost.

This place sure is popular in the evening! I stopped by with family and friends last night and we were told it would be a 50 minute wait. We were handed a pager with flashy lights and we sat on one of the benches outside.  Thank goodness for modern technology! While we waited, we spent a lot of time on our phones. I got to catch up on my email and social media, but that's another story. After about 50 minutes our pager went off and we went inside. Once we got seated, the service was fast and excellent. We ordered our drinks and a short time later the waitress, Brooke, came back and tried to take our order. Some of us weren't there because my nephew needed some fresh air. The waitress was totally fine with coming back later.  The waitress came back to our table as soon as my nephew and our friend came back! I was impressed that she was "on it" and we did not have to search or wait for her. Our orders were taken and delivered to the kitchen. The food took some time to prepare, but it was understandable because the restaurant was completely full. There were many orders in front of ours.   Our food arrived and I was happy with the food that I received. I just had to order a pizza since this place is called California Pizza Kitchen. They got to have awesome pizza right? I ordered a Meat Cravers thin crust pizza. It features Italian sausage, pepperoni, applewood smoked ham, spicy Capicola ham, and salami. It was delicious!  I only ate half of my pizza because I'm on a diet. The waitress quickly boxed up the remainder of my pizza, delivered the check, and we were out of there quickly. She also stayed on top of our drink refills. I can easily see why this place is so popular! Above average food with great service makes me want to try this place again.

It's been a few years since we graced the local Ala Moana CPK.  The Moroccan Salad has always been a favorite for parties and still is.. This time we decided to dine inside. We ordered a Pizza and let me just say it's TERRIBLE!! The Pizza's at CPK years ago were covered in quality ingredients, apparently those days are GONE!  Worst Pizza we've had in years. Reminded me of a frozen Pizza.  Service was good.

Let me start off by saying this is my favorite resturant!!!!! FOOD: AMAZING everytime i visit the food never fails me, the consistency of food between all the locations are the same and i love it! its never a bad meal! i have visited all of the CPKS on the leeward side of the island and i must say they really have it together the meals are always the same quality....  SERVICE: the service is always top of the line, the servers are always on top of things! i really love how they give house bread, and if you get it with the balsamic vinegar its the best!! LOCATION: the ala moana location is one of the most busiest i must say! but i do love the speedy service once your in there, the wait for the food is never to long! but there is tons of parking all around the shopping center PRICE: This is my favorite part! the prices are so good its reasonable for the quality of the food and service! this is my family go to place for all birthday and anniversary dinners! average cost of a plate is around $15 which is very affordable! OVERALL: overall this place has to be my go to place to have dinner or even lunch with family and friends! i love the vibes i get here its not to uptight, instead its a relaxing place to sit down and talk stories with your friends and family, its a good place to just sit back and enjoy some good food for a low price! i would recommend this restaurant to anyone because of the huge selection of food they have there! i also love how they have the pizza dough rewards cards which is a rewards program that gives you a dollar back for every $5 spent i believe! but they also do free appetizers when you join, and monthly they offer different things for members exclusive

We just had dinner at CPK in Ala Moana tonight. As usual, there was a bit is a wait. The service was amazing! From the time we checked in, to the time we exited after dinner, the staff was so friendly. Ekolu that served us at the bar was efficient and courteous. He worked diligently to make sure everyone at the bar was well taken cared of. When we got seated, Jenn M was our server and she was very friendly and cheerful. The food was delicious! The quinoa and arugula was refreshing and the pumpkin cheesecake was so delicious! The whole experience was perfect! Great food AND great service! Kudos to Ekolu and Jenn, along with their supporting staff to make it all happen! Definitely worth the wait!
Very nice service and place to eat with a loved one. My gf loves it here so we constantly come to eat after work.

My family and I popped in to the Ala Moana CPK to celebrate my birthday on July 9th.  Hostesses were fantastic, waitress & service were fine, food was good... but one of the managers was less than service oriented.   I called the restaurant after reaching home that night because I realized that my Pizza Dough card had not been returned to me.  I spoke with a female manager who, non-apologetically acknowledged that they had my card.  She said that I could come in and pick it up.  I asked if she could mail it to me because I live in Mililani and infrequently visit Ala Moana, and she grudgingly agreed.  She asked for my address, which I happily provided, and I ended the call with a "thank you very much!"  Here it is, July 20th, and I still haven't received my card in the mail.  I love CPK, but must admit that this incident left a bad taste in my mouth.  It is unfortunate that one manager was the cause, as I've always had stellar experiences in the past.

Service is bad, and I can never find something good to eat. Chefs change so food rarely tastes the same. Servers only serve their tables and don't help other tables unless you actually grab them to the side.  We ate there today and it was alright I got the California Club pizza and there wasn't much arugula and basil topping thing, so I asked if I could get more but the lady charged me, and it didn't even come with the sauce like how it was on the pizza. We also got a kids Alfredo and the alfredo sauce was so dry, it was more like a butter and cheese. For drinks we got water, coke, iced tea and strawberry lime margarita. Obviously they were fine but the margarita was SO sour like a lime margarita with a hint of strawberry. I told our server and she just looked at us with a "what do you want me to do about it" look so I asked if we could just get a new one and she did it kindly. By the time we got the drink we were done paying the bill and waiting.  Also we ordered a regular alfredo Togo so our server told us to tell her later when we wanted her to put it in. We were nearing the end of our meal and decided we didn't want the pasta, so we told our server and she said she already placed in the order so we couldn't really do anything about it. We didn't want them to just waste it so we just took it (as if we had a choice tho) and that alfredo was more dry then the kids one. Not even exaggerating it looked like regular pasta with a bit of oil and little cheese. On a side note almost all the time my sister eats at CPK she gets food poisoning.

Went to CPK lastnight and it was amazing. Service was   great and food was fabulous. I ordered the pear and gorgonzola pizza..very tasty! I think the greens were a bit wilted but flavor made up of for it. Other orders included chicken piccata (this was really yummy..capers with lemon sauce on chicken); of course we had two orders of the spinach artichoke dip which is always divine..the chips compliment the dip but we used the bread and it was delicious! Someone ordered the works pizza which was also really yummy! The drinks were good too. I ordered a strawberry mango cooler very refreshing for these hot summer nights!!

I love cpk so good food and clean
I love cpk so good food and clean

I personally think CPK is a great place to go for lunch. You know it's a good place to dine at when everything on the menu is good. I even make my own copycats of the dishes!  The atmosphere is also great. Most of the locations have large windows looking outside which makes the restaurant feel spacious and inviting.

I personally think CPK is a great place to go for lunch. You know it's a good place to dine at when everything on the menu is good. I even make my own copycats of the dishes!  The atmosphere is also great. Most of the locations have large windows looking outside which makes the restaurant feel spacious and inviting.

Although very busy, our estimated 30 minute wait was 15 minutes.  We were immediately greeted by Maile (Manager on Duty) who helped the server by taking our orders, helped other tables and made table rounds to make sure guests were satisfied and all needs met!   Great teamwork as servers helped each other bring out the orders to the tables. Maile was a role model and great team leader!  Food consistently great at CPK!

I enjoy the pizza here. My favorite is definitely the Thai Chicken Pizza is one of my favorite pizza's to order from there. Definitely worth ordering. Your taste buds won't mind. Costumer service is also excellent.

I've eaten here many times. Sometimes it's just been me with my two children. Sometimes it's been my husband and I alone. Once or twice I've had out-of-state relatives come along with my family. Mostly it's been just the four of us. I have never had a problem with regardless of which grouping of our family is there for a meal. Most of the time, the servers will take my kids orders first so they can get their food faster. That's excellent customer service, IMHO. The food is not anything stellar, but it is dependable. You want pizza? You can get a decent pizza with a variety of topping combinations. I used to live in NJ when I was growing up. My family bought pizza from a little old Sicilian man who had his shop down the street. I've been to Rome where the pizza crust is made so thin you can eat a whole pie on your own without thinking much about it. CPK pizza is pretty good for being a chain restaurant. I love the salads though. They are my whole reason for eating here. Italian Chopped. Roasted Veggie. California Cobb. Chinese Chicken. They are so good! I'd get one every day if I could. There are two things about this location that bother me. First, if you come at a peak time you might as well walk right on past. We came for lunch once and the wait for a table was 45 minutes. Nope. Second, it's loud. I guess it's just the acoustics of the restaurant itself. But if you are planning to sit and talk with your sweetie or you have a family member who doesn't hear as well as they used to, you might want to order take out instead of sitting in the restaurant.

I never get tired of eating at CPK. It's very conveniently located at Ala Moana Shopping Center on the top floor/center area.  I try to avoid peak food hours (lunch time/dinner) because it does get very busy here.  Went on a Sunday night around 7pm and the wait time wasn't too bad.  I'm guessing it was because the mall closes early on Sundays. I always get the Pesto Penne Pasta and add mushrooms (even though this is not an add on choice on the menu). I also love the White Pizza with bacon.  They also provide you with complimentary bread. Food items are pretty consistent every time and I never ran out of iced tea. I feel as though the wait staff has been getting better and better.  It seems as though they have gotten friendlier over the years and more attentive.

Corporal franchises food at its best. You could almost taste the machinery that manufactures the dough and everything being pretty much the exact stuff.  Food itself is okay, nothing too spectacular, and waiting service is also okay. A lot of weird combinations on the menu. In a nut shell: slighty better pizza than pizza hut, at a slightly better cost.

No denying that CPK is classic, one of the better pizza places out there. They made a name for themselves. A step above the rest, beyond the realm of delivery pizzas. I enjoy the atmosphere in the Ala Moana location. It's always busy, especially on weekends. They also have quite the variety of pizza to choose from. Some are well known and loved by all, others are unique and original. I been here a few times before. It's a great place for a date or if you're with a group of friends. I would have given CPK 5 stars but the service can be hit and miss in my opinion. In the most recent time that I have been here, our first server seemed tired and annoyed, devoid of energy. Granted we did arrive 30 minutes before closing but we couldn't help it. She passed us on to another waitress for whatever reason and she continued to help other tables. Our next waitress was great, she was lively, smiled a lot and brought us everything we needed. We could feel her energy. I could tell she cared. I would definitely go here again in the future. This is a great restaurant with a great atmosphere, and quality food. I will give the staff the benefit of the doubt because we all know how we feel after a long day of work and I don't hold that against anyone.

The food was great!!  Everything was tasty and well prepared. As added bonus, our Server, Jenna, was awesome!!!  She was attentive, pleasant, and prompt.  As you can tell we enjoyed both the food and the service!!!

Don't get me wrong. My family and I frequent CPK and very much like the menu. We know that the wait times are usually long.  However, today I witnessed a group of girls (party of three) almost immediately be seated in a booth, when we (party of four) were told to wait at least 30 minutes and of course there were people in front of us. I saw them receive their wait buzzer, and less then five minutes later return with it buzzing, and were seated in a booth. A booth big enough for everyone else waiting before them. The host, named Daulton (as I glare at him this very moment), took their buzzer and asked them, "What was that? Like less than five minutes yeah?"  Dear Daulton, you are terrible and should have never said that loud and clear for me to hear. I will be sure your manager knows that I hope you receive no tip from me.

The wife and I came here for lunch. I tried the raspberry lemondrop and it came in a martini glass; not what I was expecting. The drink was pretty potent. The bartender definitely had a heavy hand when he made my drink. My wife had their mango smoothie. She loved that it was not too sweet and you could definitely taste the mango. It was really quite refreshing and surprisingly light.  We had their crispy mac-and-cheese bites and Bianco flatbread to start. I love mac-and-cheese, so I had to get the bites and these were really nice and crispy. The white truffle cream in the Bianco flatbread was pretty potent, but otherwise, it was tasty. The flatbread was very light and had the right amount of crunch on the edges.  For my entree I had the Habanero Carnitas pizza and my wife had the Wild Mushroom pizza with the added white truffle oil. The Habanero Carnitas pizza was an 8 out of 10 in flavor. The flavors of the pulled pork and cilantro pesto complimented each other very well. I really enjoy spicy food, but the spice factor of this pizza was lacking. It felt rather mild. The Wild Mushroom pizza (shiitake, cremini, portobello, white mushrooms) was very savory with the added drizzling of white truffle oil. The White Truffle oil for an additional $1.50 was definitely worth it.  Our waiter was friendly, fast to get our order in, and to get us our check.

Went to dinner last night and was great food. Better than I expected. I had the shrimp zucchini fettuccine and my husband had the works pizza. We started with mushroom spinach flatbread. With their awesome sangrias. Such a good choice and to end with their red velvet cake ala mode. Too die for. Hands down they make the best red velvet cake.  The wait supposed to be 45 minutes but was way less. Lucky they take ur phone number. Probably about 30 minutes.

With their awesome sangrias. Such a good choice and to end with their red velvet cake ala mode. Too die for. Hands down they make the best red velvet cake.  The wait supposed to be 45 minutes but was way less. Lucky they take ur phone number. Probably about 30 minutes.
Service was great so a 5 star. Had the dumpling and those were pretty good. The sauce went really well with it.
Service was great so a 5 star. Had the dumpling and those were pretty good. The sauce went really well with it.

Let me give you a quick run down of how I grew up.  I grew up eating Chinese food.  At home, at the restaurants, at relatives' homes.  That's all I knew.  And I was not happy about it.  My idea of pizza was Pizza Hut, Papajohn's, Dominos, and Sbarros for a long time.  My parents did not care to take me out to any other cuisine other than Chinese food or fast food.   Sometime in late high school, a friend suggested we eat here to celebrate a birthday.  I fell in love with California Pizza Kitchen.  It is one of the earliest restaurants that opened my eyes to what "dining out" truly meant (compared to my childhood, you can see what I mean).  For years and years, I only ordered pizza from here because I LOVED it.  CPK was a treat.  I did not go here for just any reason.  Even after I discovered multitudes of delicious eateries in Hawaii and outside of the islands, I still love CPK.  Even as I slowly grew out of my tendency to eat at chain restaurants and hit up more hole in the walls, I still like it here as a stable option whenever eating with a group. This was the first CPK I ever ate at and in recent years, I have not been paying it enough visits.  This Ala Moana branch is BUSY.  It is CROWDED.  Account for waiting time!  The hosts are friendly, though, but unfortunately, reservations are not accepted.  As others have mentioned, waits can be anywhere from 20-60 minutes.   I came here for one of my birthday dinners this week (as it's the big 3-0, I decided to bring my parents out for something different, aka non-Asian).  The wait was only about 10 minutes since I made my boyfellow go early and put down his name. This time, we only ordered (between the 4 of us): wild mushroom pizza (5/5), california veggie pizza (3.5/5), chicken Caesar salad (4.5/5), and the two in a bowl soup (4/5).  My parents don't drink room temperature or cold water so I asked for hot water and the server nicely accommodated them. Other things over the years: Spinach dip (5/5) Yummy in the tummy... Margherita thin crust pizza (4/5) Chinese Chicken salad (5/5) YUM!!!! Thai crunch salad (4.5/5) Lovely combo of flavors Lettuce wraps (4/5) I would eat this each time if I could Fettucine alfredo pasta (3.5/5) It's decent Sesame Chicken dumplings (5/5) A little pricey but this is excellent
The BEST!!! The servers and hostesses  ROCK! The management are so curtious. They have the tastiest food. YUM!

Service was excellent! Food was amazing. (I posted a picture of my lunch) I even ate a Caesar Salad, had to ask for more dressing though. The Pesto Penne was overall amazing. It was the first time I ate it.

Service was excellent! Food was amazing. (I posted a picture of my lunch) I even ate a Caesar Salad, had to ask for more dressing though. The Pesto Penne was overall amazing. It was the first time I ate it.

Frequent flyer of CPK till coming to this location. Ordered a pasta and the noodles them selves were very undercooked. By the time they fixed the issue my family was all done eating and ready to go. There was no discount or even option to just cancel it all together. CPK let me down today.

Not good today.  Buzzer not working.  Waiting, waiting, waiting.  Hmmm.  Let's check to see why such a long wait.  "Oh, sorry we forgot."   First item ordered.  "Oh sorry, we're out of that."   Hope the food we get measures up today.

I don't understand why you would ring my buzzer thing when my table isn't ready! You sit me down, no water ready or bread. Cmon guys. I know you're busy but at least give me bread and water.

This place sure is popular in the evening! I stopped by with family and friends last night and we were told it would be a 50 minute wait. We were handed a pager with flashy lights and we sat on one of the benches outside.  Thank goodness for modern technology! While we waited, we spent a lot of time on our phones. I got to catch up on my email and social media, but that's another story. After about 50 minutes our pager went off and we went inside. Once we got seated, the service was fast and excellent. We ordered our drinks and a short time later the waitress, Brooke, came back and tried to take our order. Some of us weren't there because my nephew needed some fresh air. The waitress was totally fine with coming back later.  The waitress came back to our table as soon as my nephew and our friend came back! I was impressed that she was "on it" and we did not have to search or wait for her. Our orders were taken and delivered to the kitchen. The food took some time to prepare, but it was understandable because the restaurant was completely full. There were many orders in front of ours.   Our food arrived and I was happy with the food that I received. I just had to order a pizza since this place is called California Pizza Kitchen. They got to have awesome pizza right? I ordered a Meat Cravers thin crust pizza. It features Italian sausage, pepperoni, applewood smoked ham, spicy Capicola ham, and salami. It was delicious!  I only ate half of my pizza because I'm on a diet. The waitress quickly boxed up the remainder of my pizza, delivered the check, and we were out of there quickly. She also stayed on top of our drink refills. I can easily see why this place is so popular! Above average food with great service makes me want to try this place again.

It's been a few years since we graced the local Ala Moana CPK.  The Moroccan Salad has always been a favorite for parties and still is.. This time we decided to dine inside. We ordered a Pizza and let me just say it's TERRIBLE!! The Pizza's at CPK years ago were covered in quality ingredients, apparently those days are GONE!  Worst Pizza we've had in years. Reminded me of a frozen Pizza.  Service was good.

Terrible take out service! Last night we ordered a couple of pizzas on line and went to CPK at the appropriate time to pick them up. We had pre paid so there was no monies that needed to change hands. When we got there there were 2 staff people and a manager trying to correct a mixed up bill at the register. Several minutes passed and they were unable to resolve the problem. We saw our pizzas get delivered to the shelf behind the register and tried to get one of the staff to give them to us but were told it needed to go thru the register. 15 more minutes passed during which the line kept getting longer. They finally figured out the person's bill, and then moved on to us. We showed them our credit card and they handed us our now very cold pizzas without using the register at all! Could have done that immediately and we would have gotten warm pizzas! While we were waiting a ToGo employee showed up and was given his order without needing the register. No one was comped or even offered an apology. Perhaps the staff needs both a course in how to use computers and customer service.

My boyfriend and I often come to this location for lunch or dinner. Warren was our server, he was very kind, attentive, and quick with his service. But we absolutely didn't like it that he circled the recommended tip amount that is located on the bottom of the bill (posted a picture of it as well). We thought that it was very unprofessional, and it left a bad taste in our mouth when we left the establishment.  Good service should speak for itself regarding tips, they shouldn't circle how much tip we should leave! We have eyes and we can read, thank you very much Warren.

This place is okay. Their pizza is good! I always order their strawberry colada. Its very delicious. On birthdays, you get a free cake or a designed ice cream. Its really good! Though there are other places to celebrate birthdays but this one is pretty descent. The ambiance is good, you can see the sea side view. Some waiters are not nice some are nice. But on the first time I came here, I didn't really get a good service so its not my best recommendation. The other times, their service is okay. So four stars for the service but four stars as the food is what matters anyways here for me.

I always love going to CPK.  My favorite items are the avocado rolls, pear gorganzola (may be wrong spelling) and chinese chicken salad.  As usual, they were all yummy.  The unexpected surprise was the Sangria.  It was delicious and HUGE.  There is always wait at the CPK, but they do try to keep it moving.

I always love going to CPK.  My favorite items are the avocado rolls, pear gorganzola (may be wrong spelling) and chinese chicken salad.  As usual, they were all yummy.  The unexpected surprise was the Sangria.  It was delicious and HUGE.  There is always wait at the CPK, but they do try to keep it moving.

Great service, great food.   My problem? Be careful with the round up for charity.  They double charged me for my bill, my total before tip and after tip. The manager told me that this "happens a lot with this round up thing" but they didnt tell me when I paid my bill. Luckily I checked my bank statement for something else and noticed the error. I then spoke to some other manager 5 hours later who said that she knows that "sometimes" "they" will void the incorrectly charged amount and that I should wait to see if it shows up on my statement. I asked her who this person would be, the server (who anticipated the error ahead of time and voided the total before knowing that it actually charged me on accident) or the roundup for charity people, and she took a few steps back, fumbled with her words, apologized, and just credited my card for the amount.  Sounds like a scam, smells like a scam, but CPK doesn't seem like the kind of place who does this.  So the takeaway is if you did the roundup for charity, double check your online statement if they double charged you. And, if you wanna donate to charity, dont do it through this roundup for charity thing.

Better go early if you are eating there on the weekends for dinner. This place get really crowded and the wait time can be long. California Pizza Kitchen just changed their menu so they have a bunch of new items. I always get the spinach artichoke dip and Mushroom pizza. Try and check the toilet out after you take a dump the next morning after eating that artichoke dip. Anyways The service is pretty good here and they treat you like family. Prices got raised a little but I guess it is necessary.

3rd time coming to this location and as I said in my 2nd review I am a forever customer to this location!  Kyle was my server today and he went above and beyond as to what a server should be doing. He was fun and friendly the service was prompt, he always made sure I was happy all while not bothering me too much (of hate being bothered too much) he was a team player with other employees even offering to help them bus tables on his down time all while making sure everyone in his section was taken care of 5 stars to him AND this location.
Up to this date, have always had a good meal at CPK.  Our server tonight, Maile, was great --quick and attentive.

California pizza kitchen is a national chain and this restaurant has all the same menu items as the rest of the locations throughout the United States.  The one thing about this location in Ala Moana shopping mall is that it is usually very crowded. I would recommend going either at off times or early if you have a party of four or more. Our favorites include the Cobb salad, barbecue chicken pizza, and the California club pizza. You can't really go wrong with these three.

We just had dinner at CPK in Ala Moana tonight. As usual, there was a bit is a wait. The service was amazing! From the time we checked in, to the time we exited after dinner, the staff was so friendly. Ekolu that served us at the bar was efficient and courteous. He worked diligently to make sure everyone at the bar was well taken cared of. When we got seated, Jenn M was our server and she was very friendly and cheerful. The food was delicious! The quinoa and arugula was refreshing and the pumpkin cheesecake was so delicious! The whole experience was perfect! Great food AND great service! Kudos to Ekolu and Jenn, along with their supporting staff to make it all happen! Definitely worth the wait!

Let me start off by saying this is my favorite resturant!!!!! FOOD: AMAZING everytime i visit the food never fails me, the consistency of food between all the locations are the same and i love it! its never a bad meal! i have visited all of the CPKS on the leeward side of the island and i must say they really have it together the meals are always the same quality....  SERVICE: the service is always top of the line, the servers are always on top of things! i really love how they give house bread, and if you get it with the balsamic vinegar its the best!! LOCATION: the ala moana location is one of the most busiest i must say! but i do love the speedy service once your in there, the wait for the food is never to long! but there is tons of parking all around the shopping center PRICE: This is my favorite part! the prices are so good its reasonable for the quality of the food and service! this is my family go to place for all birthday and anniversary dinners! average cost of a plate is around $15 which is very affordable! OVERALL: overall this place has to be my go to place to have dinner or even lunch with family and friends! i love the vibes i get here its not to uptight, instead its a relaxing place to sit down and talk stories with your friends and family, its a good place to just sit back and enjoy some good food for a low price! i would recommend this restaurant to anyone because of the huge selection of food they have there! i also love how they have the pizza dough rewards cards which is a rewards program that gives you a dollar back for every $5 spent i believe! but they also do free appetizers when you join, and monthly they offer different things for members exclusive

No denying that CPK is classic, one of the better pizza places out there. They made a name for themselves. A step above the rest, beyond the realm of delivery pizzas. I enjoy the atmosphere in the Ala Moana location. It's always busy, especially on weekends. They also have quite the variety of pizza to choose from. Some are well known and loved by all, others are unique and original. I been here a few times before. It's a great place for a date or if you're with a group of friends. I would have given CPK 5 stars but the service can be hit and miss in my opinion. In the most recent time that I have been here, our first server seemed tired and annoyed, devoid of energy. Granted we did arrive 30 minutes before closing but we couldn't help it. She passed us on to another waitress for whatever reason and she continued to help other tables. Our next waitress was great, she was lively, smiled a lot and brought us everything we needed. We could feel her energy. I could tell she cared. I would definitely go here again in the future. This is a great restaurant with a great atmosphere, and quality food. I will give the staff the benefit of the doubt because we all know how we feel after a long day of work and I don't hold that against anyone.

Terrible take out service! Last night we ordered a couple of pizzas on line and went to CPK at the appropriate time to pick them up. We had pre paid so there was no monies that needed to change hands. When we got there there were 2 staff people and a manager trying to correct a mixed up bill at the register. Several minutes passed and they were unable to resolve the problem. We saw our pizzas get delivered to the shelf behind the register and tried to get one of the staff to give them to us but were told it needed to go thru the register. 15 more minutes passed during which the line kept getting longer. They finally figured out the person's bill, and then moved on to us. We showed them our credit card and they handed us our now very cold pizzas without using the register at all! Could have done that immediately and we would have gotten warm pizzas! While we were waiting a ToGo employee showed up and was given his order without needing the register. No one was comped or even offered an apology. Perhaps the staff needs both a course in how to use computers and customer service.

We've had numerous problems with this restaurant. Tonight, not only did I find a green inchworm in my Thai Crunch Salad, but my party and I have been forced to wait over an hour for a takeout order. The manager waived part of our order, but the wait for our takeout has made this an all-around awful experience. If I get worms, I know it's not E. Coli, but an invasion of inchworms. So done.

The manager waived part of our order, but the wait for our takeout has made this an all-around awful experience. If I get worms, I know it's not E. Coli, but an invasion of inchworms. So done.

Late birthday dinner and it was exceptional! I had never been to this location but I will say its my go to spot now for birthday dinners, o.k one of my go to spots. Anyways loved the service, and the food came out quickly.

I know CPK is quite popular and this was the first time we tried the restaurant. I've had the frozen pizzas and done the quick airport meal before in the past. My first clue would have been to order a pizza. Instead ordered the chicken jalapeño lime pasta and immediately regretted it. The first word is chicken so I was expecting some chicken. Well there was about 4 microscopic pieces the size of my fingernail cut up as if feeding to a cat placed on top. I thought oh there must be more mixed in the pasta. No that was it, super disappointed and that was $16.  The appetizer of avocado egg roll was  to die for! My 1 yr old daughter ate two. My friends seemed pleased with their meals and that's why I didn't send mine back. Or maybe if was all the drinks they ordered made the food better idk? They had fish tacos, fettuccine Alfredo and BBQ pizza. I didn't want to make a scene and it was crazy busy for veterans day. So maybe it was just an off day, to overwhelmed, or that's business as usual? The staff was very friendly and that's why it gets 3 stars. Our waiter was amazing! (His name wasn't on the name tag because he had written he was a  vet that served 10 yrs). When my daughter was getting fussy he gave her a little ice cream sundae and that made her night.

Very disappointed with the Margarita Pizza.  The basil was sparse and clump to one side.  The pizza crust was not crispy.  The mozzarella did not taste fresh.  Instead of round slices of cheese it look like shredded cheese.  I hope this was a fluke and not the future norm.  Took picture and posted.

Very disappointed with the Margarita Pizza.  The basil was sparse and clump to one side.  The pizza crust was not crispy.  The mozzarella did not taste fresh.  Instead of round slices of cheese it look like shredded cheese.  I hope this was a fluke and not the future norm.  Took picture and posted.

I have never been a fan of CPK; but I commend them for introducing an eclectic fusion of Asian inspired flavors to the mainstream of America. The prices aren't horrible, but they could be $3 -$4 cheaper and they'd feel just right...Taste wise, go with one of their two main dishes - pasta or pizza. Overall, very tasty whether you're getting pepperoni and cheese staples or gorgonzola and pear combos. Pasta is good with their asparagus spaghettini, although thry lazily chop in the bottom most parts of the asparagus spear, the ones that are chewy and stringy and widely inedible. Other our server was friendly enough but relatively inattentive; never filled our water and he didnt offer the standard parmesan cheese and pepper on the pasta. A nice floor manager walked by at the right time and got us some...but when shaking chili pepper flake on my pizza the lid popped off and a dune of pepper graced my pie...I was sad, but of course the manager got a new hot and ready replacement in front of me stat. All in all good job but didnt blow my hair back...
