Go figure that we go on vaca to Hawaii and eat at CPK lol...at least they are by the water and we got a window seat with a pretty view....so it didn't seem like we were at a franchise place.  So far, on our vaca this week, CPK has had the best service and didn't screw anything up. We all shared spinach dip, avocado bacon egg rolls (YUM!) and chicken ginger wontons (best out of the 3 appetizers). The frozen mango lemonade was tasty (but pricey at $4.19!) and I got a strawberry drink thingie. My friend got iced tea with free refills. For entrees we got thai pizza, thai salad (full with avocado) and full Caesar salad. Oh, their bread with the pesto Olive oil thingie is to die for. I think it comes with the meal, as we kept asking for refills and they didn't say there was a charge. Dessert was the chocolate cake and velvet cake (chocolate was better). All that was $110 for 3 people. Not an inexpensive meal, but for the amount of food we got, and it was prepared well, we were satisfied. Service was great at this CPK. Tip: ask for the bread and olive oil thingie to go if you have leftovers. We did and we had lunch at our hotel the next day. Yummy!
Very nice service and place to eat with a loved one. My gf loves it here so we constantly come to eat after work.

The food was great!!  Everything was tasty and well prepared. As added bonus, our Server, Jenna, was awesome!!!  She was attentive, pleasant, and prompt.  As you can tell we enjoyed both the food and the service!!!
The BEST!!! The servers and hostesses  ROCK! The management are so curtious. They have the tastiest food. YUM!

My boyfriend and I often come to this location for lunch or dinner. Warren was our server, he was very kind, attentive, and quick with his service. But we absolutely didn't like it that he circled the recommended tip amount that is located on the bottom of the bill (posted a picture of it as well). We thought that it was very unprofessional, and it left a bad taste in our mouth when we left the establishment.  Good service should speak for itself regarding tips, they shouldn't circle how much tip we should leave! We have eyes and we can read, thank you very much Warren.

Late birthday dinner and it was exceptional! I had never been to this location but I will say its my go to spot now for birthday dinners, o.k one of my go to spots. Anyways loved the service, and the food came out quickly.

I know CPK is quite popular and this was the first time we tried the restaurant. I've had the frozen pizzas and done the quick airport meal before in the past. My first clue would have been to order a pizza. Instead ordered the chicken jalapeño lime pasta and immediately regretted it. The first word is chicken so I was expecting some chicken. Well there was about 4 microscopic pieces the size of my fingernail cut up as if feeding to a cat placed on top. I thought oh there must be more mixed in the pasta. No that was it, super disappointed and that was $16.  The appetizer of avocado egg roll was  to die for! My 1 yr old daughter ate two. My friends seemed pleased with their meals and that's why I didn't send mine back. Or maybe if was all the drinks they ordered made the food better idk? They had fish tacos, fettuccine Alfredo and BBQ pizza. I didn't want to make a scene and it was crazy busy for veterans day. So maybe it was just an off day, to overwhelmed, or that's business as usual? The staff was very friendly and that's why it gets 3 stars. Our waiter was amazing! (His name wasn't on the name tag because he had written he was a  vet that served 10 yrs). When my daughter was getting fussy he gave her a little ice cream sundae and that made her night.

Definitely worth the 20 minute wait to get in. Staff were totally amazing - drink refills before I'd even finished it and the manager even brought me another pizza because it was a tiny bit burnt which I didn't even notice!! The Works pizza was a great balance of flavours. Not too salty or spicy.

Definitely worth the 20 minute wait to get in. Staff were totally amazing - drink refills before I'd even finished it and the manager even brought me another pizza because it was a tiny bit burnt which I didn't even notice!! The Works pizza was a great balance of flavours. Not too salty or spicy.
So excited to eat here ... Pizza came with a curly black hair in it mmmm tasty... Manager comped us but not the drinks I was just about to sip and what do you know another bug! Welcome to Hawaii
So excited to eat here ... Pizza came with a curly black hair in it mmmm tasty... Manager comped us but not the drinks I was just about to sip and what do you know another bug! Welcome to Hawaii

Food is always good, but was shocked when waitress Michelle stated there's a $0.75 extra per lettuce for the lettuce wrap. Really? Four pieces of lettuce and you expect me to eat all this chicken mushroom filling? Hmmm not possible. This is the first time in history that I was told there was a charge. Granted she was doing her job and it's only $0.75, I decided to request for more bread. Keep in mind I'm always here with family and friends.  Haha Heads up people $0.75 charge for extra lettuce for their lettuce wraps! Auwe.

We stopped in for a quick lunch before our pedicure appointment.  The avocado egg rolls are divine!  We have to get these each time we come.  We split a sausage, pepperoni, and mushroom pizza.  Can you tell we were starving?  I forgot to take a picture until we were almost done.

Did a call-in and didn't have to wait. Ordered the rib-eye steak rare, and it was delicious! I love the free bread too. I wanted more, so I wish we were offered more, but probably better for my waist that I didn't eat anymore. Our waiter was nice and friendly. I liked that the waiter looked at me most of the time. I feel like waiters tend to give more attention to the guys thinking they're paying for it, but I felt like I got more attention this time, so that was nice for a change. And, yes, I did pay too. The waiter reminded me of someone I went to high school with whom I don't talk to anymore. Similar feature and manners. He seemed gentle and delicate, very sweet.  Anyway, the food was delicious. I would go back again. Also, the honey lemonade was good too. The only thing I don't like about drinking at these kinds of restaurants is they're always cheap on the alcohol. It always tastes like more juice than alcohol.

The cpk menu seems to keep getting smaller..but oh well at least they have ribeye steak as a regular menu item now...pizzas pastas & appetizers are pretty consistent. ..I guess that's why we always come back

Ordered a kids meal pizza with ice cream sundae.  My son didn't like thr icecream and gave it to me. I didn't like it. The sundae tasted like  frostbite.  The hot fudge tasted horrible. Thai crunch salad with avocado is always good. The waiter was nice.

The food is consistently good, priced appropriately and the service is always outstanding! Sara is simply the best--running the bar and counter where I always sit on my breaks from work. Some people are just meant to make your day and she always does! Thank you Sara for your stellar service!

Sunday night was quite busy, so 40 minutes wait time was Ok. We were buzzed about 15 minutes after the quote time. We already knew what we wanted to order. Server was nice and I specifically said Avacado Egg Rolls for our appetizer, mind that the Avacado Egg Rolls is an Appetizer on the Menu. Bread and drinks came out fast. Waited 20 minutes and still no appetizers. When the food finally came, the Avacado Egg Rolls came out with my entree, Kung Pao Spaghetti. 2 minutes later, our Thin Crust Pizza came out. Egg rolls weren't hot. Spaghetti was hot but the portion has gotten a lot smaller. Thin crust pizza wasn't crunchy but was chewy and hard to cut. Server refilled waters but never refilled my kids drinks. ( Kids drinks have free refills, right? )  Might just order take out next time and eat it downstairs in the food court.

CPK... what can I say that hasn't already been said? This place is definitely my go-to when I can't decide on where to meet my girlfriends for a quick bite after work or for lunch during the weekends.  They've got appetizers, salads, tacos, pastas, pizzas, and alcohol, among some other notable items. Their food is consistent and full of flavor.  I especially enjoy their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine an Kung Pao Spaghetti.  Their popular BBQ Chicken Pizza is good too for the rare days I am craving pizza from CPK.  As for their salads, I enjoy the Chinese Chicken Salad and the Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad.   All of their appetizers are good, too.  Be adventurous and try something new each time you come here.  I'm sure you won't be let down.   Service is usually consistent - I have no complaints, nor do I have anything extraordinary to report.  The Ala Moana location gets really packed during the evenings and the weekends, so I do suggest you come early.  Wait times can be 45 minutes - 1 hour.  Luckily there's usually live music nearby for you to enjoy while you wait. They don't take reservations.  And there's bar seating if you don't mind it. I'm definitely a fan.  Check it out.  I think you will like it too. Enjoy!

Popped in for a late lunch today and sat at the bar. It was relatively quiet since it was after 2, mostly just tourists and late lunchers. I ordered an iced water with lemon and a Caesar salad. And some of their yummy toasty bread came out with that fantastic olive oil dip. Unfortunately my salad was WAY overdressed. My tongue still hurts from the sharpness of the dressing. Luckily my server James was really cool. He not only told the salad guys about it but also a manager who came over and ended up comping my bill. So sweet! I decided to order dessert so as not to totally bum out my server. Their red velvet cake is like heaven in dessert form. Super moist, not too sweet, and the frosting is divine. I bake at home so I know how hard it is to perfect cream cheese frosting and theirs is on point! All in all an excellent trip to cpk despite the salad upset. James is a great server if you get him.

Never can go wrong with cpk ! Quinoa , asparagus, arugula salad is winner !!!! I also get the Sicilian pizza and pesto Alfredo !    This place can get so busy and it sucks so bad but when we have gone the staff have managed to move people in and out appropriately! I'll stick to the staff subject, I feel like I've had the best customer service in a busy restaurant from cpk, at multiple locations ! So I don't mind waiting! So as long as we don't have a bad experience we won't stop coming !

Stopped in on a busy Saturday evening at the Ala Moana location as we had to sample some of their new menu items. CPK has always been known for great California Style pizza, but as they've always experimented with new pizza flavors, they've been really stepping out beyond the pizza and pasta world. Food: The three of use all ordered new menu items..Poke Chop Salad, Seared Ahi, and Grilled Rib Eye. The Poke Chop salad was excellent, nice cubes of fresh ahi served over a bed of mixed greens. Seared Ahi was also a winner, slices of ahi grilled to perfection on outside leaving the interior perfectly rare, served over a bed of roasted farro and bak choy.. a little spicy which added a nice touch. And steak..oh yeah you can now order a nice 12 oz grilled rib eye steak. I ordered my steak medium rare, while the steak was not overly thick they still managed to cook it perfectly. I'm going to have a hard time in the future ordering anything besides the rib eye!  The only downside was the steak was topped with a generous dollop of compound butter, unfortunately they didn't put it on quick enough so it never melted as intended, instead it sort of sat there in a solid clump, I eventually just moved it to the side. The steak may have been off the grill for a few minutes before they applied the butter, small thing but noticeable. Oh..and the bread..the bread...oh my the bread. They changed the bread a little while ago..instead of the soft french bread slices they used to serve (albeit not big on the flavor or texture profile), someone on the CPK team decided to change it up and go with a crusty, crunchy, chewy, sourdough like baguette. Whoever decided this..give that person a raise! I could probably just eat the bread with a nice glass (or two or three) of wine and call it a day. Service: Busy as always, all CPK locations on the island seem like they can double their floor space and still be busy. The wait can back up during prime dining hours so be prepared or go during off hours. Even busy, the servers are attentive and manager at this location jumps in to lend a hand. We were seated, he recognized the server was still busy managing another table so he quickly jumped in to take our drink order, get us water, etc.  Atmosphere: Bustling, crowded, people laughing and having fun, everyone enjoying their meal seems to be the norm. Even with the wait, you will rarely see an unhappy customer who at CPK.  Tip..if you can snag a seat at the bar..especially during peak times you can skip the wait, chat with the bartender, and watch the pizza chefs work their magic. Value: Can get a little pricey..I think my rib eye came in at about $27 but that's actually a fair price compared to other places that do not match the quality. Our bill is usually a bit on the higher side but that's probably due to the consumption of some of their fine adult beverages.  The draft beer here is actually quite reasonable..the cocktail prices can get you though as no prices are listed on their cocktail menu.  Overall: We enjoy CPK probably a couple times per month..We appreciate the consistent quality of the both the menu items and service as well as their periodic new offerings.

Every time that I pass by there's always a long wait for this place. I'm not too big on their pizzas. You can buy them frozen and bake it at home for half the price. I swear it tastes just the same. There is a bigger variety if you go to the restaurant. They only offer a few of their most popular pizzas frozen. I come to CPK for their salads. Oh, how I love thee! Their Chinese Chicken and Thai Crunch salads are the best. I always seem to order the Thai Crunch as of late with avocado. It's the mix of the Thai peanut dressing, peanuts, wontons,  and rice sticks that gives it that oomph. If you get anything from this place, get the Thai Crunch salad. For dessert, we ordered the Butter Cake with vanilla ice cream. This was so yummy! The cake was served warm and moist, with a scoop of vanilla ice cream in the center. The stark contrast of the warm cake and the cold ice cream just turned my tastebuds into a frenzy, in a good way.

Pizza + Salad is always a good combination! If you sign up for their pizza dough rewards card, you'll get special treats too!

I am so disappointed! I usually get take out of the spaghetti. This time it came in a container almost half the size as the usual one. The hostess said they just stuffed the same amount of pasta in a smaller container because they don't have the bigger one.  Bull pucky! No way to fit the same amount in a considerably smaller container. As a result the pasta was very, very dry as there was very little sauce. Unfortunately, by the time I got home, it was too late to turn around and return it. Last time I go there!
Pizza + Salad is always a good combination! If you sign up for their pizza dough rewards card, you'll get special treats too!

CPK was one of my favorite places to go to when I am out and about.  I love their salads and usually order an appetizer, half salad and dessert.  I have noticed that the prices for the half said has gone up quite a bit this past year and on my last visit, the half salad is now the price of what a full salad used to be AND the portion size was less than what I usually received.  Come on guys, for $17.00 I can find many other places for good food and a better deal.  I wondered why it was so empty and we had no wait time when we went last Saturday at noon.  Now I know.  I am but one person, however, I will not be going back to CPK.

I ordered the turkey, bacon, avocado club and it was downright horrible. First off there was only about 1 ounce of turkey on the entire sandwich. A few dinky pieces of avocado and a slice of bacon. The ginormous "ciabatta" bread was SMOTHERED in mayonnaise and immediately was falling apart when I attempted to picked it up. It was like I was eating something out of an airport vending machine. I know..I went into a pizza place to get a sandwich but I expected a much better product. Sorry...wont be back,

Well... what can I say. My boyfriend and I decided to grab a quick bite someplace close to home and since this is almost a never fail with finding parking for being in Waikiki... we opted for some CPK. Greeted with friendly smiling faces at the door we were quickly seated.  Another friendly smiling face quickly came and introduced himself as "not our server" but one that was helping ours out, who was held up at the current moment. This is something I appreciate, having worked in the industry so long. Teamwork is what helps the night go smooth for  Our server hadn't been far behind the drink ordering when he introduced himself and apologized for his delay. Obviously, not a problem since even though he hadn't made it to us upon being seated, we were not for a moment neglected.  He offered his recommendations and asked if we had any questions but we had already been informed by the 1st server, that had taken our drink orders so we were good to go. For me, it was a no brainer-the only thing I think of when I think of CPK is their bbq chicken pizza. My boyfriend is not that big a fan of pizza, and enjoys any opportunity to eat something with shrimp since I'm allergic and this is not something we can cook at a home, as we pewfer to avoid possibly contaminating our kitchen and me coming into contact with any of it. Across a table just being eaten near me is fine so... these are his opportunities & he seizes them. Lol  He ordered the shrimp scampi. It looked amazing and he ate it all. (Sorry as mentioned above I clearly can not give my opinion as I was unable to actually try it). The portion size was not huge and he was able to finish the whole thing. My bbq chicken pizza with added bacon of course, was just as delicious as I remembered it always being. I also ordered a cup of the baked potato soup which also did not disappoint.  For drinks- He got his usual blue moon, and for myself...I am normally a straight whiskey kind of gal wanted something light and sweet for a change and opted for their Caribbean Sangria. The goblet was huge and it was definitely tasty. An awesome summer day drink if you ask me. Caribbean Sangria is the perfect name bc it reminds you of something you should drink on a beach in the sun....  So, all in all... even though I don't usually prefer to do chain restaurants,I do love their bbq chicken pizza. So in addition to it being close to home and pretty much a sure shot when it comes to parking... if ur in the mood for a quick bite of some good pizza and near Ala Moana and don't wanna hassle with trying to find or paying for parking... well cpk hit the spot for us just right last night.... quick,friendly and efficient service from the moment we arrived to the moment we walked out... all in all, a good spontaneous meal choice I must say....

Ate dinner here for a Bachelorette Party dinner and although it was on a Friday night, we didn't have any problems getting a table for 15.  We called an hour ahead, as we were instructed to do, and they sat us before our scheduled time!  The waitress (Tiffany) and manager were great!  I had the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer (ALWAYS yummy) and the pepperoni pizza (another ALWAYS yummy!).  No complaints from anyone in our party.

Went there a couple nights ago... It was very busy! Anyways, the staff was very nice. What kind of turned me off though was that it was during shift change and the employees are hanging out where people are waiting, employees are walking out of the back room with bottles of wine that they are obviously taking home, and the off going wait staff is carrying on personnel conversations yelling across the restaurant. Once we were seated a waiter introduced himself and said that he was going to take care of our drinks but someone else would help us for the rest of our meal... Well, he must've ended up working overtime cause he stayed with us the whole time.... Which is fine with me since he did a good job overall. The restaurant itself is very loud. Overall though, the food was really good and the waiter was good. Off going staff could've used a lesson in professionalism though.

Went for lunch.  Ladies only.  We got as our waiter, Kyle.  The best.  He made excellent suggestions, all on target.  He made our lunch special.  Ask for him, sit by the window, go early.  Good food, good company, good staff. Can't ask for more.

My baby is home... and we're back to our favorite restaurant for a date night.. Our waiter was good,  food is good.. We are very happy.. It's always nice to go back to a restaurant and you know you will always have good food and service..  I recommend everyone to try their lettuce wrap... So Ono!!

My baby is home... and we're back to our favorite restaurant for a date night.. Our waiter was good,  food is good.. We are very happy.. It's always nice to go back to a restaurant and you know you will always have good food and service..  I recommend everyone to try their lettuce wrap... So Ono!!

Ended up here because the wait for Cafe Lani was too long for the 5 of us. This 3 star review is mainly for service we had last night & not the food. Our food was delicious, we had no complaints about that. I don't know if we caught Tiffany on the wrong day but we love coming here & usually never have any problems w/ service. My 2 girlfriends decided to run to the store while we waited and they came back just in time as we were ordering. They already knew what they wanted but our server decided to just take my other 2 friends & my order and walked away. She came back in about 5 minutes w/ bread and asked my 2 girlfriends if they were ready and they finally got to place their order. My other 2 friends and I got our food in a pretty timely matter but we were pretty close to being done w/ our food and the other food hadn't even shown up to the table. We decided to ask about the other 2 people's food. Our server casually said "yeah the pizza's taking kind of long and they did order later." It wouldn't have bothered me so much had she asked them if they were ready to order before she walked away, but she didn't so they had no choice BUT to order later. After we were done, she drops off the check and we realized that we didn't all have cash (our bad) so we had asked to separate the checks which must have really grinded her gears because she then said "who wants their checks separated??"  Fast forward -- We FINALLY get everything settled and honestly, I couldn't have been more relieved to get out of there.

Ended up here because the wait for Cafe Lani was too long for the 5 of us. This 3 star review is mainly for service we had last night & not the food. Our food was delicious, we had no complaints about that. I don't know if we caught Tiffany on the wrong day but we love coming here & usually never have any problems w/ service. My 2 girlfriends decided to run to the store while we waited and they came back just in time as we were ordering. They already knew what they wanted but our server decided to just take my other 2 friends & my order and walked away. She came back in about 5 minutes w/ bread and asked my 2 girlfriends if they were ready and they finally got to place their order. My other 2 friends and I got our food in a pretty timely matter but we were pretty close to being done w/ our food and the other food hadn't even shown up to the table. After we were done, she drops off the check and we realized that we didn't all have cash (our bad) so we had asked to separate the checks which must have really grinded her gears because she then said "who wants their checks separated??"  Fast forward -- We FINALLY get everything settled and honestly, I couldn't have been more relieved to get out of there.

I enjoyed my experience dining at CPK.  I got something other than pizza - Kale Salad on their seasonal menu. It was delicious!  I had their pizza before and its really good. It gets crowded here, especially weekends but we didn't have an issue getting a table right away.  We went for lunch on a Sunday.

The service was excellent, but the food was pretty pedestrian. We ordered a pizza with garlic and chicken, which was pretty good. We also ordered the pasta carbonara, which could have been better. Haven't been to this location in a while, but the food seemed better before.

Ioane was an amazing server!!! Awesome customer service!!! Food was ono, thank you all so much!!!!! We had to wait a little while, but we expected too. Friday night, Ala Moana... always busy. Lol. Once again, thank you!!!

CPK is one of my favorite places to eat. I love the flavors of the food and everyone can usually find something that they'll enjoy. The menu has several options that include Steak, Halibut, Seafood, Pastas, Chicken, Salads and of course Pizza! If you're only wanting a light lunch they have a few small plate options that include salads and flatbreads.  They only have a few options for dessert, I've only had the chocolate lava cake and it was a bit dry. I never save room for dessert but I'd really like to try the butter cake on my next visit.  This location is usually a bit noisy but the service & food have always been good.  See ya soon!!

So Im in a party of 5 1/2. We have a server named Joey. My entire party enjoyed his service! He was very consistent with refilling our drink. Almost so consistent that a friend of mines didn't notice that his drink was refilled for the THIRD time before getting our main course. I asked specifically for extra lemons, "like a lotta lemons." He got me just that. He was kind and always left us with a smile. He didn't look bored or "blah". He made this experience memorable!

The service was excellent, but the food was pretty pedestrian. We ordered a pizza with garlic and chicken, which was pretty good. We also ordered the pasta carbonara, which could have been better. Haven't been to this location in a while, but the food seemed better before.

I love CPK, especially the one here at Ala Moana. It has a decent view.  Although it was a tad bit busy, of course on a Saturday night...we got seated in a decent amount of time & our server James was really nice and helpful! He made sure to let us know the drink specials, asked us if we needed anything and that we got our bread. Very polite. The food that we got was also hands down one of the most yummy plates ever. I have to say 10/10, I recommend you to try it! And don't forget room for dessert.

Honestly today was probably the worst experience I've had here. First off the hostess was pretty snobbish and rude did not even greet us when we walked in door. Just eyed us out until it got awkward enough, then I finally just asked for a "Table for 2." She gave us the sensor and said "15min." Alright. 15min later we were seated greeted and got some drinks. My fiancé wanted to try a new beer, so he went back and forth with waiter, and decided on a beer. When they brought us our drink bread came as well. 2pieces. So when our appetizer came I asked the lady (a woman with long hair and curls, I think she was the manager) if we could please have another round of bread with our artichoke dip. She rudely scoffed at us, rolled her eyes and sped off the tell our waiter to get us bread. When our food finally came I was beyond dissatisfied, the scampi was bland and had 2 noodles and about 50 pieces of zucchini. I barely touched it and was quite obvious I didn't like it. My fiancé also disliked his beer. The waiter then made a comment "didn't like the beer." But yet nothing was done about it. Our bill came out to $70, payed, tipped and left. I mean we're a very young couple so I understand the stereotype. I work in the restaurant industry, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt that it was lunch. But this was truly disappointing. This used to be on of my favorite restaurants. Now it's just upsetting.

Got the full Cobb salad to go... $17 later for what you should call a half salad is so plain. What a waste of money. I always eat here but never had such a bad experience. Don't order the Cobb salad with its cheap ice berg lettuce. I guess if I want to order an over priced small salad. I will stick with the Waldorf salad. Jeez

Me and my friend came here for lunch today, we got seated and the host sat us at a table that looked like it hasn't been bussed yet. There was bread crumbs all over the table, besides that our server Brooke was super nice and explained the new special drinks she was really kind. We then ordered, I got a California club sandwich with a baked potato soup and some avocado spring rolls (which is my favorite lol) 10 minutes later we got our food, it was delicious but half way through my sandwich I found a piece of hair smashed in with the avocado..... I then stopped eating.. I am only rating this 3 stars because of our server, if it wasn't for her I would've probably rated it a one star.

I'm not sure how new it is, but the quinoa and arugula salad is my new favorite from here. Also, I had no idea they served steak, but my friend got that and said it was really good. It comes with potatoes and and side salad. Our server was great. Really attentive and friendly. Came by to fill my iced tea glass regularly. I think his name was Seth.  But the main reason I'm writing this review and also knocking off a star from it being a completely pleasant experience, is the manager (at least I think he was a manager.) The first time he made a sweep of our section, refilling glasses and asking each table how their meal was, I made a joke that he asked everyone but us. But he did it THREE times. He went to each and every table but ours and asked how their experience/meal was. It was really obvious and when it happened once, I thought it was funny. Not three times.

The birthday meal...nananana~~ I came here on my birthday weekend and I did really enjoyed it, so I'm giving it 5 stars. It was lunch time and the wait for 2 people on a Saturday was 5-10 minutes. What a great start!  As soon as we got the menu, I scrolled through the dishes and entrees. I decided I'll order the artichoke and spinach spaghettini and my bf wanted the chicken penne pesto. I had a reward thing on their app so we got a appetizer/small plate of spicy poblano flatbread. The server brought out the complimentary bread first. Then the appetizer came. The flat bread was really thin and crispy, but very good. It was a little spicy but I liked it. Our pasta came after we finished our appetizer. The spaghettini was good, it was seasoned well, not too bland or too salty. The noodles were soft. The chicken penne pesto was yummy. I liked that more than the spaghettini. It had a thicker sauce compare to the other plate. I like the flavor in it. It was a lot of food and we wanted to save room for the dessert so we got a container for the leftovers. I had a free dessert for my birthday so I got the chocolate souffle with vanilla bean ice cream(extra cost for ice cream). The waitress also put in a candle after my bf mentioned it was my birthday. Mmmm...I'm a chocoholic so I love anything dark chocolate-ish dessert. This was a very very yummy and sweet heavenly dessert. I could lick the plate!  Service was prompt and attentive. The server also wrote "Happy Birthday" on our receipt. I don't remember her name but she was really awesome!  I probably will come back if there's some sort of special occasion. This place is pricey. But I used my gift card for this meal. Arghhh...

I have a weakness for their spinach artichoke dip.  I like to order it with side pita bread and pretty much use the bread to get every bit of dip left.  I would lick the bowl if I could but that would make me a savage.  Haha. All kidding aside, I normally order the BBQ chicken salad and add avocado.  Along with the salad, I'll also order a pizza.  As far as pizza goes, I love their wild mushroom and BBQ chicken pizza.  Both are fantastic choices. My all time fave pasta is the Kung Pao Spaghetti.  It has a real spicy kick to it!  Which I absolutely love.  I usually order this with chicken and shrimp...best decision ever!  Just thinking about this dish is making me hungry.  I'm thinking that I should stop writing this review and get me some CPK.  Toddles for now!

Did you know that It's much more than pizza?  This place looked promising. The menu looks great but maybe I should've ordered a pizza. Instead I ordered spinache and asparagus spaghettini with grilled chicken - it was fine. Just fine!  Is try this place again but what is it with these parents who let their kids run through the restaurants?  It's not cute!  Is it an American thing?  Lol. 3 stars CPK. That's all.

Go to the Kahala Mall location. This one was too noisy and they did not have enough staff. Also, avoid the poke salad. It was nothing more than an arugula salad with some underdressed poke on top. All of that being said, the spinach dip, artichoke pizza, chicken pecatta, and drinks were at the usual excellent CPK quality.

I usually love cook but ever since the new owner the portion sizes are getting smaller and smaller. I went in yesterday with my husband to eat a chicken tequila pasta and the noodles were decent amount but the chicken! Chicken is already cut off to less than a bite size pieces, and they literally gave me 5 pieces. I had to cut them into sand just so I can have chicken on every bite of my pasta. I pay more than $15 on a plate of pasta and you can't even give me at least a breast of chicken?? It wasn't even half a breast of chicken on my plate. Better to go next door to macaroni grill. Do me a favor, stop skimping on the protein. This has happened on other pasta like chicken fettuccine pasta too where I had more mushrooms then chicken. Also, I always seemed to have the same problem with this for a few years every time.

Ambiance is wonderful, with a nice window view of the ocean. This location seems to always be busy, but the staff keeps up very well. Employees are always friendly and helpful. Pricing is decent, and quality is great. I only ever order pizza from here, so I can't speak for the rest of the menu.... but it is a pizza kitchen after all. Drinks are good and there is a large selection.
Always good food. Sometimes service is a little slow but worth the wait. When we order out my staff always wants food from CPK!

I love this place. Been coming here since middle school.  Good is always the same and you can order things that are not on the menu.  My favorite is bbq chicken salad & tomato pesto pasta.  It can get super busy so call ahead or you'll have to wait forever :|

Coming to this location on a Friday night be prepared to wait 40 minutes for a table.  Inside it's quite noisy, but if you don't mind that then it's ok.  The food here is good. Definitely get their delicious spinach and artichoke dip. It would've nice to have more chips though. Their pizzas are good. I prefer their hand tossed versus the thin crust pizzas.  Overall it's a pretty good place to eat. Only thing is the wait times and the noise inside the restaurant.

Come here every once in a while and figured I should finally write a review. Went there yesterday with some friends and had a good time.  PARKING: easy to find parking since located at the ala moana mall. Usually park on the 3rd floor open parking off Atkinson.  SERVICE: it was pretty busy when we went around dinner time so service was kinda slow, but our server was great! He was super friendly and very helpful!  ATMOSPHERE: casual dining. Kinda loud tho so made it hard to keep a conversation. Had to yell across the table. Lol FOOD: I've always enjoyed eating here. Everything is flavorful and unique. Today I had the wild mushroom pizza with white truffle oil. I love mushrooms and truffle oil, so it was bomb. Only thing is, the oil was just served on the side, I would of preferred if it was already spread on the pizza. Also tried the Thai chicken pizza, which was surprisingly good. I didn't think I would like the peanut sauce, but it was great! Also had butter cake for dessert with ice cream. It was good but a little too sweet.  Overall, good experience. Great food and service.

Food was mediocre and service was bad. The sales came out same time as entrees and was wilted and soggy

It has been awhile since i have eaten here- and now I know why. The food is only subpar. I was looking forward to tortilla soup and some Halibut. But - the halibut was way over cooked- and the soup was not good. Very disappointing.

Leaning tower of pizza. The high ceiling spacious dining area occupied by a very long bar with more different types of alcohol than spring break at Cancun and a woodfire pizza oven gives of an affordable family dinner vibe I got the 5 cheese pizza and it was really good followed by the butter cake with ice cream to give me a bigger sugar rush than a kid at the Cadbury factory, the pricing was decent and the service was friendly.  The food came out really quick too which was good but i feel the quality and presentation could have been slightly better, free soft drink refills were a plus I would come here again but not in a rush

Good ambience; nice view overlooking the ocean in the corner of the restaurant.  Service is wonderful! The staff is always so cheerful and delightful to interact with. It makes for a pleasant dining experience. However, we've only ever sat at the bar area because the wait is usually 30 minutes or more for regular seating no matter when we come (hence, the one less star). Because it is always so crowded no matter what day of the week you come in, it does tend to be on the louder side. Also taking into account all the music from Mai Tai's across the way.  We always order the chicken piccata with pasta and the bbq chicken chopped salad - it's our favorite and has been for the past couple years. Sometimes we'll deviate, but we like what we like! Ambience: 7/10 Service: 10/10 Food: 9/10 Wait time: 6/10

Being that CPK is a chain restaurant, I am pleasantly surprised with the wonderful service and food as they never fail to disappoint. My favorites are all their salads & pasta as well as the baked potato chowder which is excellent!

Being that CPK is a chain restaurant, I am pleasantly surprised with the wonderful service and food as they never fail to disappoint. My favorites are all their salads & pasta as well as the baked potato chowder which is excellent!

Placed a order online to pick up 5 hours later. When I arrived on time the food was not ready for another half hour. It wasn't even that crowded. It looked like the staff was in transition of a shift change and no one really cared about customers waiting on their orders as well. Poor service... I had to ask for a bag for my salad, utensils and bread when they usually include everything from the get go.

Food is always good, but was shocked when waitress Michelle stated there's a $0.75 extra per lettuce for the lettuce wrap. Really? Four pieces of lettuce and you expect me to eat all this chicken mushroom filling? Hmmm not possible. This is the first time in history that I was told there was a charge. Granted she was doing her job and it's only $0.75, I decided to request for more bread. Keep in mind I'm always here with family and friends.  Haha Heads up people $0.75 charge for extra lettuce for their lettuce wraps! Auwe.

We ordered the mahi mahi tacos and there was hardly any fish. When I mentioned it to the waiter he said that was normal and I some customers buy extra fish for four extra dollars. I switched it out for a pizza which was pretty good with lots of toppings

CPK is one of my favorite places to eat. I've been to most of the locations on the island, and this is one of my favorites because of the location and the convenience. This location in particular earns itself three-stars from me, and it's quite difficult for me to rate it less than five stars because I love this restaurant chain so much. SERVICE: This is the reason for my three-star rating. Hit or miss; "hit" most of the time, "miss" some of the time. I've gotten a few servers that were less-than-enthusiastic. Maybe it was a bad night; however, I'm not very pleased with the way they handle the Pizza Dough Rewards. TWO out of THREE times my family and I have dined at this location, they did not grant us the pizza dough credit (and mind you, it was a lot of missed dining credit). Being the Chinese gal that I am, I was disappointed because that means I wouldn't get my discount :( Even after I told the server(s) (they were two different servers on the two different occasions) about my Pizza Dough Rewards membership, and even after I wrote down my membership number on the receipt for them to see, I still did not get my points. I've never had any trouble with the other CPK locations, so either management at Ala Moana has to do something about their servers acknowledging the Pizza Dough Rewards, or CPK should implement a new system to have their customers get credit more easily. My favorites to eat here are the Thai Crunch Salad (no chicken, replace it with avocado!) and the Tomato Basil Spaghettini (not on the menu anymore, but I still love to order this). Recently, my dad also ordered the shrimp scampi, but we were disappointed because they barely gave him any noodles, and there was not much else on the plate (and it's one of the more expensive menu items!). Other than that, I'm almost always pleased with my experience at CPK. Maybe just go to the Kahala Mall location, and avoid Ala Moana.
Fish tacos amazing, berry sangria amazing, view amazing, service amazing ....need I say more.

Amazing food and we didn't wait very long to be served even though the place was packed. Their California Club Pizza is AMAZING! I've tried it before at a different California Pizza Kitchen and this one did not disappoint. We sat close to a window and while we were eating someone was doing fireworks, so we had a great dinner show.

Amazing food and we didn't wait very long to be served even though the place was packed. Their California Club Pizza is AMAZING! I've tried it before at a different California Pizza Kitchen and this one did not disappoint. We sat close to a window and while we were eating someone was doing fireworks, so we had a great dinner show.

Had a great dinner here the other day with my boyfriend. As always the appetizers were so good,  the artichoke dip and avocado rolls. But I decided to only write a review because our waitress was the best! So it may be a pet peeve of mine but I always get a coke with lime in it and every single time she refilled my drink she put in a new lime! I've notice a lot of waiters/waitresses don't do that even though I believe they should. This sounds kind of small but I really appreciated it and I loved that she was thoughtful enough to do so. She noticed my boyfriend was playing Pokemon Go and shared her enthusiasm for the game! I wish I remembered her name so I could give her credit, but we ate there in the evening around 7pm - 8:30pm on Tuesday 12th July as a party of two right next to the door on the left side when you walk in. I got the shrimp scampi zucchini cause it was one of the house favorites but I wasn't really impressed (I know kind of dumb going to CPK and I get shrimp but that's what I was feelin, I'll stick to pizza next time). That's the only reason I didn't give five stars for the review. We got the chocolate soufflé for dessert though and I loved it, so so good. Overall thanks CPK and our waitress for a great evening!

But I decided to only write a review because our waitress was the best! So it may be a pet peeve of mine but I always get a coke with lime in it and every single time she refilled my drink she put in a new lime! I've notice a lot of waiters/waitresses don't do that even though I believe they should. This sounds kind of small but I really appreciated it and I loved that she was thoughtful enough to do so. She noticed my boyfriend was playing Pokemon Go and shared her enthusiasm for the game! I wish I remembered her name so I could give her credit, but we ate there in the evening around 7pm - 8:30pm on Tuesday 12th July as a party of two right next to the door on the left side when you walk in. I got the shrimp scampi zucchini cause it was one of the house favorites but I wasn't really impressed (I know kind of dumb going to CPK and I get shrimp but that's what I was feelin, I'll stick to pizza next time). That's the only reason I didn't give five stars for the review. We got the chocolate soufflé for dessert though and I loved it, so so good. Overall thanks CPK and our waitress for a great evening!

Always great food.  Usually busy so there is usually a wait which is the only draw back.  The servers are pleasant the food comes fast.  The food is always delicious.  I always have a hard time choosing because everything looks good and it is good.  One of my favorite restaurant chains.  Whats not to like.

Always great food.  Usually busy so there is usually a wait which is the only draw back.  The servers are pleasant the food comes fast.  The food is always delicious.  I always have a hard time choosing because everything looks good and it is good.  One of my favorite restaurant chains.  Whats not to like.

We usually love CPK but today the service was bad! First of all before we ordered, I mentioned to my server that I had a free birthday dessert & pizza dough that I wanted to use. She took my card to check, came back & told me I couldn't take advantage of both things....hmmm, usually have no problem. Ok, then my daughter requested more salad dressing,  she brings back this little "shoyu" dish with a thin layer of dressing.  Not enough! Needed to ask again, then she brings a whole dish full, little too late, huh? Then I order my free birthday dessert: the butter cake with ice cream. Then the check comes,  I am charged for the ice cream, What?  When I asked her, she tells me that the ice cream is not part of my "free" birthday dessert.  The ice cream is how they "upsell", REALLY!!! Complained to the manager & he immediately took off the ice cream & used my dough rewards! No wonder, the place was empty!!!!

We stopped in for a quick lunch before our pedicure appointment.  The avocado egg rolls are divine!  We have to get these each time we come.  We split a sausage, pepperoni, and mushroom pizza.  Can you tell we were starving?  I forgot to take a picture until we were almost done.

CPK was one of my favorite places to go to when I am out and about.  I love their salads and usually order an appetizer, half salad and dessert.  I have noticed that the prices for the half said has gone up quite a bit this past year and on my last visit, the half salad is now the price of what a full salad used to be AND the portion size was less than what I usually received.  Come on guys, for $17.00 I can find many other places for good food and a better deal.  I wondered why it was so empty and we had no wait time when we went last Saturday at noon.  Now I know.  I am but one person, however, I will not be going back to CPK.

Go to the Kahala Mall location. This one was too noisy and they did not have enough staff. Also, avoid the poke salad. It was nothing more than an arugula salad with some underdressed poke on top. All of that being said, the spinach dip, artichoke pizza, chicken pecatta, and drinks were at the usual excellent CPK quality.

I usually love cook but ever since the new owner the portion sizes are getting smaller and smaller. I went in yesterday with my husband to eat a chicken tequila pasta and the noodles were decent amount but the chicken! Chicken is already cut off to less than a bite size pieces, and they literally gave me 5 pieces. I had to cut them into sand just so I can have chicken on every bite of my pasta. I pay more than $15 on a plate of pasta and you can't even give me at least a breast of chicken?? It wasn't even half a breast of chicken on my plate. Better to go next door to macaroni grill. Do me a favor, stop skimping on the protein. This has happened on other pasta like chicken fettuccine pasta too where I had more mushrooms then chicken. Also, I always seemed to have the same problem with this for a few years every time.

We ordered the mahi mahi tacos and there was hardly any fish. When I mentioned it to the waiter he said that was normal and I some customers buy extra fish for four extra dollars. I switched it out for a pizza which was pretty good with lots of toppings

CPK is my go to whenever I am craving pizza. My family and I enjoy coming here for dinner and even though sometimes it's a long wait, it is still worth it :) The only junk thing about this CPK location is that they don't take reservation so I recommend you to come early to put down your name! Getting into the restaurant, their service is good and when it gets busy, it's hard to see where your server is but they try to come to your table as much as possible! Now on to the fooooood!! I love their avocado rolls, original bbq chicken pizza, & the chicken tequila fettuccine and don't worry, no tequila in this pasta LOL. The avocado rolls has chicken, cheese and avocado filling. It comes with 3 whole pieces that are cut in halves. It comes with two types of sauce, ranch and spicy ranch. I recommend using the spicy one and it is not too spicy! The original bbq chicken pizza, is really good! They have chicken, onion and a bbq sauce that is spread around the pizza. So if you love bbq flavor, this will be a good pizza! The chicken tequila fettuccine is my favoriteeee! This has a hint of lemon flavor and one of my friends tried it and said it reminds her of a Vietnamese flavor :o It's not as heavy compared to other pastas and they use spinach fettuccine! Makes me feel healthy eating that lol. Overall, you can never go wrong with CPK! Their portion size is good for two meals and you feel leaving full!

I really love coming to CPK ( california pizza kitchen) its one of my favorite restaurant to go to. Where ever I go there is always a California Pizza Kitchen around.  I love there pasta over there its my favorite!! The pasta taste amazing with a lot of parmesan cheese on top. I ate all there pasta and I love the Garlic pasta the best with sub Chicken in the pasta.  The menu changed so there is less things on the menu then before. I remember back then when they had so much on the menu but now they have taken things out that weren't selling much. It was disappointing to me cuz I really enjoyed the old style food they had. Now they have less option to pick from.  They also have really good drinks like the Long Island Cocktail. Its really strong but the flavor inside makes you want more :P LOL I love cocktails so every single one is my favorite!! Gotta come try the CPK in the Ala Moana location! its on the 3rd floor

What can I say? I'm a sucker for their appetizers, their Thai Chicken Pizza, Thai Salad, Kung Pao Spaghetti, and their tiramisu (WHICH THEY HAVE DISCONTINUED!!!!!). I'm inconsolable. Even my picky eater of a son LOVED that dessert. I wish they would bring it back, or at least give me the recipe or vendor who sells it! That stuff was legendary, smh. Anyway, if you're a big fan of CPK, this place is consistently good, but nearly always busy. If you have a hungry party of more than 4, it might behoove you to make reservations, or at least don't go during the lunch or dinner rush.

It's your typical California Pizza Kitchen - from the décor to the menu.  This company certainly proves consistency, no matter the location.  I've been here a few times.  Not my favorite location but it is sufficient for my CPK fix.  I'll be back.

It's your typical California Pizza Kitchen - from the décor to the menu.  This company certainly proves consistency, no matter the location.  I've been here a few times.  Not my favorite location but it is sufficient for my CPK fix.  I'll be back.
Always good and you can meet interesting people at the counter.  My Thai salad was good as all the salads and pizza was great.
Always good and you can meet interesting people at the counter.  My Thai salad was good as all the salads and pizza was great.

Lunch was delicious at CPK Ala Moana! Great friendly service, also signed up to get discounts on future dining, just ask your server. 15 min wait, very busy atmosphere, we didn't mind it at all. We will be back, thanks CPK.

Lunch was delicious at CPK Ala Moana! Great friendly service, also signed up to get discounts on future dining, just ask your server. 15 min wait, very busy atmosphere, we didn't mind it at all. We will be back, thanks CPK.

Did a call-in and didn't have to wait. Ordered the rib-eye steak rare, and it was delicious! I love the free bread too. I wanted more, so I wish we were offered more, but probably better for my waist that I didn't eat anymore. Our waiter was nice and friendly. I liked that the waiter looked at me most of the time. I feel like waiters tend to give more attention to the guys thinking they're paying for it, but I felt like I got more attention this time, so that was nice for a change. And, yes, I did pay too. The waiter reminded me of someone I went to high school with whom I don't talk to anymore. Similar feature and manners. He seemed gentle and delicate, very sweet.  Anyway, the food was delicious. I would go back again. Also, the honey lemonade was good too. The only thing I don't like about drinking at these kinds of restaurants is they're always cheap on the alcohol. It always tastes like more juice than alcohol.

The cpk menu seems to keep getting smaller..but oh well at least they have ribeye steak as a regular menu item now...pizzas pastas & appetizers are pretty consistent. ..I guess that's why we always come back

I love CPK, especially the one here at Ala Moana. It has a decent view.  Although it was a tad bit busy, of course on a Saturday night...we got seated in a decent amount of time & our server James was really nice and helpful! He made sure to let us know the drink specials, asked us if we needed anything and that we got our bread. Very polite. The food that we got was also hands down one of the most yummy plates ever. I have to say 10/10, I recommend you to try it! And don't forget room for dessert.

Ambiance is wonderful, with a nice window view of the ocean. This location seems to always be busy, but the staff keeps up very well. Employees are always friendly and helpful. Pricing is decent, and quality is great. I only ever order pizza from here, so I can't speak for the rest of the menu.... but it is a pizza kitchen after all. Drinks are good and there is a large selection.

CPK is one of my favorite places to eat. I've been to most of the locations on the island, and this is one of my favorites because of the location and the convenience. This location in particular earns itself three-stars from me, and it's quite difficult for me to rate it less than five stars because I love this restaurant chain so much. SERVICE: This is the reason for my three-star rating. Hit or miss; "hit" most of the time, "miss" some of the time. I've gotten a few servers that were less-than-enthusiastic. Maybe it was a bad night; however, I'm not very pleased with the way they handle the Pizza Dough Rewards. TWO out of THREE times my family and I have dined at this location, they did not grant us the pizza dough credit (and mind you, it was a lot of missed dining credit). Being the Chinese gal that I am, I was disappointed because that means I wouldn't get my discount :( Even after I told the server(s) (they were two different servers on the two different occasions) about my Pizza Dough Rewards membership, and even after I wrote down my membership number on the receipt for them to see, I still did not get my points. I've never had any trouble with the other CPK locations, so either management at Ala Moana has to do something about their servers acknowledging the Pizza Dough Rewards, or CPK should implement a new system to have their customers get credit more easily. My favorites to eat here are the Thai Crunch Salad (no chicken, replace it with avocado!) and the Tomato Basil Spaghettini (not on the menu anymore, but I still love to order this). Recently, my dad also ordered the shrimp scampi, but we were disappointed because they barely gave him any noodles, and there was not much else on the plate (and it's one of the more expensive menu items!). Other than that, I'm almost always pleased with my experience at CPK. Maybe just go to the Kahala Mall location, and avoid Ala Moana.

Just ate at Ala Moana CPK with a family of 7. Ordered almost $200 worth of appetizers, small plates and entrees. Ordered lettuce wraps and was given the sautéed chicken with 3 pieces of head lettuce. Asked for more lettuce and was told they charge .75 for extra.  Ordered it and was given 3 additional pieces. Seems petty to charge charge customers especially when they only give 3 additional pieces. Kung pao chicken pasta was salty tonite too. Disappointed

Service: 3/5. Waitress took too long to receive the bill  Food; 4/5 for margarita pizza 2/5 for cream penne pasta - plain
Service: 3/5. Waitress took too long to receive the bill  Food; 4/5 for margarita pizza 2/5 for cream penne pasta - plain

Came here last night with my BF since we couldn't decided if wanted to eat at home, at Shirokiya or at CPK. Our wait wasn't that long, it took about 15-20 minutes tops & we went around 630PM ish. Our waitress was Devon & she did an amazing job! She didn't even need to write down our orders that she memorized what we ordered. We ordered a fresh strawberry mango cooler(I think? Lol), 2 chicken piccatas, a spinach artichoke dip, mac & cheese, fire grilled ribeye, & butter cake with vanilla ice cream. When I was done with my drink, Devon asked if I wanted a strawberry lemonade on the house but I told her no, I'm ok. Even though this CPK is the busiest, I always seem to come back. Not just for the food, but for the customer service as well! The chicken piccata is both, my boyfriend & I's favorite! Even thought the capers keep it salty, the flavor is just there. Also, you can never leave without eating the butter cake with the vanilla ice cream! Thank you Devon for the great service! :)

Ordered a kids meal pizza with ice cream sundae.  My son didn't like thr icecream and gave it to me. I didn't like it. The sundae tasted like  frostbite.  The hot fudge tasted horrible. Thai crunch salad with avocado is always good. The waiter was nice.

The food is consistently good, priced appropriately and the service is always outstanding! Sara is simply the best--running the bar and counter where I always sit on my breaks from work. Some people are just meant to make your day and she always does! Thank you Sara for your stellar service!

Honestly today was probably the worst experience I've had here. First off the hostess was pretty snobbish and rude did not even greet us when we walked in door. Just eyed us out until it got awkward enough, then I finally just asked for a "Table for 2." She gave us the sensor and said "15min." Alright. 15min later we were seated greeted and got some drinks. My fiancé wanted to try a new beer, so he went back and forth with waiter, and decided on a beer. When they brought us our drink bread came as well. 2pieces. So when our appetizer came I asked the lady (a woman with long hair and curls, I think she was the manager) if we could please have another round of bread with our artichoke dip. She rudely scoffed at us, rolled her eyes and sped off the tell our waiter to get us bread. When our food finally came I was beyond dissatisfied, the scampi was bland and had 2 noodles and about 50 pieces of zucchini. I barely touched it and was quite obvious I didn't like it. My fiancé also disliked his beer. The waiter then made a comment "didn't like the beer." But yet nothing was done about it. Our bill came out to $70, payed, tipped and left. I mean we're a very young couple so I understand the stereotype. I work in the restaurant industry, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt that it was lunch. But this was truly disappointing. This used to be on of my favorite restaurants. Now it's just upsetting.
Always good food. Sometimes service is a little slow but worth the wait. When we order out my staff always wants food from CPK!

Dined here for dinner last night with my family,  I had a party of 9 and waited for about 10 minutes till we got seated.  I expected longer since they seemed to be busy most of the time.  We had a wonderful time, our server was great!! friendly and professional.  I wish I got her name.  One thing I was very impressed of is the service staff was very prompt.  We didn't wait too long for our food to arrive and everything was on point!! food here was very tasty and delicious as always.  Don't forget to make room for dessert! this wasn't my first time here as some of my family were and it sure ain't my last... I work at a restaurant and I know how crazy and difficult it can be.  Thank you to our server/ staff for a wonderful experience.

Dined here for dinner last night with my family,  I had a party of 9 and waited for about 10 minutes till we got seated.  I expected longer since they seemed to be busy most of the time.  We had a wonderful time, our server was great!! friendly and professional.  I wish I got her name.  One thing I was very impressed of is the service staff was very prompt.  We didn't wait too long for our food to arrive and everything was on point!! food here was very tasty and delicious as always.  Don't forget to make room for dessert! this wasn't my first time here as some of my family were and it sure ain't my last... I work at a restaurant and I know how crazy and difficult it can be.  Thank you to our server/ staff for a wonderful experience.

Had dinner here with a friend again.  If eating light, we share the cobb salad and the brusell sprout flatbread.  YUM!  If you see room at the bar/counter, you can bypass the hostess desk and go seat yourself at the bar/counter - it's first come, first serve seating.  Also don't forget your Pizza Dough (CPK rewards program), just give them your phone number associated with your account. CPK currently has a holiday deal going on: for every $100 gift card (gc) purchase you buy, CPK will give you 2 gcs (a $20 gc and a $10 gc) to be used at separate times since each card has separate valid use dates (very clever of you CPK!).  You have until early january to use the $20 gc and then after that you have about 1 month to use the $10 gc.  A lot of people (like me hahaha) will forget to use the bonus gcs before the expiration date and lose out on the bonus. Our server told us that it's like getting 30% off your purchase which is incorrect.  I simply explained to her that the $30 bonus is actually about a 23% discount since you paying $100 to get $130 value vs 30% which you would pay $91 to get $130 value.  She seemed rather irate by my pointing this out even though I meant NO HARM OR INSULT whatsoever toward her.  I wish people would not take things so personally.  Nevertheless, I didn't let it ruin my evening.  In my opinion, with the conditions limiting the use of the $30 bonus and it being only 3% more savings, you are better off buying gift cards from Costco.  Costco sells 2 x $50 CPK gift card sets for $80 so that's a 20% discount.

I like that CPK offers vegetarian and gluten free options, but I'm surprised that they still do not offer a vegan option. It's just hard to choose this restaurant when there are so many other good local pizza places on the island. However I do like the pizza and I do like the salads. I always have a yummy experience with good service. But I only come here when it is convenient, I never feel compelled to seek out this restaurant, especially because there is generally quite a wait, and therefore I am only giving it three stars.

Watch out!  Told waiter about the $10 off $40 promo.  No problem.  Ordered, ate, then comes the bill.  It does NOT show the $10 off.  Asked the waiter for a new bill with the $10 off.  His answer:  Oh, I do that later, after you pay.  Does this make any sense?  No.  I told him bring a new bill with the $10 off.  If this isn't deceptive I don't know what is.  So...I'm supposed to give him my cash or credit card, he swipes it and then gives me an updated bill with the $10 off?  Doubt it.  Management knows.  Corporate is next.   Be aware, check your bill before you pay.  Needless to say, CPK isn't high on my go to restaurants any more.

We show up spur of the moment to eat, and just so happens we have a birthday.   Place is popping filled with the dinner crowd.  It's about a 10 min wait that's not bad.  It didn't take long for our server to show up, take our drink order and bring those out shortly. Sicilian Pizza 16.99 This was okay.  Nice taste just not my kind of pizza.  It was a small pizza made even smaller by the price.  I could have had a large for that. Garlic Cream Fettucine with Chicken 16.49 This was good.  I could smell and taste the garlic which I love.  Somehow  though, it didn't  anything I could be excited about.  I gave a taste to my other and told her I like it.  Right away she said yours is better. Butter Cake ala Hagen Dazs 9.79 If there was a saving grace to this meal this was it.  Cake and ice cream is always a winning combination in my book. Beehive Sangria 8.99 Refreshing and delicious.  Wish it came in a bigger glass or allowed one refill. Noel, our server, brought out the  complimentary birthday cake.  Looked nice, a good portion too.  I was offered a bite but turned it down.  There wasn't any more room. Overall it was a good experience.  I'm not a fan of CPK. Before this visit, the last time I had was decades ago because I wasn't impressed then either.  It's a nice place, the food is decent.  Customer service is spot on.  Maybe it's just too hip and pretentious for me.

We've been to this location many times. Food is always good, but service is a hit or miss. Tonight we had great service from a guy, that I can't remember his name, but he has been there for a while. We went about 5:30pm and got seated right away. Surprisingly there was no wait! We had a rewards coupon to use, spend $40 get $10 off. We had to plan our meal accordingly. I ordered my kids a kids pasta with Alfredo sauce and chicken (didn't know we could add chicken, this was the first time we were offered this option!). My husband and I shared a half order of Chinese chicken salad and a Sicilian pizza. My kids always love their pasta with some added fresh parmesean cheese. They ate most of it, until they heard we were ordering dessert...lol! The Chinese Chicken salad was ok. Not enough crunch (won ton strips) and the lettuce looked wilted and a little old, not crispy and fresh. Sicilian pizza was good. I love thin crispy crust pizzas! It has a little spice to it, which is perfect. They have generous portions of meat on this pizza and cooked perfectly! For dessert we had our favorite...butter cake with ice cream! If you haven't had this cake yet, it's worth a try. It's nice and buttery and warm. One taste and you will eat the whole thing no matter how full you are, we do...lol! If you go here on a Friday night, go around the time when the fireworks go off. Amazing view but the restaurant does get crowded on Fridays! The reason for 4 stars is salad could be fresher, and I wish they would bring back the miso salad. Also service is great or bad, depending on the night and the person.

Not enough crunch (won ton strips) and the lettuce looked wilted and a little old, not crispy and fresh. Sicilian pizza was good. I love thin crispy crust pizzas! It has a little spice to it, which is perfect. They have generous portions of meat on this pizza and cooked perfectly! For dessert we had our favorite...butter cake with ice cream! If you haven't had this cake yet, it's worth a try. It's nice and buttery and warm. One taste and you will eat the whole thing no matter how full you are, we do...lol! If you go here on a Friday night, go around the time when the fireworks go off. Amazing view but the restaurant does get crowded on Fridays! The reason for 4 stars is salad could be fresher, and I wish they would bring back the miso salad. Also service is great or bad, depending on the night and the person.

I pop in every so often when I need a convenient lunch. Decent food at a reasonable price, and a well run CPK altogether.  Seth and Dave are great and are a couple of the best casual dining waiters I've seen in years.

I pop in every so often when I need a convenient lunch. Decent food at a reasonable price, and a well run CPK altogether.  Seth and Dave are great and are a couple of the best casual dining waiters I've seen in years.

Sunday night was quite busy, so 40 minutes wait time was Ok. We were buzzed about 15 minutes after the quote time. We already knew what we wanted to order. Server was nice and I specifically said Avacado Egg Rolls for our appetizer, mind that the Avacado Egg Rolls is an Appetizer on the Menu. Bread and drinks came out fast. Waited 20 minutes and still no appetizers. When the food finally came, the Avacado Egg Rolls came out with my entree, Kung Pao Spaghetti. 2 minutes later, our Thin Crust Pizza came out. Egg rolls weren't hot. Spaghetti was hot but the portion has gotten a lot smaller. Thin crust pizza wasn't crunchy but was chewy and hard to cut. Server refilled waters but never refilled my kids drinks. ( Kids drinks have free refills, right? )  Might just order take out next time and eat it downstairs in the food court.

I ordered the turkey, bacon, avocado club and it was downright horrible. First off there was only about 1 ounce of turkey on the entire sandwich. A few dinky pieces of avocado and a slice of bacon. The ginormous "ciabatta" bread was SMOTHERED in mayonnaise and immediately was falling apart when I attempted to picked it up. It was like I was eating something out of an airport vending machine. I know..I went into a pizza place to get a sandwich but I expected a much better product. Sorry...wont be back,

I like that CPK offers vegetarian and gluten free options, but I'm surprised that they still do not offer a vegan option. It's just hard to choose this restaurant when there are so many other good local pizza places on the island. However I do like the pizza and I do like the salads. I always have a yummy experience with good service. But I only come here when it is convenient, I never feel compelled to seek out this restaurant, especially because there is generally quite a wait, and therefore I am only giving it three stars.

Had dinner here with a friend again.  If eating light, we share the cobb salad and the brusell sprout flatbread.  YUM!  If you see room at the bar/counter, you can bypass the hostess desk and go seat yourself at the bar/counter - it's first come, first serve seating.  Also don't forget your Pizza Dough (CPK rewards program), just give them your phone number associated with your account. CPK currently has a holiday deal going on: for every $100 gift card (gc) purchase you buy, CPK will give you 2 gcs (a $20 gc and a $10 gc) to be used at separate times since each card has separate valid use dates (very clever of you CPK!).  You have until early january to use the $20 gc and then after that you have about 1 month to use the $10 gc.  A lot of people (like me hahaha) will forget to use the bonus gcs before the expiration date and lose out on the bonus. Our server told us that it's like getting 30% off your purchase which is incorrect.  I simply explained to her that the $30 bonus is actually about a 23% discount since you paying $100 to get $130 value vs 30% which you would pay $91 to get $130 value.  She seemed rather irate by my pointing this out even though I meant NO HARM OR INSULT whatsoever toward her.  I wish people would not take things so personally.  Nevertheless, I didn't let it ruin my evening.  In my opinion, with the conditions limiting the use of the $30 bonus and it being only 3% more savings, you are better off buying gift cards from Costco.  Costco sells 2 x $50 CPK gift card sets for $80 so that's a 20% discount.

Had the greatest service tonite!!! Accidentally ordered the small asparagus arugula salad to accompany a delicious cedar plank salmon when I actually wanted the quinoa arugula salad. Our server Bartek made my evening by bringing me the correct one after I had already eaten the smaller portion. Thank you Bartek!!!

Had the greatest service tonite!!! Accidentally ordered the small asparagus arugula salad to accompany a delicious cedar plank salmon when I actually wanted the quinoa arugula salad. Our server Bartek made my evening by bringing me the correct one after I had already eaten the smaller portion. Thank you Bartek!!!

I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants or stores. I don't normally enjoy patronizing places that don't really need my business--they obviously have no shortage of people willing to wait 45-60 minutes for a table on a weekday night. BUT there is something about CPK that keeps us coming back. I think this is what it is:  1. My kids. They do something to kids that gets them hooked. Coloring sheets and crayons? Bottomless drinks? Individual pizzas? $1 dessert menu? All of the above--cumulatively it brainwashes kids into thinking CPK is the best place on earth. At least for my kids, that is.  2. There is something on the menu for every palate. There is no bad item on the menu! Seriously! I've tried them all!  3. It's consistent--you get the same thing every time. Even if you order the oriental chicken salad consistently from 8th grade until you're 41 (I'm speaking from experience)...you will get the same exact salad every single friggen time!  4. The service never fails. I've never had a bad server at CPK. They're always friendly, pleasant and trying hard to please.  5. DOUGH REWARDS. My blasted CPK dough rewards app keeps notifying me when I have $5, a free dessert, or whatever coupon/discount to use up before it expires! I hurry in to use it--because only a fool would pass this up!  CPK will continue to be the only place that satisfies everyone in the family. Oh and you know what is ultimately satisfying for mom? That with dough rewards, you don't only get the generic brownie or sundae free treat on your birthday, but ANY DESSERT ON THE MENU! So like, you can order the chocolate souffle if you so desire (which I do) and it's on them! Aaaaaah. And it doesn't even have to be on your actual birthday because they give you the coupon to use anytime that month I think it is. Can it get any better than that?!

I've been here a few times... like ten times... and never wrote a review. #shame  The food is definitely a hit or miss here.... although I used to ONLY come here for the four cheese ravioli, and well, they got rid of it. I couldn't even say goodbye!!! Since they yanked it off the menu, PERMANENTLY, I've been on the hunt for another LOVE at CPK...  The appetizers... well, none really stood out. I didn't like that the Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings had a spicy sauce sprayed on.. and it was cold so these are probably from the freezer. The salads are decent, can't complain. The soups, ....wait for it.... , are DELICIOUS! I love the baked potato soup and farmers market. I actually got the farmers market last time since they were sold out of baked potato (my friend also raves about the tortilla). Anytime I don't get a soup, I regret it.  The pizzas are yummy too. The pastas are OK.  Garlic Cream Fettuccine was alright, a bit bland but the shrimp was very tender and juicy. The Bolognese Spaghetti was also just alright.  The butter cake.. mhmm... SO SO GOOD!!! It's really more of a 3 start review (especially now without the four cheese ravioli), I only gave 4 stars because the service was awesome! The waiters here are on it and the managers are very nice--I haven't had an issue with the customer service at all here! I think that's what always makes me come back, the friendly staff. :) and the hope that four cheese ravioli will make it back on....  To summarize: Great customer service, good pizzas, and great soups!  Tip: Sit window side!!  The section by the bathrooms is warmer than the ones by the window. I think the AC might be broken?

Definitely one of my "go to" places for as long as I can remember...any location. If in doubt, CPK! Loveeee ALL of their salads, esp. Moroccan Chicken Salad (interesting ingredients, BIG portion). They have one of the best Spinach Dips, IMO. Chicken Tequila Fettucine pasta, mmmm! Unique flavor, must try. Tip: get discount gift cards at Sam's before you go. See you soon, CPK!

Definitely one of my "go to" places for as long as I can remember...any location. If in doubt, CPK! Loveeee ALL of their salads, esp. Moroccan Chicken Salad (interesting ingredients, BIG portion). They have one of the best Spinach Dips, IMO. Chicken Tequila Fettucine pasta, mmmm! Unique flavor, must try. Tip: get discount gift cards at Sam's before you go. See you soon, CPK!

California Pizza Kitchen at Ala Moana is always packed. Literally the wait would usually be 10- 20 minutes, but when we went there was no wait. We got immediately sat. Service: good. Although our server seemed a little occupied with his other tables, he still tried to give us the best service he could. The reason why I say this is because it took 20 minutes for my strawberry cooler to get to my table. But our server did apologize so it's fines Food: I ordered my usual Kung pao noodles. It was super flavorful and had lots of green onion in it -- just the way I like it. But this time I actually didn't order any protein or nuts in my noodles. It still tasted good without any meat. Definitely recommend trying it!  Drinks: strawberry cooler took a little long to come but my hubby got the vitamin water which was free refills. Overall experience: I love CPK and the Ala Moana location probably is the best one on the island since I had a bad experience at the other locations.
