I love this place. Been coming here since middle school.  Good is always the same and you can order things that are not on the menu.  My favorite is bbq chicken salad & tomato pesto pasta.  It can get super busy so call ahead or you'll have to wait forever :|
Fish tacos amazing, berry sangria amazing, view amazing, service amazing ....need I say more.

Watch out!  Told waiter about the $10 off $40 promo.  No problem.  Ordered, ate, then comes the bill.  It does NOT show the $10 off.  Asked the waiter for a new bill with the $10 off.  His answer:  Oh, I do that later, after you pay.  Does this make any sense?  No.  I told him bring a new bill with the $10 off.  If this isn't deceptive I don't know what is.  So...I'm supposed to give him my cash or credit card, he swipes it and then gives me an updated bill with the $10 off?  Doubt it.  Management knows.  Corporate is next.   Be aware, check your bill before you pay.  Needless to say, CPK isn't high on my go to restaurants any more.

I've an old timer when it comes to CPK.  I'm not like these youngsters today with their acronyms.  Why I remember the good old days when people said the entire name of the restaurant (California Pizza Kitchen)instead of the abbreviation.  The Kahala CPK location used to be my favorite, but now I favor the Ala Moana Center restaurant because of the ocean view and parking.  I've had consistently great service at this location unlike some of the other locations although service has never been atrocious at any CPK I've been to here or on the Mainland.  My go to choice these days is the wild caught Pacific Halibut with ancient grain farro, squash and asparagus.  It feels healthy and tastes delicious.  The farro has a better mouthfeel than quinoa.  It's nutty without being chewy.  The halibut is a good size portion.  Not too fishy although I'm not bothered by seafood smells or texture.  I eat poke (marinated cubed very fresh raw fish) about once a week.   We tried their new appetizer Crispy Ahi Tuna Egg Rolls.  It has a filling of ahi tuna, avocado, nori, had rolled in a crispy won to wrapper with a tamari ginger dipping sauce.  My family liked it.  We'd order this again.  What we will definitely order again is the Butter Cake. I still think about it two days later wondering when we can go back to CPK. The butter cake is served warm with a scoop of cold vanilla ice cream.  It's a shame in today's society we use the word vanilla  to mean something bland or boring. The scoop of vanilla ice cream elevates this dish to another level. You get the warm soft cake with the sharp cold bite of the ice cream.  It's like a party in the mouth, ya'll.

Always busy and the wait is sometimes more than half an hour long.. the wait can be worth it if you're a sucker for semi-Italian bistro.. the service is great. Everyone always seems on their toes, which I great. I love an attentive server, however; I can't quite tell if it's the smell of all the cheese being cooked and processed, or if it's their carpeted floor that kinda smells. Lol.  I'm a sucker for spinach and artichoke dip. The fact that they serve it at all is what keeps me coming back, but it's really just the same as anywhere else. Other than that, all their pizzas are great. Something for everyone. A fellow yelper recommends the "wild mushroom" pizza (I believe it's called)... price point is about average, and for such a busy restaurant, it's not so annoyingly loud. Hope this helps... I know I'll be back for more... I just hope they steam the carpet by then.

12/26/2016 - Although it's the day after Christmas and Ala Moana Shopping Center is full of shoppers doing their returns or on the hunt for a good deal we came here for lunch.  We arrived at CPK's bar which had lots of seats open (only two people were sitting there) around 11 am.  Placed our order for a pizza with all the works, Cobb salad with grilled shrimp and beets and a mushroom pasta.  Shortly after we placed our order people started to fill in the rest of the seats at the bar and 10 minutes later we noticed some of them were eating but us! So the better half and I started to have a conversation about what could be the reason we didn't have our meal yet.  Could it be because we said bring everything at the same time......  Hmmm but then we saw a so much food go out that we wondered even more.  While observing the managers clearly there was something WRONG.  I saw one manager hovering the kitchen asking questions so I know we weren't the only ones.  But then "all" the people beside us had their food.  Including the three new guest who sat down where the first two guest were sitting and already left.  Mind you we sat down before all but two of them!  Talk about feeling frustrated.  I'm on a tight schedule to have lunch and get out of anywhere I am because of my work schedule.  So we carefully time things so I can get to work on time.  UGH.... What made it worst is that the pasta and pizza wasn't even hot.....  This review is just for the kitchen wait time and partially the managers.  Clearly there was something going on since I saw a third manager taking a look at the kitchen and not doing anything.  Our wait for food at a fast food chain like CPK was over 1/2 hour.  I can however say that this hasn't really happened in the past.  When we got out bill nothing was comped.  Not even my mango ice tea.  Our server knew that we waited and if the managers knew of some or many delays in the kitchen to really should be pro-active and do something about it.  Yes you are busy, but allowing your patrons to wait and "just take it" isn't a good thing.  By the time we left an hour later I was already grouchy.  The better half said that I should complain.  For me it's about ownership and recognizing your short comings to become better.   No manager was going to ANY of the tables to apologize for the longs wait times. (Ok maybe one was but none came to the bar area) By the time we left the wait times was 45 minutes to get your food.  Good luck people after us. 12/27/2016 I looked at my bank statement and CPK charged my card (same day) for someone else's meal.... $62.98 I was able to speak to the GM Frank and he was very nice and quickly credited my card.  After calming down from yesterday day I wanted to make sure that everyone knew that my unhappiness was with the kitchen and not with how the food taste.  I enjoy eating at CPK just not the longggg wait time to eat especially so when others around me was eating before us.

The food was delicious as usual and this time we had enough room for dessert. The butter cake is what the goal really is ;-). Our server was totally awesome. Very pleasant and fast with our orders and attentive to our drinks. We were hesitant about coming to this one instead of Pearlridge due to volume of people but glad we ended up here.

The food was delicious as usual and this time we had enough room for dessert. The butter cake is what the goal really is ;-). Our server was totally awesome. Very pleasant and fast with our orders and attentive to our drinks. We were hesitant about coming to this one instead of Pearlridge due to volume of people but glad we ended up here.

I'll forever LOVE ordering/coming to this place. I always take advantage of their gift card deals during the holidays because my boyfriend and I enjoy their food and customer service.  I always, no doubt, order the spinach artichoke dip WITH pita bread. If you have not tried it with pita bread, you totally should it is DELICIOUS! Also their Signature BBQ Chicken with Smoked Apple Bacon and California Club pizzas are amazing!!! I'm a little disappointed though when it comes to their Chicken Milanese because I have been going to CPK for years & I have noticed that their chicken for the Milanese came smaller. But other than that it still has the same great taste.

We called in a take-out order while heading to Ala Moana, and was told it would be ready in about 20 minutes. I was dreading going back after numerous times of getting terrible service by the take-out employee, Kimo. However, when we arrived it was a different worker! Joel addressed us quickly and got our order ready right away.  After we got home, I realized the person that took my order over the phone forgot to put in my rewards for their loyalty program. I called the restaurant and after getting transferred three times, I was finally able to talk to Joel, who apologized about the mistake, opened my check back up, and added in my rewards. (*Every $100 you spend gets you $5 off, and on occasions they give away free food, but you have to check your account or have the app to see what rewards you have, and they do have expiration dates!)  Overall review of my experiences so far with take-out: - If you have Kimo as your only worker there, RUN. You will either wait far too long to get helped, or your order will be messed up. - CPK is a large corporation but their organization and staff knowledge are mediocre - I was on hold for about 6 minutes because the workers didn't know who to transfer the call to.

Ordered via BiteSquad. Pros: + Consistently the best salads you can get (e.g cobb, chinese chicken, etc) + Good Hawaiian pizza + Tasty apps. Cons: - It's a little pricey. Note: I would not drive to the mall and wait an hour to eat there. Delivery is the best option.

This wasn't our first visit here, always a hit or miss we either like the meal, or completely disappointed. This time we had the cesar salad, bbq chicken pizza, spinach artichoke dip, and garlic shrimp fettuccine. For a drinks we had the citrus burst mixed drink. The food was all right. The mixed drink was complete garbage tasted like a lemon tasting water with alchohol and with old mint no flavor. I understood that it was really busy and the service was good at least. Just really disappointed with the food and the mix drink we ordered. Not worth the money. Honestly would rather go to home bar down the road or the lounge and get way better food. This place lacks consistency.

4 Stars only because the bread was cold and kind of tasted stale. We were on a tight schedule and our server Ally was awesome enough to help get out our orders quickly so we could keep to our schedule.  The place was packed but she did an awesome job taking care of everything.

01/16/2017  Today my girlfriends and I were a big party (6 people), so we had to wait an hour or so (at a busy time) for our table to be put together (since it requires multiple tables to make a 6 person table), but other than the wait, me and my friends' experiences were very satisfying and delightful! We appreciated the high ceilings at this location, and how they made the space more inviting. Our waiter, James, was so friendly and worked well under pressure. He was very funny and thoughtful, & knew when to give me and my girlfriends some space for conversation, and was really diligent about refilling our ice teas and lemonades (which are free refills btw!!). I've been to cpk many times before, and have had really good wait staff almost every time, but James was above and beyond awesome! ~Spinach artichoke dip was finished in less than 2 minutes, great appetizer :) ~The Pesto Cream Pene w/ mushrooms was delicious, I like that I was able to substitute the original accompanying vegetable (sun-dried tomatos), for something more to my taste. ~Poke Salad was okay if you are looking for raw, non-seasoned ahi, and salad with a light and tasty dressing, but my friend was looking for something a little more flavorful fish-wise. ~Thin Crust Pizza was awesome! I've notice that the thicker crust has less of the topping, and thin crust can get a little crispier (which is favorable amongst my friends)  ~Garlic Fettuccine Alfredo w/chicken was devoured in 5 minutes max, my friend really really liked it.  ~Kid's Curly Mac n Cheese w/edamame was great as usual :) there always seems to be a stray spaghetti noodle in it, but I feel as if it isn't complete without it. ~Butter Cake was so nice and warm, next time i'd request the scoop of ice cream be on a separate plate because, although it made nice decor, made the Cake colder, when the warmth really enhanced the flavor. A good dessert to share! ~Chocolate Soufflé was god sent. ~Salted Caramel Pudding was better than expected! Had such good combination of textures and flavors. James knew quite a bit about the menu and was an amazing waiter, if you have him, strike up a conversation! He is very cool, I kinda wished that he would just sit at the table with us :) OVERALL, we had a great time in a welcoming environment with amazing staff and delicious food! I will be at this cpk location very soon!

We love CPK! Don't forget your Dough Rewards! We got a free small plate for signing up with Dough Rewards. Winning!  We've been CPK goers for a while now. I'm addicted to the BBQ chopped chicken salad! Favorite salad by far! Spinach Artichoke dip is so creamy and delicious. Majority of the food is very good and tasty! Everything I've tried from appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pastas, pizzas, and desserts have all been very pleasing! Be prepared to spend at least $20/person.  My favorite is when we come and there's no wait. The service is always good and pretty quick! We've never had a bad experience.

We love CPK! Don't forget your Dough Rewards! We got a free small plate for signing up with Dough Rewards. Winning!  We've been CPK goers for a while now. I'm addicted to the BBQ chopped chicken salad! Favorite salad by far! Spinach Artichoke dip is so creamy and delicious. Majority of the food is very good and tasty! Everything I've tried from appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pastas, pizzas, and desserts have all been very pleasing! Be prepared to spend at least $20/person.  My favorite is when we come and there's no wait. The service is always good and pretty quick! We've never had a bad experience.
The food is good, but it seems like everyone here hates their job. Feels like an unfriendly type of ambiance. Workers should smile more, show some aloha.
The food is good, but it seems like everyone here hates their job. Feels like an unfriendly type of ambiance. Workers should smile more, show some aloha.
Ordered the shrimp scampi. Noodles a little dry. Shrimp is small. There were a lot of vegetables which included spinach. The bread was delivered warm.
Ordered the shrimp scampi. Noodles a little dry. Shrimp is small. There were a lot of vegetables which included spinach. The bread was delivered warm.

I love CPK and am a loyal long time customer. But this location is going downhill. All the long time regular servers are gone. The menu is pared down to half its former glory, and the decor is in need of a remodel. The food is always fine, and decent service, but not like it was in the old days. I love the new Ewa location, however. Great decor, fun and updated. I prefer the Ewa location and hope Ala Moana gets a redo soon.  Favorites: farmers market soup and the bbq chicken hawaiian pizza.

I love CPK and am a loyal long time customer. But this location is going downhill. All the long time regular servers are gone. The menu is pared down to half its former glory, and the decor is in need of a remodel. The food is always fine, and decent service, but not like it was in the old days. I love the new Ewa location, however. Great decor, fun and updated. I prefer the Ewa location and hope Ala Moana gets a redo soon.  Favorites: farmers market soup and the bbq chicken hawaiian pizza.

Ordered via BiteSquad. Pros: + Consistently the best salads you can get (e.g cobb, chinese chicken, etc) + Good Hawaiian pizza + Tasty apps. Cons: - It's a little pricey. Note: I would not drive to the mall and wait an hour to eat there. Delivery is the best option.

It's a real bummer I have to give CPK such a low rating, as it was one of my favorite go-to chain restaurants, but my most recent dinner here was quite unsatisfactory to say the least. Decided to go grab dinner here the evening of Halloween and was sorely disappointed... - When we first checked in, they said the wait was about 30-45 mins... no biggie, i always expect to wait whenever coming here, so we grab the buzzer thing and waited at Mai Tai's. Half an hour goes by, still no vibration from the buzzer or anything. We look over at the restaurant and there were tables available and no crowd, so we went to go check w/ the host, and they were like, oh we buzzed you and tried calling you. But my friend who had the buzzer the whole time said it never went off nor did she get a phone call. Ok, whatever... already off to a great start! Bleh, so we proceed to get seated... - Our server was nice and our dinner experience seemed promising at first, but alas that was not the case. *sigh* As our dinner progressed, he maybe checked on us once? Took him a while to finally come around to us again towards the end of our meal, at which point we just asked for the check and boxes. He then takes his sweet time to get all that. Apparently closing out all his tables and counting up his tips for the end of the night was more of a priority than tending to his remaining guests. Meh, definitely had better service in the past.  - Onward to the food! My friend's pizza came out barely even warm, like it's been sitting out for a while (I guess the pizza was ready before the rest of our entrees, so they just left it out). My friend takes one bite and was like nope, not happening -- cheese was all hard, and on top of that, they forgot the extra mushrooms my friend had asked for. We told the manager, and she brought the pie back to the kitchen. A few moments later, she brings the same pie back out (slice where my friend took a bite out of was still there!). It's like they just popped it into a microwave/toaster oven for a quick reheat. Then one of us made the mistake of ordering their ribeye (even though we all knew better than to order steak at a California PIZZA Kitchen!); requested medium to medium-well for doneness, and it came out medium-rare to medium, yummy meat to fat/gristle bits ratio was off, but the parts that I did eat were ok -- definitely not the best piece of beef (as expected), but it certainly wasn't the worst. I think the only saving grace was the ever consistent spinach artichoke dip! You know it's bad when that's the only good thing about the meal!!  All in all, it's like the B Team was on duty that night, because it was just all bad. Sadly, I've been noticing a steady decline in food quality and service over the last year or so. Not only that, but they've increased their prices! So basically you're telling me, I'm paying more to receive crappier food and service... hmmm somehow the two don't add up. I am boycotting this place for a while and suggest y'all do the same, at least until they step their game back up!

Good experience here again. Actual al dente noodles was a pleasant surprise. Overall our dinner was nice for a Sunday outing. The other half got her usual BBQ chicken salad which never fails. Parking is light if you park on the roof deck near Neiman Marcus. Our server just bumped it up to a 5 star, she was nice and took the time to box our food and was friendly the whole dinner. She also refilled Nat N. drinks before she even finished. Our server was named Jamie I believe.

Ala Moanas California Pizza Kitchen, is the number one friendliest restaurant I have had the honor of experiencing here on Oahu. The staff at this location in the biggest open air mall in the world, not only remembered my name after the first visit but treated me with respect and dignity. Me and my fiance now visit this California Pizza Kitchen at least once a week. The customer service is unparalleled to remembering your last visits favorite meals and deserts, to really caring about what's going on in your personal life. It's amazing to feel at home and treated special in a super busy/packed restaurant. The ladies that make our experience beautiful over and over are  the beautiful manager Nenette, the best hostess on Oahu Erikahanako, and as far as I'm concerned the friendliest server Devon, as well as Genevieve.

They did not have the Valentine's Day special but they gave us an appetizer w/o charge so that was nice. We did not have to wait long to be seated. Everyone in our party liked their food. Will go again.

They did not have the Valentine's Day special but they gave us an appetizer w/o charge so that was nice. We did not have to wait long to be seated. Everyone in our party liked their food. Will go again.
When they say the wait time is 35 minutes, you might wanna triple that time to get a damn seat.
When they say the wait time is 35 minutes, you might wanna triple that time to get a damn seat.

A special shout out to our amazing waiter JOEL! We were a pain in the butt waiting for people and not ordering right away, but you kept reassuring us that it's okay, and kept those waters fresh, and our bread plate was never empty! You're amazing!  The buffalo cauliflower is simple yet amazing! I was really hesitant to get this at first since I was told it's a little spicier than normal, but hands down delicious! I only picked this item because they no longer serve the Tuscan hummus!  My go to plate is always the garlic fettuccine pasta with chicken and mushrooms. It's a perfect blend of ingredients and has always come out perfectly creamy (:  It's usually a busy spot, the wait is normally about a 30 minute wait during lunch time, and of course over the weekend.
Thanks cpk for seating us right away.  We waited over an hour to be seated at lucky strike. The guy there acted like we didn't ask to eat there. Then gave us the run around.

Haven't been to CPK for a while. Met some friends for some dinner and drinks. Started off with an Agave Mojito and a cup of water. We looked over the menu a little more and decided on a lettuce wrap appetizer with chicken only. The waiter came back within 5 minutes and took our orders. U ordered the Wild Caught Seared Ahi on baby bok choy something called stir-fry roasted farro and shiitake mushroom. There was some type of demi glaze sauce which was really tasty! The dish was Topped with ginger which I should asked for without since I am to too keen on the taste of ginger. The seared ahi was cooked to perfection! Seared on the outside and raw on the inside, very tender. Tender and tasty morsels of ahi was pleasure to my mouth! The bok choy was cooked to perfection as well and the mushrooms and farro was great with the dish. The farro added more sustenance to the dish and made it very filling. I was highly pleased with my dish! As for my Agave Mojito, it was also very yummy. Wish the glass was much taller for $9.95. The seared ahi dish was pretty pricey at $24.99. Although the dish was expensive, I would order it again! I was happy with the flavor and the amount of food given on this dish!

Always love to come to this place. Our go to is salad and a pizza. We change up w the salads but always tend to get the BBQ chicken pizza w bacon. They also offer gluten free pizza. The waits are usually a little long but we always check in as soon as we get to the mall and can kill some time checking a few shops. They'll call you when your table is ready. Another great deal is you can get $100 gift card at Costco for $79.99. We've been hear countless of times and we will keep coming back!

Always love to come to this place. Our go to is salad and a pizza. We change up w the salads but always tend to get the BBQ chicken pizza w bacon. They also offer gluten free pizza. The waits are usually a little long but we always check in as soon as we get to the mall and can kill some time checking a few shops. They'll call you when your table is ready. Another great deal is you can get $100 gift card at Costco for $79.99. We've been hear countless of times and we will keep coming back!

Greeted nicely upon arrival and seated quickly.   Our waitress (Ali) was awesome.  She was friendly, attentive, and was helpful with dinner selections.  She was also on top of the timing of salad and dinner.  Drinks never sat empty.   The Cobb Salad was excellent.  Fresh veggies and a good amount of bacon.   The California Club was a nice lighter Pizza  that also had fresh ingredients.   Overall a very good dinner with excellent service.

Greeted nicely upon arrival and seated quickly.   Our waitress (Ali) was awesome.  She was friendly, attentive, and was helpful with dinner selections.  She was also on top of the timing of salad and dinner.  Drinks never sat empty.   The Cobb Salad was excellent.  Fresh veggies and a good amount of bacon.   The California Club was a nice lighter Pizza  that also had fresh ingredients.   Overall a very good dinner with excellent service.

Came here on a Sunday evening for dinner and was seated immediately. The service was quick and our waiter was always prompt to refill our waters and attend to our needs. We were seated by the window towards the back of the restaurant and it was such a beautiful view..especially since we got to watch the sunset from our table! I would definitly recommend asking for a table near the back window during sunset! Overall great service and much better food experience than CPK in Kapolei.

This review is solely based on my last experience here. So there's always a wait which is expected, but I didn't think I needed to wait an extra 15 mins after being seated for our waiter to even greet us.  Because we had so much time just sitting and waiting, when the waiter finally came around we ordered right away hoping that our food would come fast.  The one thing that has always been consistent at CPK would be the time it takes the food to come out, which is pretty fast! That's why I gave this review an extra star.  We ordered a spinach artichoke dip, a flatbread, and a Chinese chicken salad. All which tasted great per usual. But we had gotten my daughter a Mac and cheese but the noodles were kind of hard and there were very little sauce.  I'm never giving up on CPK I just hope next time the experience is better.

I eat at CPK regularly for lunch as it is near my office. The service is dependably good, the wait is never long - even at peak lunch hours - and the food is always excellent. I've also eaten several times in the Kailua CPK, which is good at lunch, but mostly disappointing during the dinner shift. It's easy to see the wait staff/management are much better at the Ala Moana location. Although, I've never been to Ala Moana at dinner time  - so I cannot directly compare. If you have not yet tried CPK - I think you should. The thin & crispy pizza is great and so are the salads and I love the sandwiches too.

Terrible hostess with an attitude! Then wait 15 min to be seated after the fact she told me to wait outside then later when I find an open seat in the waiting area and rudely replies what are you doing? I said you told us wait outside to be seated then she gives me attitude stating she wanted me to wait on the side (where the main door is meaning I will be blocking the main door). After being seated we waited another 20 min just for water! I only give 3 stars because I like the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Serve here is terrible and to the hostess do not give attitude to customers it shows disrespect toward your company you work for.

Arrived for a very early lunch at 10:45am and the place was fairly empty ... but we were still sat at a shitty table right next to the condiments and in the main walk-through.   There was alot of staff but nobody smiled at us except for our waitress. Food was cold.  Ordered crispy mac n cheese (which are deep fried balls of mac n cheese rolled in panko) and it was icy inside - blech.  Ordered plain pepperoni pizza and it too was cold.  Ordered flatbread, again cold.  We also got three sad little pieces of "complimentary" bread that was super hard and yes, super cold.

The service here is always on point! Our waiter, Matthew, was very attentive and easy to talk to. We ordered the Spinach artichoke dip, Thai crunch salad, and Kung pao spaghetti. Unfortunately, there was a mix up and we didn't get our spinach artichoke dip.. our waiter and the manager came over apologized and gave us a gift card to use for the next time we visit. I was honestly really impressed with the gesture.  Although the wait may be a little longer compared to other restaurants in the area, I would definitely choose to go here!
Michelle was a great server and the food was ready fast! Cheese and tomato pizza and macaroni bites were amazing, white corn guacamole was alright.
Michelle was a great server and the food was ready fast! Cheese and tomato pizza and macaroni bites were amazing, white corn guacamole was alright.

The service here is always on point! Our waiter, Matthew, was very attentive and easy to talk to. We ordered the Spinach artichoke dip, Thai crunch salad, and Kung pao spaghetti. Unfortunately, there was a mix up and we didn't get our spinach artichoke dip.. our waiter and the manager came over apologized and gave us a gift card to use for the next time we visit. I was honestly really impressed with the gesture.  Although the wait may be a little longer compared to other restaurants in the area, I would definitely choose to go here!

It's always packed. Always great to have a good server. When food takes awhile it does get irritating. This last time me and my bf went to celebrate our 5 yr anniversary we got our appetizers and dinner all at one time. It did take awhile but our waiter kept our drinks full. I think the best time to go is before 630. We didn't even have to wait outside we were taken to our seats while checking in.

Been coming here for a while. Service is great and food is consistent. I do feel though that some of the hostesses do seem impatient and unhappy.
Been coming here for a while. Service is great and food is consistent. I do feel though that some of the hostesses do seem impatient and unhappy.

This wasn't our first visit here, always a hit or miss we either like the meal, or completely disappointed. This time we had the cesar salad, bbq chicken pizza, spinach artichoke dip, and garlic shrimp fettuccine. For a drinks we had the citrus burst mixed drink. The food was all right. The mixed drink was complete garbage tasted like a lemon tasting water with alchohol and with old mint no flavor. I understood that it was really busy and the service was good at least. Just really disappointed with the food and the mix drink we ordered. Not worth the money. Honestly would rather go to home bar down the road or the lounge and get way better food. This place lacks consistency.

We were a pain in the butt waiting for people and not ordering right away, but you kept reassuring us that it's okay, and kept those waters fresh, and our bread plate was never empty! You're amazing!  The buffalo cauliflower is simple yet amazing! I was really hesitant to get this at first since I was told it's a little spicier than normal, but hands down delicious! I only picked this item because they no longer serve the Tuscan hummus!  My go to plate is always the garlic fettuccine pasta with chicken and mushrooms. Came here on a Sunday evening for dinner and was seated immediately. The service was quick and our waiter was always prompt to refill our waters and attend to our needs. We were seated by the window towards the back of the restaurant and it was such a beautiful view..especially since we got to watch the sunset from our table! I would definitly recommend asking for a table near the back window during sunset! Overall great service and much better food experience than CPK in Kapolei.

Food continues to be good and the staff friendly. Just make sure to get there early to avoid the long lines. Portion size for kids pasta meal is large enough to have two meals for my kids. Always a good place to get good food for the family.

I recently went here with my friends while we were out shopping at the mall. I ordered a pizza! I don't remember the exact name of it, but the steak on it was rather delicious and tender. I had plenty left over and it even tasted great afterwards. We were seated super quickly and our food came out promptly and waitress was a gem!

We were about to be seated in a dark noisy area near the waiter station and kitchen again!  Why not one of the many open tables near the beautiful view? The banh mi bowl was vegetarian-fresh and light, but don't expect it to be big or plentiful like their other salads are.  Sad face. My girl loves the shrimp zucchini fettuccine that never disappoints. The strawberry cooler drink, we are told, is not refillable although the menu says it is.  Waitress says the menu is wrong. Sad face. I left without getting CPK dough points since I wasn't reminded to provide my CPK card.  Oh I don't like that:(. Why do I always feel rushed there?

I'm usually happy with my experiences at CPK. During peak hours the wait can be a little long but this past time I went there it was for a late lunch and we didn't have to wait at all. My husband and I tried their sandwiches and were pleasantly surprised!  I got the California Club: over roasted turkey with fresh avocado and Nueske's applewood smoked bacon with a Mediterranean salad. I found this sandwich to be very tasty and the bread was soft and fluffy. It went perfectly with the salad Hubby got the over roasted turkey with brie sandwich with the super spinach and quinoa salad. (oven roasted turkey breast, warm brie, shaved granny smith apple and baby greens with house made honey mustard.  You can get theses sandwiches with either salad or soup and it's all for $14.45.  I usually get a Peach Italian soda with the cream on the side and the best part is that it's bottomless!

I come here a lot & it's mainly because I'm out with someone who wants CPK. I personally don't like this location. Every time I have come here service was not at its best. You wait forever for a refill of water & for your drink to come out. The food runner I believe her name is Kia gave me a very rude look when dropping out food off. Asked her to take plates away & she walked off with a snobby look. For sure don't plan on coming here again. Gonna tell my friends too.

It's a chain.  In a mall.  At a tourist destination.  All this together means it's super busy.  How the wait staff keeps it all moving with any semblance of order, I'll never know. On the most recent trip, we had - The buffalo cauliflower - way too little cauliflower.  Like 6 individual bites displayed like pieces of art of a long plate.  It was tasty. - Spinach artichoke dip - small but very tasty. I wanted to lick the dish clean. - Five Cheese Pizza - respectable.   - Red velvet cake with vanilla Haagen Dazs.  Perfect and huuuge.  Do NOT try to eat this by yourself. All in all, a good meal.

When the charge of the meal shows on my credit card, I found the number is a little different,  the server changed the tip amount, he changed the number 3 to 8. Because I just wrote a total amount. What a good restaurant !!! I tried to do dispute with the bank, it is way more work than you think, even though I have the receipt with me. It is just a few dollars, but if they do it to everyone?  And they know it is hard to dispute with the bank, not many people will spend time for a few dollars. I just want to let everyone be careful when you use the card to pay, I won't dine in this restaurant any more!!!

Came here recently and tried the deep fried Mac and cheese side dish and the spaghetti Bolognese. The mac and cheese tasted okay but it was a little gummy and rather cool, which makes me wonder if it is freshly made or frozen, or if it just cooled on the line before getting to our table. The Bolognese on the other hand was made decently. The pasta almost felt on the cusp of Al dente, any less and it would need to boil further. Nothing special but also nothing to complain too much about. Maybe I'd have been more of a fan of the pizzas. The star of the show here for me was definitely the desserts. The butter cake and salted caramel pudding that we tried really were well made. The cake was just the right size and sweetness with a healthy scoop of vanilla right on top and a side of whip cream. The pudding was creamy but light and also textured with the cookie crumbs right under it all. The caramel taste was light and not as strong as your favorite grocery store candy bar. Price was okay but if you're looking for pasta, I'd go elsewhere. Next time, I'd go for the soups or pizza. No complaints on the salads except they lack avocado.

Being a vegetarian, at times I find it hard to locate a restaurant that serves impeccable tasting salads. California Pizza Kitchen does exactly that.  The menu features a separate section for salads. I absolutely adore the Roasted vegetable salad! It tastes magnificent! It contains roasted corn, avocado, sun dried tomatoes, green lettuce, asparagus. You can ask the server to add chicken, shrimp or smoked salmon. I like to pair off the salad with an unsweetened ice tea.  The menu offers pizzas such as artichoke and mushroom pizza. It tastes heavenly! The chefs prepare the pizzas on thin crust. The mixture of olive oil, sauce and cheese tastes like what you expect from a 5 star restaurant.  An easy stroll to the top floor at the Ala Moana Center, go to the California Pizza Kitchen after shopping. Good for lunch, and dinner. Bring your friends, family or take your date here.   Come. You will not be disappointed.

Ala Moana location. It doesn't matter what day of the week or what time my visit to this location been.  Upon checking in, I've always had to wait at least 10-15 mins. Guess that's not bad. No wait is always better. Known for their pizza, I'm guessing, that's what I ordered tonite. I was very disappointed. The pizza was SOGGY. Therefore, it was difficult to eat as all the toppings were falling as I was trying to bite into the pizza. Awful! More so the utensil set, fork was dirty, how disgusting! Think they need to hire better dishwashers! Yea. I'm talking, this was a Monday night and I couldn't believe how busy CPK was and how much attention we were not getting from our server. I probably will not be eating the pizza again. I love their salads but I was hungry I wanted something more filling. Well, there may not be a next time.

I probably will not be eating the pizza again. I love their salads but I was hungry I wanted something more filling. Well, there may not be a next time.

Being a vegetarian, at times I find it hard to locate a restaurant that serves impeccable tasting salads. California Pizza Kitchen does exactly that.  The menu features a separate section for salads. I absolutely adore the Roasted vegetable salad! It tastes magnificent! It contains roasted corn, avocado, sun dried tomatoes, green lettuce, asparagus. You can ask the server to add chicken, shrimp or smoked salmon. I like to pair off the salad with an unsweetened ice tea.  The menu offers pizzas such as artichoke and mushroom pizza. It tastes heavenly! The chefs prepare the pizzas on thin crust. The mixture of olive oil, sauce and cheese tastes like what you expect from a 5 star restaurant.  An easy stroll to the top floor at the Ala Moana Center, go to the California Pizza Kitchen after shopping. Good for lunch, and dinner. Bring your friends, family or take your date here.   Come. You will not be disappointed.

Food continues to be good and the staff friendly. Just make sure to get there early to avoid the long lines. Portion size for kids pasta meal is large enough to have two meals for my kids. Always a good place to get good food for the family.

I recently went here with my friends while we were out shopping at the mall. I ordered a pizza! I don't remember the exact name of it, but the steak on it was rather delicious and tender. I had plenty left over and it even tasted great afterwards. We were seated super quickly and our food came out promptly and waitress was a gem!

Dine at the bar! If your party size permits it, I strongly recommend dining at the bar. Everyone knows the food is tasty and table service is good. But when you dine at the bar there just seems to be more immediate attentiveness to your needs (and I believe it was by the Managers), plus you get to watch the staff make the pizzas which is kind of cool. And best of all, as long as there's seats available, there's no wait!

Dani was a horrible server. Waited 15 minutes just for her to take our drink order. Then another 10 for our food order. Everything we ordered was cold. She wasn't friendly at all. Didn't check in on us once. When we asked for water she acted as though it was a bother to her. Waited forever for our cold food. Just absolutely rude. Worse server at CPK by far. On top of that people who say after us got their food way before us and even left before we got our food. Just disgraceful.

Been here multiple times as it is conveniently located in Ala Moana. Server Joelle was excellent; he was very personable and made our experience another good one. This time around tried the cauliflower in buffalo sauce, couple of soups (tortilla and farmers) and the Waldorf/bbq chicken salad. Cauliflower was cherreh! Gf and I were joking that if someone cooked like that for us we could definitely be vegetarian haha! Anyway, good job Joelle- he also gave us our ice teas to go
This is the full size take out Italian chopped salad. It cost $17. Totally not worth it. What a rip off!! Never again should you order an over priced salad from them.

I never really write a review but i feel like the service I got last night deserves one. I'm giving 4 stars because the waitress we had last night seemed very overwhelmed with how busy it was and was not really attentive to us and didn't give us what we had asked for TWICE. I was trying to be understanding considering how I saw that she wasn't just standing around but was helping other customers. But still I never got what I asked for. Now the actually reason I'm writing this review, a nice lady I think she was a manager but she was walking around asking how we were doing and I said we were doing "okay". But she seemed concerned with our response. Long story short she gave us a really great experience after that. Took care of all our needs. I think her name was nenette? Idk that's what it said on the pen I signed my check with.

This cpk is usually busy.   Their service is decent when they are not training.  I like their fettuccine with shrimp. It has a nice flavorful garlic sauce.  I eat it with the free bread lol.  The lighting is dim inside which is nice if your on a date and trying to hide your shirt stains or acne. My fav pizza is the Thai pizza. Tastes like bahn mi sandwich if you know what that is lol.

This cpk is usually busy.   Their service is decent when they are not training.  I like their fettuccine with shrimp. It has a nice flavorful garlic sauce.  I eat it with the free bread lol.  The lighting is dim inside which is nice if your on a date and trying to hide your shirt stains or acne. My fav pizza is the Thai pizza. Tastes like bahn mi sandwich if you know what that is lol.

4 Stars only because the bread was cold and kind of tasted stale. We were on a tight schedule and our server Ally was awesome enough to help get out our orders quickly so we could keep to our schedule.  The place was packed but she did an awesome job taking care of everything.

This review is solely based on my last experience here. So there's always a wait which is expected, but I didn't think I needed to wait an extra 15 mins after being seated for our waiter to even greet us.  Because we had so much time just sitting and waiting, when the waiter finally came around we ordered right away hoping that our food would come fast.  The one thing that has always been consistent at CPK would be the time it takes the food to come out, which is pretty fast! That's why I gave this review an extra star.  We ordered a spinach artichoke dip, a flatbread, and a Chinese chicken salad. All which tasted great per usual. But we had gotten my daughter a Mac and cheese but the noodles were kind of hard and there were very little sauce.  I'm never giving up on CPK I just hope next time the experience is better.

We were about to be seated in a dark noisy area near the waiter station and kitchen again!  Why not one of the many open tables near the beautiful view? The banh mi bowl was vegetarian-fresh and light, but don't expect it to be big or plentiful like their other salads are.  Sad face. My girl loves the shrimp zucchini fettuccine that never disappoints. The strawberry cooler drink, we are told, is not refillable although the menu says it is.  Waitress says the menu is wrong. Sad face. I left without getting CPK dough points since I wasn't reminded to provide my CPK card.  Oh I don't like that:(. Why do I always feel rushed there?

Wasn't thAt busy, well we can on a weekday so that was a given.  Our waitress was really nice, and from the time we ordered our food to receiving it was pretty quick.  Couldn't finish our food so had left overs and she offered to box our food which was really generous if her :)

Great Service and food is fresh and flavourful, I didn't wait as sat at the bar. Can't go past the BBQ chicken salad with Avocado! Cauliflower starter is yummy if your are really hungry. Great menu section and reasonable price. Good for families, couples and singles.

Went to have dinner there last night. At 7 PM the wait was disclosed as 40-45 minutes. We waited and finally got in. Service was great, but food not great. The pizza is JUST ok. The salad  consisted of limp lettuce, and a Caesar's salad dressing that was more oil than the creamy part of the dressing I'm used to at other restaurants.  It's going to take me a lot of effort to go back to CPK. For pizza I'd highly recommend Harbor Pub. Not the nicest place to eat, but the pizza is 1000% better than CPK.  Did I mention the noise level is super loud too? Yuck!!

We tried to eat at this location yesterday at 2:35pm. They were able to seat us immediately. At the time of seating I noticed that the floor surrounding our table was covered in large chip crumbs and crust pieces. I figured no big deal as it was the weekend and they were packed. The first gross out moment was when the server brought our water, he started spitting while talking and it landed all over my arms and the table in front of him. We ordered appetizers and food as my family was very hungry. When they brought the bread out and the plates, we noticed that all of the plates were dirty with crusted on food and sauce spots. We asked to see the manager. We were told he was probably in the back office, but would come out. After several minutes he arrived and apologized and said that he would make sure it was fixed. While we were waiting again I noticed that my daughter had not touched any of the bread, appetizer chips, or even her water. When I asked her about it she said she was afraid to drink it because the water looked like it had food in it. After examining the water glass more closely I found food (yellow and red colored specks) caked onto both the outside and the inside of the water glass. At this time, the same spitting server returned with a new stack of plates. The top plate was still dirty. At that point we got up and left. The spitting server protested that we should just wait because all of our orders were already put in. We were told them we were too grossed out to eat anything after seeing their lack of cleanliness. We went down the walkway to Macaroni Grill and had a suprisingly delicious and clean experience. I just returned to the island after having been away for the last two years, so it's not like I didn't know what to expect from this restaurant. I used to be a frequent weekend customer back when the lady who was the manager walked around and was always involved in checking on the customers. This current gentleman manager's complete lack of follow through and clear lip service was the fastest way to loose my business permanently. He should have been the one to bring the clean plates, and he should have been the one holding the entire kitchen, dish washing, serving, and busing staff accountable for cleanliness. I am surprised that this restaurant passed their health inspection. They most definitely do not deserve and 'A' and I would not recommend that anyone eat here. Luckily Ala Moana has many other delicious alternatives nearby.

Great place for lunch with family, friends, coworkers. Great food, nice atmosphere alll within ala moana shopping center, great area to relax and grab a bite before and after shopping.
Great place for lunch with family, friends, coworkers. Great food, nice atmosphere alll within ala moana shopping center, great area to relax and grab a bite before and after shopping.

Yesterday for lunch, I was starving and wanted a sandwich.  I didn't want to go Subway, so I decided to take a walk to mall.  Thank god I did because I opted out for a grilled veggie sandwich as take out from CPK.  It was crazy during their lunch hour, so take out was the better option.  The best part of it was that it was grilled.  I don't eat meat often, so this was a better option for me.   The sandwich was on a toasted cibatta bread.  It had mushrooms, grilled bell peppers, cheese, lettuce/spinach, and this bomb aioli.  The aioli made this sandwich even taste better.  I did have a choice of either soup or salad, but decided to get the quinoa salad because of the amount of greens.  One thing I wasn't a fan of was the dressing.  But regardless, that was yummy. Overall, the food always never disappoints, and the service was quick and fast.  Bing, bang, boom, I'm on my way to enjoy my lunch.  Mahalo CPK Ala Moana Staff.  Continue to kick butt!

Phenomenal service and incredible food! The is hands-down the best CPK I've ever been to. I've eaten here several times but I highly suggest you try dining at the bar. Rowen and Felicia are true rockstars with their service. Very friendly staff, great atmosphere and delicious food. So glad I live close!

Great Service and food is fresh and flavourful, I didn't wait as sat at the bar. Can't go past the BBQ chicken salad with Avocado! Cauliflower starter is yummy if your are really hungry. Great menu section and reasonable price. Good for families, couples and singles.

I really like California pizza kitchen. This location is where me and my fiancé had our first date 11 years ago. The pizzas are always consistent and the food tastes fresh and made with good ingredients. My fiancé always gets a pasta and the Szechuan chicken dumplings.  The restaurant can be busy but it moves fast.  Great place to grab something to eat and relax in between all the shopping

ONE STAR IS TOO KIND FOR CPK ALA MOANA! My coworkers and I (party of 6) were waiting for an hour before we got anywhere with this staff. A bigger party who arrived AFTER us was sat before us. Of course the staff apologized and gave us the run around with some policy they have. I understand it's busy but it makes no sense to seat a bigger party then move them to the table THE MANAGER told us we would sit at.  That's not all. There was a LONG STRAND OF HAIR IN MY FOOD. They apologized and gave me a "new" plate and took it off the bill. To me, that's something so basic.  Both situations totally avoidable. Hoping for better. Aloha, Mihana

Second time coming here. Four of us arrived at 6 p.m. and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. I split a pizza and quinoa Buddha bowl with my friend. The pizza was excellent gluten free. The quinoa Bowl sounded good on the menu but I did not care for it. I thought it had no flavor even with the dressing or actually the bean sprouts seem to take over the flavor of the bowl. I'm not a fan of vegetables being cut using a spiralizer such as the carrots in this bowl. It makes it hard to eat and makes you think you're getting a lot of food but you're not. The best part of the experience was the free bread that you dip in the olive oil I could eat that all day. The only other issue I thought was the menus were dirty. We shared a bottle of wine and my bill was only $22

Absolutely horrendous service it is definitely not a good thing when you as a customer have to get your own plates, refills and condiments. Instead of shooting the breeze why don't you be a team and help each other it's even worse when the kitchen. Is open and they are shooting the breeze

Did a take out tonight... I usually get the wild mushroom strozzapreti... What a big disappointment!! compare to the Kalaha store you get more for your bucks!! This is the first time I've been to the Ala Moana Store.. NEVER AGAIN! I also asked for extra bread.. nope didn't get it.:(

The quality of take out was bad!  Dine in is ok,but for take out it just terrible. The pizza was overcook and salty ,the pasta was taste less .
The quality of take out was bad!  Dine in is ok,but for take out it just terrible. The pizza was overcook and salty ,the pasta was taste less .

Haven't been to CPK in a while. We were seated fairly quickly. They took our drink order and brought us bread. We order a spinach dip that came fairly quickly. Then we ordered our lunch I ordered a 1/2 BBQ chicken salad and my daughter order a mac n cheese. Our entrees took a long while to come. When we finished eating I let the server know I would like my check and my check number for dough rewards and said there is a $10 reward I would like to apply to my check. We waited and waited he brought a paper with a summary of my dough rewards account. I asked for my check again. We waited over 30minutes to get the check. The service was so slow.

Love the food here and most of the servers are pretty good.  The hostess at the front, Brianna, has a terrible attitude. I went to check in and I told her the number of adults in my party and then I explained that I also had a stroller with an infant. She responded by rolling her eyes and say "so, how many people then..?" I really didn't appreciate the attitude. The reason I mentioned my infant and the stroller is because normally people take their kids out and the restaurant puts the stroller by the bar. Needless to say her horrible greeting made us take our business elsewhere.

California Pizza Kitchen is one of the good selections if you have friends visiting from the mainland that wants a casual Italian restaurant. As a local in Hawai'i, at the beginning, I was very fond of this restaurant, but now after going there for several times, it has become a place where I would go if I'm in mood for a casual Italian food. They provide various types of pizzas and pastas, as well as salads. Their pizzas were great, especially that they created them in a flat pizza style which is good for 2 or probably 3 people. Pastas are great; fettuccine alfredo and cheese ravioli are my favorite plates. If you are in search for a fancy Italian restaurant, then look somewhere else. If you're down for a casual Italian restaurant, then this is your place to go.

Shout out to the host Brianna and the server Joel!! Brianna was always full of positive energy and she's really easy to talk to. Very nice. :)The younger looking Joel had a perfect display of relaxed competence. This is my new CPK spot from now on!

we were greeted by the hostess brianna. she was a great multi tasker answering the phone but still attending to us. she was very friendly and got us a booth that we had requested and made our wait time go quickly with some conversation. we had the ahi rolls which are to die for and as well as the buttercake! our waitress felicia? was amazing!! best service ever! :) love this cpk with such wonderful employees like these girls

Thanks cpk for seating us right away.  We waited over an hour to be seated at lucky strike. The guy there acted like we didn't ask to eat there. Then gave us the run around.

Dani was a horrible server. Waited 15 minutes just for her to take our drink order. Then another 10 for our food order. Everything we ordered was cold. She wasn't friendly at all. Didn't check in on us once. When we asked for water she acted as though it was a bother to her. Waited forever for our cold food. Just absolutely rude. Worse server at CPK by far. On top of that people who say after us got their food way before us and even left before we got our food. Just disgraceful.

Friendly service. Thank you Jamie for your attentive and friendly service. Whether it be take out or dine in, this restaurant is great. I like that it is bigger than the Pearlridge restaurant and that the service is much friendlier.  We usually get the pizza--the works or wild mushroom. We've had the BBQ chicken but that was too sweet for us. We also like the Thai chicken salad. Something About the dressing it comes with makes the salad addicting. If you don't want appetizers just settle for the warm bread with olive oil and herbs.

Service 3/5 Taste/Quality of Food 5/5 Ambiance 4/5 Cleanliness  4/5 Overall Experience 3/5 *Comments - Ended up having to pay for an item that they forgot to include in my order. I would expect better service here.

Service 3/5 Taste/Quality of Food 5/5 Ambiance 4/5 Cleanliness  4/5 Overall Experience 3/5 *Comments - Ended up having to pay for an item that they forgot to include in my order. I would expect better service here.

Haven't been to CPK since prices went up, but decided to splurge a bit tonight and gave CPK a try. We got seated immediately and service was good! Waitress brought water and gave us time to look over the menu. Came back within a few minutes and took our drink and food orders. For drinks, me and my bf ordered the flight of sangria. Damn!! This is a must get for the indecisive ones like myself. Good thing I got the flight because they were all delicious. For food, I got what I usually get at CPK, garlic fettuccine with mushrooms and shrimp. The new pasta item on the menu, the mushroom strozzapreti looked appetizing as well but that will wait for next time. My bf got the shrimp lettuce wrap. Both dishes were really good. Overall, service and food was 5/5.

Oh oh, a drop in rating for one of our favorite chain restaurants that refuses to open up on Maui?  Don't say we have a CPK at OGG because that is NOT a CPK by a long shot. The Ala Moana location is our favorite as it has an energetic vibe compared to the others on the rock.  I unfortunately had to do takeout because the spouse was holed up in our room at the Modern due to surgery earlier in the day.  Takeout is just not the same... FOOD: Caesar Salad - $9.99 half size.  Comparing their takeout container to what's piled high on the dine-in plate was like night and day.  It was half of a half really.  While it tasted as-expected, the portion size received was like a slap in the face and one of the reasons for a drop in star rating. Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti - $16.79 + $4.50 for chicken breast strips.  We absolutely love the pasta dishes here so we were excited to try this new selection.  The strozzapreti pasta is like a long macaroni that's split down the middle.  It was more of a stir-fried pasta & mushroom dish with hardly any sauce or gravy, then topped with grilled chicken breast.  Everything seemed separated and dry, though the addition of parmesan cheese helped a bit.  Possibly the result of a takeout dish that sat too long?   The Works Pizza - $16.99.  I haven't had a CPK pizza in years so this was a welcomed item.  This hand-tossed version is loaded with mushrooms, Italian sausage, pepperoni, onions, olives and green peppers that we nixed (not my decision).  Loved it!  The crust was soft and chewy.  Pizzas always do great as takeout's. DESSERT: Butter Cake - $7.99.  After seeing mouth-watering pics and reading stellar reviews, it ended up being way to sweet for me.  Yes it was buttery but overly sugary which killed it.   SERVICE: I ordered on their website and walked to the mall as I couldn't find any delivery service, that is until I got to the restaurant and followed a fella in who was wearing a Bite Squad uniform.  Too little, too late.  I got lots of exercise that night.   My food was ready and waiting.  The gal at the takeout counter was friendly and made sure I had all the takeout bells and whistles in my big brown bag. OVERALL: We have our favorites and will stick to them.  Avoid takeout as the portion size is less than dine-in, sans for the pizzas.
Kristine our server, very smiley and on cue with our drinks and food.  Love the spinach and artichoke dip, Sicilian pizza and you can never go wrong with the thai crunch salad.

Oh oh, a drop in rating for one of our favorite chain restaurants that refuses to open up on Maui?  Don't say we have a CPK at OGG because that is NOT a CPK by a long shot. The Ala Moana location is our favorite as it has an energetic vibe compared to the others on the rock.  I unfortunately had to do takeout because the spouse was holed up in our room at the Modern due to surgery earlier in the day.  Takeout is just not the same... FOOD: Caesar Salad - $9.99 half size.  Comparing their takeout container to what's piled high on the dine-in plate was like night and day.  It was half of a half really.  While it tasted as-expected, the portion size received was like a slap in the face and one of the reasons for a drop in star rating. Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti - $16.79 + $4.50 for chicken breast strips.  We absolutely love the pasta dishes here so we were excited to try this new selection.  The strozzapreti pasta is like a long macaroni that's split down the middle.  It was more of a stir-fried pasta & mushroom dish with hardly any sauce or gravy, then topped with grilled chicken breast.  Everything seemed separated and dry, though the addition of parmesan cheese helped a bit.  Possibly the result of a takeout dish that sat too long?   The Works Pizza - $16.99.  I haven't had a CPK pizza in years so this was a welcomed item.  This hand-tossed version is loaded with mushrooms, Italian sausage, pepperoni, onions, olives and green peppers that we nixed (not my decision).  Loved it!  The crust was soft and chewy.  Pizzas always do great as takeout's. DESSERT: Butter Cake - $7.99.  After seeing mouth-watering pics and reading stellar reviews, it ended up being way to sweet for me.  Yes it was buttery but overly sugary which killed it.   SERVICE: I ordered on their website and walked to the mall as I couldn't find any delivery service, that is until I got to the restaurant and followed a fella in who was wearing a Bite Squad uniform.  Too little, too late.  I got lots of exercise that night.   My food was ready and waiting.  The gal at the takeout counter was friendly and made sure I had all the takeout bells and whistles in my big brown bag. OVERALL: We have our favorites and will stick to them.  Avoid takeout as the portion size is less than dine-in, sans for the pizzas.

Haven't been to CPK for a while. Met some friends for some dinner and drinks. Started off with an Agave Mojito and a cup of water. We looked over the menu a little more and decided on a lettuce wrap appetizer with chicken only. The waiter came back within 5 minutes and took our orders. U ordered the Wild Caught Seared Ahi on baby bok choy something called stir-fry roasted farro and shiitake mushroom. There was some type of demi glaze sauce which was really tasty! The dish was Topped with ginger which I should asked for without since I am to too keen on the taste of ginger. The seared ahi was cooked to perfection! Seared on the outside and raw on the inside, very tender. Tender and tasty morsels of ahi was pleasure to my mouth! The bok choy was cooked to perfection as well and the mushrooms and farro was great with the dish. The farro added more sustenance to the dish and made it very filling. I was highly pleased with my dish! As for my Agave Mojito, it was also very yummy. Wish the glass was much taller for $9.95. The seared ahi dish was pretty pricey at $24.99. Although the dish was expensive, I would order it again! I was happy with the flavor and the amount of food given on this dish!

I eat at CPK regularly for lunch as it is near my office. The service is dependably good, the wait is never long - even at peak lunch hours - and the food is always excellent. I've also eaten several times in the Kailua CPK, which is good at lunch, but mostly disappointing during the dinner shift. It's easy to see the wait staff/management are much better at the Ala Moana location. Although, I've never been to Ala Moana at dinner time  - so I cannot directly compare. If you have not yet tried CPK - I think you should. The thin & crispy pizza is great and so are the salads and I love the sandwiches too.

Went to have dinner there last night. At 7 PM the wait was disclosed as 40-45 minutes. We waited and finally got in. Service was great, but food not great. The pizza is JUST ok. The salad  consisted of limp lettuce, and a Caesar's salad dressing that was more oil than the creamy part of the dressing I'm used to at other restaurants.  It's going to take me a lot of effort to go back to CPK. For pizza I'd highly recommend Harbor Pub. Not the nicest place to eat, but the pizza is 1000% better than CPK.  Did I mention the noise level is super loud too? Yuck!!

The food was great as usual! The waiter let me order off the kids menu because I was craving the Mac and cheese and the spinach artichoke dip was amazing and is always a hit with everyone. The poor waiter was so busy and it seemed like he wasn't able to be around as much. Not really his fault, it's super packed on Saturday nights! The bread took forever to come out but they brought butter out for the kids which this is the only cpk I seen do this. It pretty much only got 4 stars because it was super busy and the waiter forgot things.

My honey and I love this place. Whatever you order pizza or pasta order extra sauce. The staff is fabulous.   Dave at the bar is fabulous and so is Sarah. We come here once a week at least. It's our go to place for fresh salads pizza, steak fish whatever.

Disappointed. I have a severe gluten allergy and I got very sick here even though the staff assured me I'd be safe. My husband who is not celiac, got the smallest pizza with almost no toppings for almost $20  I'm so disappointed :( nice staff but there were literally almost zero toppings on his pizza and I got sick with a Cobb salad. I used to love CPK. Not sure what happened

I used to love CPK. Not sure what happened

I love CPK for a variety of reasons: Consistently appetizing food, Decent prices for everything on their menu, Happy staff, Good atmosphere (especially at Ala Moana thanks to the Friday firework shows).  This places prime time hours is usually between 5:00 PM to 8:30 PM so avoid going because their wait times can easily reach 1 hour or more. I recommend going for their lunch hours because it's less packed.

CPK located on the 4th floor @ Ala Moana Shopping Center is always worth the wait. Home to one of the best waiters in Hawaii! Bartek always takes care of us when we come and makes us feel at home. The food is great too! Haha!

CPK located on the 4th floor @ Ala Moana Shopping Center is always worth the wait. Home to one of the best waiters in Hawaii! Bartek always takes care of us when we come and makes us feel at home. The food is great too! Haha!

Great place to eat! It's a little loud, but the food is excellent, the service is excellent, the atmosphere is great! I went there recently with some friends and they quoted us 40 minutes to wait for a table, not a big deal it was a Saturday at lunch in waikiki I totally get it. They called us over and then made a mistake and had us wait 10 minutes longer... sure you can be upset but everyone makes mistakes, the amazing thing was that they actually took care of us and gave us 2 free appetizers for our wait time. So all forgiven! My favorite pizza is pepperoni, mushroom, and Italian Sausage!

Great place to eat! It's a little loud, but the food is excellent, the service is excellent, the atmosphere is great! So all forgiven! My favorite pizza is pepperoni, mushroom, and Italian Sausage!

The restaurant was quit busy. The server was nice and the main food was delicious too but the key lime pie we ordered was just not how it represented on the menu picture. All the cream and pie was melted and it just look awful. (*see the picture.lol)

The restaurant was quit busy. The server was nice and the main food was delicious too but the key lime pie we ordered was just not how it represented on the menu picture. All the cream and pie was melted and it just look awful. (*see the picture.lol)

It's a real bummer I have to give CPK such a low rating, as it was one of my favorite go-to chain restaurants, but my most recent dinner here was quite unsatisfactory to say the least. Decided to go grab dinner here the evening of Halloween and was sorely disappointed... - When we first checked in, they said the wait was about 30-45 mins... no biggie, i always expect to wait whenever coming here, so we grab the buzzer thing and waited at Mai Tai's. Half an hour goes by, still no vibration from the buzzer or anything. We look over at the restaurant and there were tables available and no crowd, so we went to go check w/ the host, and they were like, oh we buzzed you and tried calling you. But my friend who had the buzzer the whole time said it never went off nor did she get a phone call. Ok, whatever... already off to a great start! Bleh, so we proceed to get seated... - Our server was nice and our dinner experience seemed promising at first, but alas that was not the case. *sigh* As our dinner progressed, he maybe checked on us once? Took him a while to finally come around to us again towards the end of our meal, at which point we just asked for the check and boxes. He then takes his sweet time to get all that. Apparently closing out all his tables and counting up his tips for the end of the night was more of a priority than tending to his remaining guests. Meh, definitely had better service in the past.  - Onward to the food! My friend's pizza came out barely even warm, like it's been sitting out for a while (I guess the pizza was ready before the rest of our entrees, so they just left it out). My friend takes one bite and was like nope, not happening -- cheese was all hard, and on top of that, they forgot the extra mushrooms my friend had asked for. We told the manager, and she brought the pie back to the kitchen. A few moments later, she brings the same pie back out (slice where my friend took a bite out of was still there!). It's like they just popped it into a microwave/toaster oven for a quick reheat. Then one of us made the mistake of ordering their ribeye (even though we all knew better than to order steak at a California PIZZA Kitchen!); requested medium to medium-well for doneness, and it came out medium-rare to medium, yummy meat to fat/gristle bits ratio was off, but the parts that I did eat were ok -- definitely not the best piece of beef (as expected), but it certainly wasn't the worst. I think the only saving grace was the ever consistent spinach artichoke dip! You know it's bad when that's the only good thing about the meal!!  All in all, it's like the B Team was on duty that night, because it was just all bad. Sadly, I've been noticing a steady decline in food quality and service over the last year or so. Not only that, but they've increased their prices! So basically you're telling me, I'm paying more to receive crappier food and service... hmmm somehow the two don't add up. I am boycotting this place for a while and suggest y'all do the same, at least until they step their game back up!

Terrible hostess with an attitude! Then wait 15 min to be seated after the fact she told me to wait outside then later when I find an open seat in the waiting area and rudely replies what are you doing? I said you told us wait outside to be seated then she gives me attitude stating she wanted me to wait on the side (where the main door is meaning I will be blocking the main door). After being seated we waited another 20 min just for water! I only give 3 stars because I like the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Serve here is terrible and to the hostess do not give attitude to customers it shows disrespect toward your company you work for.

Arrived for a very early lunch at 10:45am and the place was fairly empty ... but we were still sat at a shitty table right next to the condiments and in the main walk-through.   There was alot of staff but nobody smiled at us except for our waitress. Food was cold.  Ordered crispy mac n cheese (which are deep fried balls of mac n cheese rolled in panko) and it was icy inside - blech.  Ordered plain pepperoni pizza and it too was cold.  Ordered flatbread, again cold.  We also got three sad little pieces of "complimentary" bread that was super hard and yes, super cold.

When the charge of the meal shows on my credit card, I found the number is a little different,  the server changed the tip amount, he changed the number 3 to 8. Because I just wrote a total amount. What a good restaurant !!! I tried to do dispute with the bank, it is way more work than you think, even though I have the receipt with me. It is just a few dollars, but if they do it to everyone?  And they know it is hard to dispute with the bank, not many people will spend time for a few dollars. I just want to let everyone be careful when you use the card to pay, I won't dine in this restaurant any more!!!

I come here a lot & it's mainly because I'm out with someone who wants CPK. I personally don't like this location. Every time I have come here service was not at its best. You wait forever for a refill of water & for your drink to come out. The food runner I believe her name is Kia gave me a very rude look when dropping out food off. Asked her to take plates away & she walked off with a snobby look. For sure don't plan on coming here again. Gonna tell my friends too.

I'm usually happy with my experiences at CPK. During peak hours the wait can be a little long but this past time I went there it was for a late lunch and we didn't have to wait at all. My husband and I tried their sandwiches and were pleasantly surprised!  I got the California Club: over roasted turkey with fresh avocado and Nueske's applewood smoked bacon with a Mediterranean salad. I found this sandwich to be very tasty and the bread was soft and fluffy. It went perfectly with the salad Hubby got the over roasted turkey with brie sandwich with the super spinach and quinoa salad. (oven roasted turkey breast, warm brie, shaved granny smith apple and baby greens with house made honey mustard.  You can get theses sandwiches with either salad or soup and it's all for $14.45.  I usually get a Peach Italian soda with the cream on the side and the best part is that it's bottomless!

It's a chain.  In a mall.  At a tourist destination.  All this together means it's super busy.  How the wait staff keeps it all moving with any semblance of order, I'll never know. On the most recent trip, we had - The buffalo cauliflower - way too little cauliflower.  Like 6 individual bites displayed like pieces of art of a long plate.  It was tasty. - Spinach artichoke dip - small but very tasty. I wanted to lick the dish clean. - Five Cheese Pizza - respectable.   - Red velvet cake with vanilla Haagen Dazs.  Perfect and huuuge.  Do NOT try to eat this by yourself. All in all, a good meal.

Been here multiple times as it is conveniently located in Ala Moana. Server Joelle was excellent; he was very personable and made our experience another good one. This time around tried the cauliflower in buffalo sauce, couple of soups (tortilla and farmers) and the Waldorf/bbq chicken salad. Cauliflower was cherreh! Gf and I were joking that if someone cooked like that for us we could definitely be vegetarian haha! Anyway, good job Joelle- he also gave us our ice teas to go

CPK has to be one of my favorite restaurants.  However, every time I place a takeout order, usually through the company called Bite squad, I feel that I'm getting jipped, especially when ordering a salad.  Today we ordered two Waldorf Salads, which they charge about $13 for, and it seems as if they amount they provide is less than what you receive while dinning in.  I'm not a big eater and usually I'm unable to finish their salads. Today I consumed it all and was still hungry.  In my salad, there were only two slices of apples and two slices of celery with the greens (which was also small). I'd appreciate the portion sizes to be the same no matter where I'm eating, I mean the prices is the same!!  The food was still tasty though!

The thing I like about CPK is that no matter which one we go to, they're always pretty consistent food-wise. It's easy for me to judge since I always order the same thing. The shrimp zucchini plate... and it's always so good! My other half now orders it too and we've never been disappointed.  The service is usually on point, as it was this last visit as well. Our server was fast bringing out the little extras we asked for that are often forgotten. We were just tying to have a quick lunch and were able to get in and out in a good amount of time.  The store is clean, but the bathroom could have used a check-in. Other than that, our visit was great.

Big Mahalos to our server Lei at CPK Kahala. She definitely was on point. The food may of taken a little long but hey it's the busiest CPK in the nation so it was understandable. Lei made sure she didn't forget about us and kept us informed about the wait time for our food which was nice and courteous. We felt very accommodated. Thank you Lei for servers like you that give me hope people like you do exist!
