Ur guys Mac and cheese balls taste like literally horse shit. They are dry on the outside and soggy on the inside, I got ZERO cheese sauce. Talk about flavor, but there's nothing to talk about.  Im not one to complain I normally love CPK, but man stop serving ur Mac and cheese balls.

Ur guys Mac and cheese balls taste like literally horse shit. They are dry on the outside and soggy on the inside, I got ZERO cheese sauce. Talk about flavor, but there's nothing to talk about.  Im not one to complain I normally love CPK, but man stop serving ur Mac and cheese balls.

First time eating at this location in almost a year and the bartender Dave remembered me and said "welcome back its been a while!" Really touched he remembered me. Service was fantastic on his part. Great suggestions drink wis. I spiked the cucumber refresher with vodka. It was great. Want to try it with rum next time since there is mint so it can be like a pineapple cucumber mojito! Food at Cpk is so consistent and never disappoints! Need to come by more often!

First time eating at this location in almost a year and the bartender Dave remembered me and said "welcome back its been a while!" Really touched he remembered me. Service was fantastic on his part. Great suggestions drink wis. I spiked the cucumber refresher with vodka. It was great. Want to try it with rum next time since there is mint so it can be like a pineapple cucumber mojito! Food at Cpk is so consistent and never disappoints! Need to come by more often!

We ate there on Veterans Day and I had a free item from their Veterans menu. Their honoring of Veterans was much appreciated.  Despite being very crowded, service was excellent and food was delicious. We truly enjoyed our dining experience.

We ate there on Veterans Day and I had a free item from their Veterans menu. Their honoring of Veterans was much appreciated.  Despite being very crowded, service was excellent and food was delicious. We truly enjoyed our dining experience.

Good experience here again. Actual al dente noodles was a pleasant surprise. Overall our dinner was nice for a Sunday outing. The other half got her usual BBQ chicken salad which never fails. Parking is light if you park on the roof deck near Neiman Marcus. Our server just bumped it up to a 5 star, she was nice and took the time to box our food and was friendly the whole dinner. She also refilled Nat N. drinks before she even finished. Our server was named Jamie I believe.

Came here recently and tried the deep fried Mac and cheese side dish and the spaghetti Bolognese. The mac and cheese tasted okay but it was a little gummy and rather cool, which makes me wonder if it is freshly made or frozen, or if it just cooled on the line before getting to our table. The Bolognese on the other hand was made decently. The pasta almost felt on the cusp of Al dente, any less and it would need to boil further. Nothing special but also nothing to complain too much about. Maybe I'd have been more of a fan of the pizzas. The star of the show here for me was definitely the desserts. The butter cake and salted caramel pudding that we tried really were well made. The cake was just the right size and sweetness with a healthy scoop of vanilla right on top and a side of whip cream. The pudding was creamy but light and also textured with the cookie crumbs right under it all. The caramel taste was light and not as strong as your favorite grocery store candy bar. Price was okay but if you're looking for pasta, I'd go elsewhere. Next time, I'd go for the soups or pizza. No complaints on the salads except they lack avocado.
This is the full size take out Italian chopped salad. It cost $17. Totally not worth it. What a rip off!! Never again should you order an over priced salad from them.

ONE STAR IS TOO KIND FOR CPK ALA MOANA! My coworkers and I (party of 6) were waiting for an hour before we got anywhere with this staff. A bigger party who arrived AFTER us was sat before us. Of course the staff apologized and gave us the run around with some policy they have. I understand it's busy but it makes no sense to seat a bigger party then move them to the table THE MANAGER told us we would sit at.  That's not all. There was a LONG STRAND OF HAIR IN MY FOOD. They apologized and gave me a "new" plate and took it off the bill. To me, that's something so basic.  Both situations totally avoidable. Hoping for better. Aloha, Mihana

Second time coming here. Four of us arrived at 6 p.m. and only had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. I split a pizza and quinoa Buddha bowl with my friend. The pizza was excellent gluten free. The quinoa Bowl sounded good on the menu but I did not care for it. I thought it had no flavor even with the dressing or actually the bean sprouts seem to take over the flavor of the bowl. I'm not a fan of vegetables being cut using a spiralizer such as the carrots in this bowl. It makes it hard to eat and makes you think you're getting a lot of food but you're not. The best part of the experience was the free bread that you dip in the olive oil I could eat that all day. The only other issue I thought was the menus were dirty. We shared a bottle of wine and my bill was only $22

Absolutely horrendous service it is definitely not a good thing when you as a customer have to get your own plates, refills and condiments. Instead of shooting the breeze why don't you be a team and help each other it's even worse when the kitchen. Is open and they are shooting the breeze

The food was great as usual! The waiter let me order off the kids menu because I was craving the Mac and cheese and the spinach artichoke dip was amazing and is always a hit with everyone. The poor waiter was so busy and it seemed like he wasn't able to be around as much. Not really his fault, it's super packed on Saturday nights! The bread took forever to come out but they brought butter out for the kids which this is the only cpk I seen do this. It pretty much only got 4 stars because it was super busy and the waiter forgot things.

My honey and I love this place. Whatever you order pizza or pasta order extra sauce. The staff is fabulous.   Dave at the bar is fabulous and so is Sarah. We come here once a week at least. It's our go to place for fresh salads pizza, steak fish whatever.

Today I consumed it all and was still hungry.  In my salad, there were only two slices of apples and two slices of celery with the greens (which was also small). I'd appreciate the portion sizes to be the same no matter where I'm eating, I mean the prices is the same!!  The food was still tasty though!

The thing I like about CPK is that no matter which one we go to, they're always pretty consistent food-wise. It's easy for me to judge since I always order the same thing. The shrimp zucchini plate... and it's always so good! My other half now orders it too and we've never been disappointed.  The service is usually on point, as it was this last visit as well. Our server was fast bringing out the little extras we asked for that are often forgotten. We were just tying to have a quick lunch and were able to get in and out in a good amount of time.  The store is clean, but the bathroom could have used a check-in. Other than that, our visit was great.

Although the food is very consistent at cpk, it is not worth the high prices. HALF sized arugula quinoa salad with chicken for one person $18!! Yikes. Despite the prices, I truly enjoy their food and love the fact that they include the calorie count on their menu. I highly recommend take out if you're looking for a quick meal. Ordering on the phone was a breeze and the receptionist really took the time to make sure my order was accurate. The pick up at Kahala is also very organized, in an open area where the service is quick and easy. All of my food was packed so nicely in very sturdy reusable containers. They even include complementary bread and olive oil to supplement your meal. As you can see there are many things I love about cpk, however the prices definitely keep me from coming back as often as I would like.

The food is very good! Although it is better when you eat there instead of take out. I had their barbecue salad and I really enjoyed it!
The food is very good! Although it is better when you eat there instead of take out. I had their barbecue salad and I really enjoyed it!

Came for a Christmas Eve dinner. Had a large party of 9 adults, 2 children, and one infant. They gave us a table for 10. If we had a stroller, it never would've worked. Talked to the hostess, KIARA about our condition (not having enough room) and she just gave me attitude. Watched her all night and she just was not happy. Sorry, I don't really care how bad a day you're having. When you're in the front line, you need to put on your happy face. She gave us attitude again when my SIL asked her to take a group pic of us.  On to our dinner...ordered something different; Bahn Mi Bowl. Asked our server, WARREN, if it was any good. He said a lot of people like it. Not me. Thought the vegetables would have been pickled like bahn mi sandwiches. Not so. My bad, I should've asked. Also didn't care fothe dressing so I ate it plain. Server asked me at the end if I wanted to pack it up. Said no, cause I didn't care for it. He took it off my check even though I told him he didn't have to. His service throughout the evening was great. Honestly, he saved the night for me. This could've been a two-star review. Warren and the rest of the food doubled my rating. Almost everyone ordered a pizza. Everyone else enjoyed the food. I enjoyed the bread, appetizers, and wine.  Hope they talk to their hostess with the mostest attitude.

I love eating here and i always eat the same thing. My friend and I did a walk-in for her birthday around 1pm and we were seated immediately. We had a great spot next to the window and our server was great! She was very nice and we just have no complaints. We're both easygoing people, so we never fuss, even if something went wrong. Working in customer service, you just automatically treat people more respectfully. Everyone there was nice and smiled, the manager even came to our table to check on us.  The only feedback I have is: they put a ton of ice in our cups, so we had to ask her to take some out. Other than that, perfect :) One last thing, they use a tiny, quiet vacuum to clean the floor, I thought that was so considerate and cute! Haha

Ate here several times before, but this was our first time back in years. Definitely make a reservation because this restaurant seems to be busy all the time. Luckily we did and we got seated within 5mins from the actual time. We ordered the bbq chicken pizza, bbq chicken salad, pepperoni pizza, artichoke spinach dip, red velvet cake, and the brazed short rib with mac-n-cheese. The artichoke spinach dip was the best from what my wife and I remembered, but it didn't taste the same and the dip was warmish cold. The bbq chicken and salad were delicious as usual. The brazed short rib with mac-n-cheese was amaaaazing. It had a nice spiciness to it, but it was very flavorful with the right amount of heat. The pepperoni pizza tasted mediocre. We've always loved their red velvet cake with ice cream and vanilla bean sauce, aaaand we still do. Damn it was diabetes good. Overall, it was a reminder on why we don't come here often, and that's because it's expensive. My wife's salad was $25, the red velvet was like $6, my short ribs was $23, my sons mediocre pepperoni was like $16, and my other sons bbq chicken was about $16. If you eat here, it will break your wallet. We had a $50 gift card and we still ended up having to pay an additional $50. Our waiter, Pak was pretty fast and friendly. He was the one that recommended the delicious brazed short ribs. There is a lot of parking since it's connected to Ala Moana shopping mk

Ate here several times before, but this was our first time back in years. Definitely make a reservation because this restaurant seems to be busy all the time. We had a really large party when visiting CPK. I called ahead and they said that if I gave them an hour notice prior to coming in they would be able to set up our table and we would only have a short wait. I called ahead and by the time we got there we only had to wait about 10 minutes. I wasn't too happy with the table arrangement that they had for us because half our group was separate, but we couldn't ask for much on a Saturday night. The service was pretty horrible. The server was missing half the time and it took forever for our food to come out. They even forgot one of our kids meals. Usually they bring out the kids food first, but instead the kids were starving and they had to wait for our food to come out before they were able to get their food too. CPK food is always good, so there's no complaints there, but the service was just really poor. With such a large party they should have been able to accommodate us with multiple servers or something. Hopefully next time our service is better.

This is probably my favorite CPK location. The food is always good, service, and amount. It is located in ala Moana shopping center by Mai Tais and Bubba Gump. It does get crowded at this location, but while you wait there is live music for the most part ay Mai Tais. Our server was very attentive and explained the new flavored drinks with a lot of detail (I almost got one)! She greeted us and brought us bread. I feel like most of the time we have to ask for bread. The food came out fast. We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, the garlic noodles with mushrooms, and the shrimp scampi pizza (seasonal special right now). I am really enjoying the shrimp scampi Pizza this season. It has medium pieces of shrimp, no red sauce and garlic! All of the food was tasty and it was pretty big portions.

I come often to this place and whenever I come in the girl in the front never seems to be doing her job. She is always talking to her coworkers and takes a while for her to give us the buzzer. While we were waiting she wasn't doing anything but taking to a fellow coworker. The servers are amazing and do a wonderful job. There is always a wait and today to the wait was 30+min with open tables not filled.

LOCATION: Ala moana center 4th floor right next to maitais  SERVICE: the service is really good. the servers realy make sure your experience is great! i love that the most about this place :) they are always checking on us to see if our food is okay or if we need refills on our waters. even though they are super busy they STILL treat us well.  FOOD: dont get me started on the food. YUM!!!! i always get the spinach & artichoke dip for our appetizer. oh and they give complimentary bread & oil for you to enjoy while waiting :) so good! i always get their shrimp cream pasta. super yummy! you cant either get shrimp, chicken or mushrooms in your pasta. or get it all. lol its just a little extra charge though. their pizzas are super good too! i love their mushroom pizza. mmm :) as for the drinks, i found my fave! its their strawberry frozen lemonade. omg i could drink that everyday!  PRICES: the prices are affordable. the pizzas range from $10-$18 and pastas are around $13.  PARKING: plenty of free parking in the ala moana center

All CPK's are busy and consistent in taste. BUT, as I stood in line to place my name on the list (I heard from the previous guest that it was a 45 minute wait), the hostess took 4 phone calls, listing the 4 groups ahead of me on her log.  She then turned to me and said, "How many?"  I asked why she took the 4 groups before me, as I was waiting in a line to place my name on her list.  She gave me a look like, "who dafaq are you?"  Millenials...

Ate here last week with my family.  We had a large group, and the service was great.  My son has serious food allergies, and I spoke to the manager, Mr. Frank Cordova, and he took really good care of us.  I really respect a restaurant that takes food allergies seriously.  Highly recommend CPK, especially this location!  Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

Despite that this CPK is always busy, I like CPK. Today's visit we waited kind of long. Was told 20-25 minutes but waited about 45m. But I had my phone to keep me busy while waiting. What sucked was they no longer have chairs outside to sit and wait to be seated. As soon as we were seated our waiter was their quick to help us. brought our drinks and bread quick and even took our order and we weren't waiting long.
